Reviews.Title: “Filthy and rundown”
Reviews.Author: John W
Reviews.Content: Booked 2 rooms in hotel for 3 nights. When we arrived, we noticed that the rooms were not well maintained. Cracks in the wall, blood stains in inside of comforter. Bedspread was filthy. Curtains were filthy. Curtains were falling off the wall in our son's room. We decided we could not stay. We lost 1 night for each room, almost 600 euros and went to the Hilton. Well worth forfeiting 600 to not have to stay!

Reviews.Title: “We just loved this place!!!”
Reviews.Author: PanosB
Reviews.Content: Me and my girlfriend stayed at this beautiful hotel in October!! Everything was really good!!! It was very close to Eiffel tower and just 3 seconds away from a Metro station!! The room was spacious, well-equipped with very nice bathroom! Always very clean! The staff was great and always very helpful! Thank you again for this wonderful stay and we are looking forward to come back for our next Paris trip!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Weekend Break”
Reviews.Author: extrasunLeeds
Reviews.Content: The staff were very friendly and welcoming. As it was part of our honeymoon they even provided us with a bottle of champagne. The hammam (steam room) was a really nice touch. You can book in for a half hour slot which is perfect after a day on your feet! Oils and loofahs are provided. The breakfast is delicious and there is plenty of it so definitely worth booking this as it is good value for money. The room was spacious for a capital city hotel we were lucky enough to have a view of the Hotel Invalides. The shower a bit temperamental but good water pressure and a bath too! The air conditioning was very welcome as it was a hot weekend and it worked very effectively. There are lots of eateries nearby and we can recommend the creperie just down from the hotel. Things to Do The Eiffel tower is nearby as is the Hotel Invalides and the Champs Elysee. We recommend the Green Open Tour sightseeing bus. A two day ticket cost €32 per person, but there are four different routes and over 50 stops. It is a good way to see Paris! There are lots of eating places nearby, but definitely suggest you get some recommendations on places to eat prior to your visit. The hotel can make reservations for you. The Louvre is great, but a nightmare with people traffic, suggest going at lunchtime to avoid excessive queues! Eiffel Tower, if you plan to go in the evening, you need to take the lift from the ground as the booth was not open when we got to the second level so we were unable to purchase a ticket to the top!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay & Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: TravelingGin
Reviews.Content: We stayed here this past weekend and had a wonderful experience overall. We went in expecting very small rooms, however we were surprised with how large the Deluxe room actually was. It had everything we needed and plenty of space. I did not see any of the other rooms to compare it in size (based on what other reviewers had to say on this). The hotel was very clean, and the staff very friendly and helpful. They assisted us with dinner reservations, best routes to travel in the city and also kept our luggage on our last day after check out as we had a full day of sightseeing before our flight that night. The bathroom was nice, and the slippers and robes were a special touch as well as the turn down service each day. The location was perfect! Within sight of the Eiffel Tower (approx 20 min walk). The nearby restaurants were also nice. The metro is across the street from the hotel which was convenient. We were in room 11 which is on the 1st floor directly across from the metro and it did not bother us one bit. I would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky, and great for a short stay...”
Reviews.Author: groggery1
Reviews.Content: A fantastic location is what you need for a brief stay in Paris, and this hotel could not be any better situated. Everything you might want to see is in walking distance, and there is a metro across the road if your legs get tired. You will have to trade off location for size, so be in no two minds about this. Inside, the hotel is quirky and original, a far cry from bland professionalism and predictability of chain hotels, but not short of a good standard. The rooms are very small, and would try even the closest couple if you were staying longer than a couple of nights, but this should be balanced by their originality in design, and the atmosphere of the place. Did I mention the location yet? The staff were polite and helpful, the breakfast suitably consistent with the ambience, and the wifi worked unfailingly. For a short stay, I would strongly recommend, but not if you prefer corporate places.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly, but for the money needs a lick of paint and sound proofing”
Reviews.Author: Millie E
Reviews.Content: The staff were lovely and helpful. The entrance, staircase and exterior delightful. The room was smaller than expected and I was expecting small. The room décor was very tired. The opulent image portrayed on the website is a little over the top as is the price for the room given it really does need sprucing up. Location was excellent for hopping onto the metro. The station was literally across a small road, but you could hear the rumblings of the train from our bedroom. The area is lovely and within walking distance to the Eiffel Tower etc, however, I'm not sure I'd agree the hotel was in the most central location for connecting metro stations or walking if you are a tourist wanting to see as much as you can over 3 days as we were. I don't want to sound too harsh. Overall, the stay at the hotel was enjoyable,friendly and there were some nice touches, but the hotel is pretty average for the cost and slightly disappointing through no fault other than it needs to be priced more realistically or the rooms redecorating.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, noisy metro!”
Reviews.Author: Kimberly H
Reviews.Content: If you want to be in affordable walking distance of the Eiffel Tower, Invalides and Musee d'Orsay, this is the place for you! All can be reached within 20 minutes, Invalides is literally around the corner. It's less than a minute's walk from the nearest metro station but on the bad side, this means that you will hear the metro running! All the time!! Try and book a room on the top floor, we were staying on the first floor (that's the second floor to Americans) and we could hear it quite a lot, but our friends were staying on the floor above us and said it wasn't as loud for them. Each room is different so I can only comment on our room and our friends' room. We stayed in room 15, a superior double room, which was quite spacious with a nice bathroom and shower. But our friends stayed in a standard room (room 26) and had a bigger bathroom with a bath!! Which didn't really make sense, but I guess they do what they can with the space for each room. They didn't have a mini bar and their room was also much smaller than ours. The view from our window was non-existent, we were facing another building but if you stay at the front of the hotel I'm guessing the view would be fine. The reception staff were always friendly and helpful, and the hotel has free wifi and a laptop and printer to use (very useful when you forget to print important documents like I did!) and we tried the hammam - which is very small but nice to relax. It is in the exercise room which is hilariously small but I'm guessing no one goes to Paris to exercise anyway as so much walking is done! We all received nice white robes and slippers, as well as fresh towels every day and the beds were turned down each night which were lovely touches. However we were rather jealous of our friends who received a small bottle of champagne and macaroons on arrival but we didn't - why not?! Breakfast I can't comment on as we didn't bother - with all the patisseries around serving pastries and coffees, it's not worth paying 16 euros each for breakfast at the hotel. All in all, I'd recommend this hotel for the service and location as long as you don't expect nice views and take some earplugs with you if the metro noise will bother you.

Reviews.Title: “Quirky Hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: ukmavrik
Reviews.Content: We had a good time in this hotel, but we were expecting boutique rather than a large, clinical, chain hotel. I couldn't call it luxurious, but it is interesting, comfortable and you are well looked after - ideal for a short stay. We'd booked a superior room, which was a reasonable size, though not much wardrobe space, and decorated in style - a touch Versailles, perhaps, and certainly unlike any boring chain hotel room. The bed was comfortable and we had no problems with noise, either internal or external (we were on the second floor) - maybe an advantage of travelling in February. The bathroom is undoubtedly small - a shower only with no bath. But everything was clean and functioning, so no problem for us. Breakfast looked lovely, but it is quite expensive so we went out to the nearby cafes. The location is terrific - the area feels safe and friendly to walk around at any time and there are many cafes, restaurants and shops close by. You can stroll to the Eiffel Tower in 20 mins, Invalides and the Rodin museum are closer and the metro is directly across the street from the front door. Finally, the staff are really helpful and friendly and we received a complimentary half bottle of Champagne on Valentines day - how nice is that?

Reviews.Title: “Great value with friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: druidstone
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the end of a week's trip to France in order to take in Paris. The hotel is in a good location for all of the main sights of Paris, with the Eiffel Tower only 10 minutes walk away. We had a superior room and, although not large, it was perfectly adequate for just a couple of nights even if the bathroom was a bit of a squeeze. The staff are very helpful and friendly. We arrived early evening and I needed to pick up some emails on my laptop so tried to connect to the free wifi but couldn't. I went down to reception after a few tries and found another guest with his laptop and the same problem. The receptionist was very helpful and after a few restarts of the router everything started working and worked fine for the rest of our stay. We didn't try the breakfast as there are plenty of cafes and restaurants within a few minutes walk and prefer to use those in order to get the atmosphere. I would certainly recommend Hotel de Latour Maubourg for a short stay in Paris if you are looking for a central location and value for money (we paid 170 euros per night).

Reviews.Title: “Not my coup de coeur...”
Reviews.Author: Justicia_Croft
Reviews.Content: Hotel de Charme seems appropriated at the first look. It’s a charming little hotel with a lovely tiny lobby once you have passed the romantic blooming entrance. And for a Parisian hotel the staff is quite lovely too. But the fairytale stops there.... When awarded a room, you have to squeeze in their shabby tiny elevator and/or climb noisy wooden stairs to squeeze into your shoebox room. The decoration is tappe à l’oeuil (canopy, vivid colours…) but the underneath is not really clean and worn out. Beddings are horrible old and saggy. The bathroom is poorly renovated and mine was dirty with only one cheap little piece of soap. Impossible to get into the room without dragging your bags behind you or shoving them first in. Furthermore I really don’t imagine how a person sized 14plus will made it through the tiny corridor leading to the bed (No offence, I’m a tall 12-14 and I had already my trouble). Don’t bring more than you negligee as their “wardrobe” is a small alcove. And don’t go shopping, there’s no room for extra bags. Well then there’s what makes about 60 % of your room: your tiny bed. Mine stood one side against the wall, leaving you as little as approx. 60 cm to the other side. The nightstand is a tablet fixed on the wall above your bed, watch your head! Once you’re installed in your un-cozy bed, you’ll have the pleasure the hear something rumble every 10 minutes or so… I must be the tube ore something, but in any case it’s annoying. And in the morning you’ll go the lovely yet tiny and oppressing cellar (all stone like a wine cellar) to take your tasty breakfast, but: as everything is so small you won’t have much choice at all. At least they have chouquettes, the tiny French pastry ball :) So if you're petite or a dwarf... go for it. I mean I have seen worse especially in Paris. But for the rate they charge you'll find someting better, definitely! This small hotel is conveniently located near ESMA (5 minutes walk) but I would recommend you to chose another stay! We got the preferential rate (160 EUR!) and it’s not worth it, and my office refrains from booking this hotel anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Great weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: Ciaran_K
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the hotel over the weekend and had a great time. Location - great location, right beside the metro (though you could feel it slightly in our ground floor room), and beside Les Invalidades and a short walk from the Eiffel tour - so very handy. And the location beside the metro meant it took just over 25 minutes to get there from the Eurostar arriving into Gare du Nord. Hotel - room was very nice, nothing like the plain white of a business style hotel so a nice difference to the hotels I would normally stay in. There was also a steam room that the staff were very helpful about turning on for us with 30 minutes notice and supplying all sorts of oils and scents - great after a long day walking around the city. Staff - very helpful about everything to do with the hotel, very friendly and always had our key ready as we walked in the door (nice benefit of a small hotel!). Only downside was the price - as mentioned before here it is not a cheap hotel but we got a special offer so it was cheaper than their normal price so slightly better value for money. I will be recommending it to friend visiting Paris in the coming years though, great place to stay and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and a warm atmosphere!”
Reviews.Author: Liz D
Reviews.Content: Great location, close to all the amenties without being too noisy. This hotel is stylish, modern and full of character. A refreshing change compared with some of the big chains. The reception staff were particulary helpful throughout my stay and made some helpful recommendations for seeing the more unusual tourist spots in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value; excellent service!”
Reviews.Author: john636363
Reviews.Content: Have stayed here about a dozen times over the past decade. Despite changed ownership, the hotel remains a gem: the location is unbeatable, the accommodations are very comfortable, the ambiance is superb, the staff is very attentive. I do plan to return often.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kit023
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful place to stay in Paris. The staff are extremely friendly and willing to help you when needed such as recommending places to eat or transport to the airport. The rooms are spotless and great attention to detail in keeping your room feeling like home. Also, the mini bar is exceptional value. The location is really good as you can walk to all sites from here. Most things are 10 mins away and there is a stop right outside. I would recommend this hotel and I would stay there again. Its a quiet and peaceful part of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot in Paris”
Reviews.Author: LmGraham
Reviews.Content: What an excellent little place! Just as all the other reviews state, the staff was friendly, the accommodation clean, close to metro stops to take you all over Paris, close to the Eiffel Tower. The staff kept in touch with us via e-mail prior to our arrival and when we arrived there was champagne and treats in the room. Very close to some wonderful cafes. The staff was also very helpful in helping us navigate around Paris and to and from the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: Harvey O
Reviews.Content: The staff was very friendly from when we booked over the phone to e-mail follow ups, check-in, check-out and all the questions in between. The location is fantastic close to the Eiffel Tower, Musee de L'Armee etc. We were on our hoenymoon and the hotel left a bottle of champagne, two glasses a card and two macaroons in the room for our arrival - a very nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Canadians303
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights in this delightful little hotel. The staff was very helpful both prior to our arrival (via emails) and during our stay. The room was clean and small. Unfortunately during this time the air conditioner would not work but the concern from the staff was very much appreciated. The extra little touches provided by the staff (turn down service, roses, newspapers) were a treat. Location was worth the price. -Canadians

Reviews.Title: “Charming room in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Bocarob
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel in October for a couple of days while visiting Paris. We were very impressed with the charming decor of the room and bathroom. It looked like, as my wife referred to it, "Aladdin's room". I did find the room, however, quite small with very little room to move around as they even managed to place a desk in the room. I did end up using the desk so it was quite convenient. The front desk was very friendly and helpful. The location was great as it was walking distance to the Eiffel tower and Siene river and across from the metro station. I requested a room with a view to the park but unfortunately the metro station entrance was being remodeled so the construction did not provide a nice view to the park. Also, it can get a bit noisy but it was not enough to bother us at night - unless the construction workers were on duty. We were also given a room in the top floor which had awnings outside the window which partially covered the view and looked at bit worn down and old. If we ever go back, we'll request the rooms below which had a nice window with flowers. One thing I wish they did was make the bed over completely every day so we could appreciate the charming bedding during our whole stay instead of just the first day. They do not place the bed duvet and sham pillows back in the bed after they make them over - probably due to laziness as it may take longer. They also have a sauna room which you can use by appointment for free. We did not have time to use it though. All in all, I would recommend this hotel if you like charming boutique hotels, do not mind close quarters, and are looking for a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip.”
Reviews.Author: Tomas3003
Reviews.Content: On the day I stayed it was late when I eventually got to the hotel as work ran late, however, the young man on reception was very nice and helpful. He was supprised when I asked for a wake-up call at 5.30am and I was a bit afraid that it wouldn't come. I also asked for a taxi to be waitig for me at 6am. To my delight I received my call at 5.30 and after a quick shower I was down at 6 to check out, the taxi was waiting outside for me and everything went well. The room, on the third floor, was small but well equipped, the shower was excellent and the bed for me was very comfortable. The location of the hotel was excellent, but although I didn't get to sightsee it was very central to The Eiffel Tower, Invalides etc. My trip was of corse for business but I was also looking for a nice hotel where I could take my wife the next time I go which will be in November. This is the hotel I will stay at as, in my opinion, you have to feel the place where you stay and this hotel will not let you down. Regards to all the staff who hopefully I will get to meet next time. Regards, Tomas

Reviews.Title: “1st Trip to Paris and Hotel was fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: Bohlerboy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I are 25 years old and this was our 1st trip to Paris. We chose Hotel de Latour Maubourg mainly because it was in 7e (my wife wanted to stay near Eiffel) & it was near a metro station. This location is absolutely perfect for 1st timers. You are in walking distance of the Eiffel Tower, Invalides, Rue de Cler, Cafes, & the metro. The room we stayed in (33) was pretty small, but from the reviews we have read, most European hotel rooms were pretty small anyways. You do have your own A/C unit for your room, private bathroom, TV (even though it's all in French, haha), money safe, comfortable bed, & telephone. For local calls, you have to dial "0" then the number. The hotel's appearance & cleanliness was very good. My wife loved the entrance to the hotel because of the huge mirror where she "checked herself out" on the way in and out, haha. The elevator (lift) is very small but I think that is normal in Paris. However, it did serve its purpose though when all you do is walk all day around the city. The whole hotel has wireless internet with no password required. So if you turn your phone on "plane mode" before you leave the US, you can use your phone to communicate for free with Social Media (Facebook, Twitter, Skype, etc.) The hotel's staff was very kind and spoke english very well. They are very helpful when trying to get to a specific location in Paris. I found this kind of weird though... you have to leave your room key with the person at the desk when you go out, then ask for it back when you return. That might be with every hotel in Paris though. I would recommend stacking up on water, cokes, etc at the Hotel before you go for the day. The Hotel sells bottled water and cokes for $2 euros each and the cafes and other stores are much more than that. Overall, I would HIGHLY recommend The Hotel de Latour Maubourg to anyone visiting Paris. We loved our stay for 6 nights. Feel free to ask me any questions and I will answer them as best as I can. I hope that my review helped and THANK YOU again Hotel de Latour Maubourg for making our Paris vacation very pleasant and memorable. Garrett & Chrissy

Reviews.Title: “Bittersweet Ending”
Reviews.Author: PKIBound
Reviews.Content: We had stayed in a private apartment the first week of our stay in Paris right around the corner on Blvd La Tour Maubourg and LOVED the neighborhood. After traveling outside Paris to Loire Valley and Burgundy, we needed a place to stay for one night before our return home. We booked Hotel de Latour Maubourg. We could not have been happier. We were in Room 2, which is right off the reception area. It was spacious, bright and LOVELY! We had plenty of room (aside from the apartment, the largest room we stayed in in France). The hosts at the desk were so kind and helpful. We had a luxurious night's sleep in the only air conditioned room we had in Paris and the low, sporadic and distant rumbling of the metro (literally across the street) was barely noticeable. We were treated to a half bottle of champagne and thoroughly our bittersweet last night in Paris. This hotel is pricey, but at least in Room 2, it was worth every penny! It ALMOST made leaving bearable.

Reviews.Title: “Charming yet noisy Shoebox”
Reviews.Author: ML R
Reviews.Content: First of all: the hotel is clean, the deco is lavish and the staff very friendly. A thing you won't find everywhere, especially in Paris. As to the neighbourhood: lot of embassies and offices, not a lot of shops or else - but therefore you have the Metro. On the other hand, I must say that some rooms are real shoeboxes - anybody upper than size 16 would have real trouble to squeeze through the corrridor which leads you to the tiny bedroom with as much as half a meter between wall and bed. I don't imaganie how I would have occupied this double room, if I actually were accompanied by someone. As to your good nights sleep: forget it! As soon as your neighbourgs start talking in the room next to you, you'll litterally understand every word they say. You'll perfectly hear what TV Chanel is on, you'll know what needs the'll have done in the bathroom, and you'll walke up at night when their mobile phone is vibrating on their bedstand (BTW my bedstand was "conveniently" located on the wall where one side of your bed stands against, so that you are sure to bang your head against). Also you'll feel and hear the Metro rumbling in your room (1st floor of the Hotel). But if you're happy with noise, go for it - as for me I won't anymore.

Reviews.Title: “Charm, flowers, location and beams: Paris!”
Reviews.Author: KontikiLondoner
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights on business in May 2011. Well-located.. steps away from the Metro of the same name and right by the Invalides "open square". Close to the lovely small shops for food and everything you didn't realise you wanted to buy until you see Parisian shops... and the Rue de Cler restaurants. Check in staff were helpful and friendly. Room was up some stairs to the lift. Room was amazing with massive wooden beams. Had to duck and weave around a few times but certainly added charm. Large paintings added to a certain type of old Empire Parisian charm. Heavy dark wood wardrobes gave a certain presence. The beams made working at the desk a little problematic. Bathroom was well tiled, clean and very pleasant to use Bed was overwhelmed by leather cushions! This is not a hotel for the modernist and miminalist. Every opportunity for a piece of decoration, some flowers or flower based motif. But it works, it is Paris after all. Breakfast down in the basement was fine: standard fare but well presented and comfortable. Overall a pleasant place to stay in a city not always noted for good value hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Our Paris home away from home!”
Reviews.Author: jwbanks1
Reviews.Content: A friend and I just returned from Paris and a stay at the Hotel de Latour Maubourg. The location was quiet and safe for two women traveling alone. The metro was directly across the street, restaurants surrounded us, the Rue Cler, a bustling little market was a 5 minute walk, giving us access to fresh fruit, croissants, cheese, a grocery store, and little shops. The Eiffel tower- a 12 minute walk through a lovely neighborhood, was a frequent stop on our vacation. Musee de l'Armee and Napoleon's tomb, also a short distance. The rest of Paris was as close as the Metro, and the hotel with it's clean bathrooms and piping hot water was a respite from the long days of walking museums and churches in Paris. Clean, quiet, yet close to many wonderful sights- the Hotel de Latour Maubourg receptionists were kind, patient, and very helpful- giving directions, and offering opinions of places to visit while in Paris. A computer downstairs was available for personal use, and a breakfast as well, though we chose the many streetside cafe's and bakeries to satisfy our stomachs. :) If I return, and I hope I do, I will surely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “We liked the place, and it can be even better”
Reviews.Author: Ed F
Reviews.Content: We stayed during 4 days, compliments to the staff for responsiveness, the room was cute and convenient, location probably among the best, the only disadvantage to mention was a modest breakfast with no hot meals. The hotel management can correct it swiftly, we expect this change for our next visit, which we with no hesitation can spend again in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, minor issues with hotel”
Reviews.Author: Beachbod
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is the location. It is within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower, Invalides, Arc de Triomphe etc, but also directly opposite the metro station. The hotel itself is okay. The reception area is nice and well kept, as are the other communal areas. We stayed in room three, which is directly behind reception. The room is quite small and very dark, but comfortable. The decoration was not to my taste, but I supposed everyone likes different things! You can here a slight noise from the metro, but nothing to bother us. The main noise issue was from reception. As the room is directly behing the reception desk we could here all conversations, music etc, including guests checking in at 4am which woke us up! It also concerned me that if I could here all of the reception conversations then it must be possible to here us! The hotel staff were very helpful and polite, and the room was clean. The free wifi was really good and enabled us to make skype video calls home.

Reviews.Title: “Superb, chic and friendly”
Reviews.Author: Svetlana a
Reviews.Content: Excellently situated right at the metro station with the same name! This was helpful as we could not take a taxi from Gare du Nord because of a terrible line and high prices! When you arrive you receive the warmest welcome, you are waited! The interior is beautiful, linen is superb, everything has a Parisian touch, delicious breakfast! Special thanks to Anna at reception, she is wonderful! We loved it and would return and recommend this nice place to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it.”
Reviews.Author: tempepatricia
Reviews.Content: Everyone was very professional and helpful. The location was wonderful; the room was pretty and comfortable. The breakfast was terrific in a lovely room. The elevator was a trip!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel with only minor issues”
Reviews.Author: JPF1985
Reviews.Content: Our room was small but not unreasonable (bigger are available) and there were little errors with the finish for example some of the tiles in the bathroom were not finished , the shower head did not work well and there was the odd loose screw on the wardrobe, shaving mirror etc. Apart from that those the hotel was quaint and the room designs were good. The staff were excellent and couldn't be more helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great place in great location”
Reviews.Author: ThereIWas
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here while I was on a business trip and we LOVED it. This is a great place to stay. Very convenient location across from a metro line. There was AC in our room and enough space for my wife and I to spread out in. The breakfast was overpriced, and there was not a gym really, but these were minor inconveniences. Great place overall.

Reviews.Title: “Top class service, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Jetsetter_AU
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in July on our first trip to Paris (and France). We had to book a hotel for one more night in Paris after a quick jaunt down to the Pyrenees before returning home, and we were really impressed with the hotel so we decided to stay there again. Fortunately, they had a room available at late notice. It's a beautiful small Parisian hotel and exactly what we were wanting to experience whilst visiting. The location is fantastic. It's right next door to the Invalides (and Napolean's tomb) with the St Germain and Eiffel Tower area at your doorstep. The Rodin Museum is also a 5 minute walk away. The metro stop (LaTour Maubourg) is opposite the street making it easy to take the metro from the airport or main train stations to the hotel. Within walking distance, there are excellent restaurants nearby - a nice take-away sandwhich shop on the corner, or try Rue de Cler for a good variety of food and budgets including excellent icecream from Amorino, only 5 mins walk away. Adding to its excellent location is that it's a 5 minute walk to the riverbank and about 10 minutes to view the Eiffel Tower. There are many parks in the area if you just want to laze about on a beautiful summer afternoon too. The room in general was typically small like European hotels, with not much storage or hanging space. Neverthless, it was easily manageable with two people and luggage for 5 weeks. Being literally on top of the metro, there was the occassional rumble as it went past, but nothing that kept us awake. Breakfast at the hotel was also good, but a little pricey for a continental only breakfast. However with so many patisseries nearby, we only ate there once. The hotel also offers free use of a hamman, but with so many things to do in Paris, we didn't get the opportunity to use it. WiFi service is also free throughout the hotel, and VERY good. So if you're stopping by Paris, I'd definitely recommend Latour Maubourg, no matter how long or short the stay.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable Parisian Hotel - Best deal in Paris”
Reviews.Author: RCTily
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. Great location, very nice staff, and best of all - a great price. The only reason i'm not giving them 5 stars is because there are two things that many American travelers might not like about this hotel (although they weren't an issue for my husband and I by any means). 1) the room we were in was extremely small (but adorably decorated and had a lovely window that we would open every morning that overlooked the park across the street) and 2) the bed was a bit uncomfortable after a few nights (we stayed for 5). But without a doubt I would recommend this hotel and I would absolutely stay there again. Because the hotel is so small (only 17 guest rooms I think), it almost had the feeling of a B&B which we like. I can't comment on the breakfast though, we usually got breakfast on the way to whatever touristy thing we were doing that day to save time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel & Location”
Reviews.Author: PandJ2011
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for our honeymoon. Minor mishap with the room as it didn't have a minibar or fridge as described on their website (Room 32 was the only room without this in the whole Hotel) Room was a little small, ceiling was very low (husband hit his head on the roof twice)and bed uncomfortable. We had to sit sideways on the toilet as the bathroom was tiny as well. However the staff were very understanding and helpful re minibar they stored our drinks in their own fridge and gave us a complimentary bottle of champagne for the inconvenience. Will recommend this hotel as it is close to most attractions and the metro.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel and very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: daveboulter
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Paris. We found the experience of booking with Hotel de Latour Mauborg easy and responsive. We asked for an airport pickup and that was worked in easily. Our room was lovely and gave us that "feel" we wanted from Paris. The staff were helpful everyday with restaurant tips and other advice. The location is very close to Invalides and easy reach of many other sights including the Eiffel Tower. I would recommend to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location to sightsee in Paris”
Reviews.Author: toybarn
Reviews.Content: As this was our first trip to Paris and I was traveling with one of my daughters, I was a bit nervous in booking a room as I wanted a safe, affordable, yet convenient place to stay. I relied heavily on the reviews and decided that given all of the wonderful reviews of this hotel that I wouldn't be disappointed...and I wasn't. This hotel had such a great location - we easily walked to most of the main attractions in minutes and for when we had to travel by metro the hotel staff was very helpful in helping us map out our journey. We felt very safe in this location and it was also fun to wander the nearby streets and shops. As for the hotel itself, the staff was very kind and helpful. Everyone we encountered spoke to us in English which was also very helpful. The trip was planned in a hurry and we hadn't had much time to study the language As much as we wanted to converse in French it was very helpful to have staff who could communicate with us easily. The hotel lobby was tastefully decorated and the rooms were very nice yet small. Even smaller was the "lift" - the gentleman on duty the night we arrived just smiled broadly when we showed him luggage and asked if there was an elevator!! We gleefully managed! All in all this was an excellent hotel and fit perfectly into our "Parisian" experience. We would stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: CraneandTuesday
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel and would go stay here again. There is a metro stop right outside the front door and it is within walking distance to the Eiffel Tower, the Rodin Museum and many other locations. You can hear the subway below the hotel, as one other reviewer mentioned, but it's hardly disturbing (just a low rumble for a few seconds) and something you would find in any big city with a metro system. Our room was very quiet, which was a pleasant surprise since we were in a major city. The staff was helpful and the hotel itself was very charming. This place is a great find.

Reviews.Title: “Loved, loved, loved the Hotel de Latour Maubourg!”
Reviews.Author: kellythurston
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough wonderful things about this hotel. We loved our stay in their splendid mansion. Impeccably clean, comfy beds, fabulous service, great location! Everyone who worked there went out of their way to be helpful. Close to the Metro, walking distance to nearby cafes and shops. An overall wonderful experience. This is a great little place and if I am lucky enough to get back to Paris, I wouldn't consider staying anywhere else!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: lourdeenc
Reviews.Content: Enjoyed staying at the hotel. The metro is right across the street. The location is within walking distance to many of Paris main tourist attractions. The staff was great, especially Roberta. Would say there again.

Reviews.Title: “Why would I stay again in this hotel ?”
Reviews.Author: mst1
Reviews.Content: I stayed for two nights. Location suited my purpose. However, the hotel is on top of the metro line, and the metro can be heard clearly (from 05 till 01). Staff was friendly and helpful. Rooms were not as small as could be feared. Nothing was broken in the room. Internet was free and fast. Decoration was tasteless : chandeliers with black drop beads, (dusty) feathers in the lightpiece, it looked a bit cheap and "too personal" to my taste. A witches' house. some would say. Staff respects the "do not disturb" sign partially : they will not open the door. But they will call you by phone to get you awake so they can clean the room. I did not find enough value for money here. I will stay in another hotel next time. In this price range, I have choice plenty.

Reviews.Title: “Old-style Paris boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lakeshore566
Reviews.Content: Incredible location close to Rue Cler & many fabulous restaurants. If you are a foodie, looking for a romantic getaway, this is the place for you. The hotel is very small, & a bit funky in decor...staff is extremely congenial and very helpful. Would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, clean, friendly and reasonably priced!”
Reviews.Author: Thelondonsurgeon
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel having searched on trip advisor. You never quite know what to expect - but we thought being in the top 20 was a good sign, and it did live up to its position. Perhaps I was epxecting something a little larger and grander from the photo - although this didn't matter. They were very friendly and the room was spotless. The bed was very comfortable and there were numerous small touches like a fresh rose in the room every day which made a real difference. There is FREE internet access downstairs. We didn't eat there, but had breakfast once. It was OK but overpriced at E15 per person. I'd recommend you pop round the corner to one of the cafes. Location was amazing. Within walking distance of Place de la Concord, l'Hotel des Invalides and bang opposite the Metro station. Given the reputation Paris has for overpriced and average hotels this was a really good find and we would definitely book again.

Reviews.Title: “Little gem in the centre of Paris”
Reviews.Author: lovejoy53
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had a lovely lovely stay for 3 nights at the end of March. This is a delightful hotel, extremely well located in a very pleasant residential area adjacent to the Hotel des Invalides and steps from the metro. So very easy to travel around Central Paris, both by foot and underground. And easy too, if you are travelling from Gare du Nord - only one change. Everyone at Reception was very helpful and friendly, all spoke good English and made our stay as relaxed as possible. Nothing was too much trouble. Room was very very clean - hotel in general is charmingly "quirky" which made it alot of fun and a haven to get back to after a long day seeing all the sights. Would definately recommend and hope to return later in the year.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous boutique hotel close to Eiffel Tower”
Reviews.Author: Karenmj1958
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Hotel de Latour Maubourg at a weekend for my husband's birthday. This is a beautiful hotel and we had a great time. We stayed in th junior suite which was very spacious with a fabulous bathroom, free standing bath which was very relaxing to soak in. Good Wifi connection, tea/coffee facilities in room. Was not aware of any street noise, excellent sleep. Sofia at reception booked dinner for us for both nights in advance, both Les Anges and Les Petit Bordelaise were very good. Nice continental breakfast, paid extra for omelettes on Sunday morning which were lovely. Very short bus ride to Champs Élysées. This place is the best!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Excellent Reception Staff.”
Reviews.Author: lorettawalsh
Reviews.Content: Most important question i like answered about a hotel is "Would you stay there again ?". The answer is an empatic, Yes. Rooms are in Napoleonic style. Tastefully decorated with antique furnituren and very clean. This is a hotel is for sleeping in and not for dining or breakfast. The dining area, like alot of Paris hotels they avail of basement space which is a common down side. Lovely cafes right next door and in the area to have breakfast and lunch. It's an absolutely perfect Location. You are right at the foot of Invalides Square. Napolean's tomb is right across the road from you. La tour Mauborg metro stop is right across the road as well (underground and no noise). A very short walk is up the avenue (5mins) is Invalides metro stop which which you can get a direct PER Train to Versailles for 12 euro. Would highly recommend getting the train instead of spending money on a private mini bus (78 euro). If your completely lazy you can get the tube across the road (Mauborg stop) one stop to invalides but you would be crazy to spoil the short walk along the avenue at invalides. The invalides metro stop is right at the famous Pont Alexander bridge that crosses the Seine. Eiffel tower is a short 10 minute walk. At Hotel latour Mauborg, you are literally at the foot of the major tourist attraction of Paris. L'open Tour bus (open top bus ) is right across the road from hotel and does all the paris attractions. The front desk staff were very friendly and helpfull and will go out of their way to help you. The staff and location are the real selling points of this hotel but that's not to say anything negative about the hotel itself. It over looks a lovely little park. The hotel is tastefully decorated and very clean. A small tip if you enjoy your cup of tea. If your Irish, bring your own Barry's or Lyons Tea bags. If English, Bring your own favourite Brand. The tea in France is terrible and when going back again I'll be bringing my own tea bags for a cuppa in the room or when going around the city sightseeing. I really missed having a nice cup of tea :). In a rush now so haven't time to check grammar and spell

Reviews.Title: “charming little hotel”
Reviews.Author: GLORIAGRAZZIOTIN
Reviews.Content: We had 3 days in this charming little hotel and we loved it. We had bock a room and they offered us an upgrade to the suite - a lovely room with slanted windows large bathroom with a gym inside.. And wonderful views L'Hôtel national des Invalides. It was practically in the middle of Paris with a subway station right in front of it. We walked to the river, to Eiffel, to the museums Rodin and Orsay and to a couple of nice restaurants nearby. Everything was neat and cleans with a few adorable surprises in decoration. The staff was friendly and polite... especially Sofia from the front desk, all the staff was great p and we'ld like to thank them for the hospitality.

Reviews.Title: “Very charming little hotel close to everything in Paris”
Reviews.Author: parislover73
Reviews.Content: Charming hotel, clean rooms, friendly staff who speaks excellent english, neat, quiet and personal rooms, in a word: perfect! The metrostation is just outside the front door, and there are two great and not too pricey restaurants just around the corner (Chez les anges and Bistro le 7eme). The hotel staff were very helpful. I will definitely stay there again if I come back to Paris and will recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Charming little hotel close to everything worth-seeing in Paris”
Reviews.Author: isilisil
Reviews.Content: This hotel is close to anything worthseeing in Paris... We walked to some of the museums, eiffel tower and the river... The subway station is literally right infront of the door so we could reach anywhere anytime... The rooms are clean, neat and tidy... Our room was a bit small but it's not unexpectable for a hotel in central Paris. There is an interesting cellar used as a breakfast room and many adorable surprises in decoration. Breakfast was also good, delicious pastery and fruits... There was a free wi-fi which was working perfectly 24/7... The stuff at the reception were friendly and polite... I like it when people smile before they start talking :) I fell in love with this charming little hotel and we''ll be back whenever possible...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel & Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Hist0ry101
Reviews.Content: The Hotel de Latour Maubourg is a charming hotel from which to base any visit to Paris. The Eiffel Tower is only a short walk and the Metro station is literally outside the front door - a real bonus when navigating a very snowy Paris. The staff were more than helpful with restaurant recommendations and helping us deal with cancelled dinner reservations because of the unexpected heavy snowfall. One point - our standard room was located on the ground floor behind the reception desk. Despite a double set of doors it was still quite loud. As it is a small hotel foot traffic is relatively light but the room was not as peaceful/romantic as other rooms would be. For example, my parents stayed in an upgraded room on the first floor and it was beautiful...and quiet! Just be aware and if concerned mention it at booking. Otherwise, a very enjoyable stay in a good hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Utterly charming small hotel in superb location; lovely lovely staff.”
Reviews.Author: LaurHB
Reviews.Content: This hotel is situated in the elegant 7th arrondissement, walking distance from Pont Alexandre, le tour Eiffel, Grand Palais (Monet exposition), Musee d'Orsay, Le Bon Marche and Boulevard St Germain (le shopping) and some of the best restaurants and cafes in Paris (Costes l'Esplanade on corner). That's marvellous enough but in addition this is a little gem of a hotel with wonderful wonderful staff. We had a lovely experience staying here where the attention to guests is outstanding. Roberta and the girls booked restaurants, organised taxi/transfers, even managed to get the best seats organised for us to attend a classical concert in la Salle Pleyel. I would recommend Hotel Latour Maubourg unreservedly and look forward to returning with my daughters. The rooms sur la rue look particularly inviting although the classic rooms offer fantastic value.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, reasonably priced and well staffed”
Reviews.Author: elkatcha
Reviews.Content: I definitely would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Paris. I have been to several similarly-priced hotels, but this one has more to offer. Breakfast was way above average, the service was very welcoming and makes you feel at home. some people commented on the size of the room. we had the classic room, it was very tastefully furnished and of course was not huge but definitely large enough for a leisure stay. more importantly it was very clean and well equipped. i will be returning to la tour maubourg!

Reviews.Title: “Sweet, Romantic Hotel - Perfect for our New Years Stay!”
Reviews.Author: kajnkween
Reviews.Content: My husband, who is deployed, and I were able to spend some very special time together over the holidays - one of our stops was in Paris for New Year's Ever ~ I booked Hotel de Latour-Maubourg after reading some reviews - it seemed nice, they responded quickly and professionally, but you just never know. We were absolutely delighted when we arrived at our hotel - it was PERFECT - they upgraded us to a deluxe suite at no additional charge, the staff was welcoming, helpful, gracious. The location was perfect for us - across the street literally from the metro line that went every place that we wanted to go ~ very safe area, amazing restraurant right next door. We had a little trouble parking - there isn't a garage necessarily close, but we finally lucked out and parked right across the street - it's a little bit of trouble because the meters have to be "fed" every 4 hours, but we took the metro to wherever, came home for the meter and to refresh, and were gone again! Finally on the weekend the meter is off and you can park for free. The hotel room itself was great, the bed was amazing, sweet continental breakfast which was great ~ they left us goodies and a bottle of champagne with their label on New Year's Eve - we thought that was such a sweet touch! About 5 block very easy walk to the Eiffel Tower, across the street from the Invalides where Napoleon is buried, and a very easy metro ride to anything else. I would definitely recommend this sweet little hotel if you are looking for a romantic but safe place to call home while in Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: stixster
Reviews.Content: We found this hotel ourselves through trip advisor and before we even arrived the help we were given in organising transfers etc was excellent. The attention to detail in sending our request for the colour of our rose in the room and our choice of morning papers before we arrived was a lovely touch, making us feel very welcome. Upon arrival we discovered we had been given a complimentary upgrade to the Napoleon Suite which literally took our breath away. The decor was tasteful and traditional adding to the overall age of the property. Our son at 15 months was very comfortable in his cot and had more than enough space to play and crawl around. The roll top bath was a particular enjoyment of my husband who spent much time indulging each morning. The breakfast was as you would expect and served in our rooms for our additional comfort. The porter was only too pleased to bring warm milk at 5am when our son woke and their help in navigating around Paris was much appreciated. Overall i have no complaint as all staff we encountered were very friendly and helped make our stay more pleasant than we anticipated. Our thanks particularly to Sofia who was most helpful throughout and even looked after our son briefly while we got bags sorted. We will definately return to this hotel when we stay in Paris again as the location alone is superb just a stones through from the Champs Elysee and Eiffel Tower and the view from our room of the Hotel des Invalides. Will never stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel does not have a hammam!!!”
Reviews.Author: Mariadavidmackness
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel because I wanted somewhere where we could relax as well as a base to go sightseeing from. I paid more than I usually would for a hotel because I expected leisure facilities. There was no hammam, there was a small sauna without any shower facilities so if we had used it we would have had to go through the whole hotel and passed the reception in a robe to get back to our room to have a shower. There were two pieces of cheap ineffective gym equipment which couldn't be used as they were in no more space than a cupboard. The bedroom was well fitted but really was a single room not a twin and without a proper wardrobe. As I was staying with my daughter it wasn't a problem that there were 2 small single beds pushed together (there was no room for them not to be) but I wouldn't have been happy if I were travelling with a friend. The best thing about this hotel was the staff. They were lovely and very helpful at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way”
Reviews.Author: Evicat
Reviews.Content: Can't say enough good things about this hotel. The location is amazing -- about a ten minute walk from the Eiffel tower and about a one minute walk from the metro. The room was adorable and comfortable (small, but that's to be expected), and we had the best night's sleep there. The staff was so helpful and nice. All in all, a great experience and a great value -- would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location. Friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: Gayenel
Reviews.Content: I stopped in Paris on my way home from Frankfurt on business. I wanted to get in some shopping and sightseeing. I chose this hotel based on its location and other reviews. My room was small but fine for one person. The hotel was quiet. The hotel is right near the Latour Maubourg metro stop. Nice restaurants nearby as well as local bakeries for quick meals. Nice breakfasts in the morning, but they are a bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “excellent”
Reviews.Author: jenny482
Reviews.Content: I always stay at this hotel when visiting Paris. It is centrally located, close to Les Invalides. The rooms are clean and beautifully decorated. The girls on reception speak excellent English and are very helpful. I have found it quiet and get a good night's sleep.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service, Great Location, Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: McQ069
Reviews.Content: We stayed a week and found Hotel de Latour Maubourg to be in a great location, especially with the metro literally over the road. The neighbourhood felt very safe, even at night and it was very quiet. Lots of the main attractions were within walking distance. The room size was small but adequate with plenty of storage space and thoughtful touches. The room was clean and charming. The decor was interesting, with an unusual but plesant colour combination of red, aqua green and mustard. I nicknamed it the Elephant room , due to the elephants on the curtains and the elephant table lamps. We were on the third floor in room 311, so had no problem with noise from rooms above us. (But maybe we were disturbing the people below us, sorry guys) You could faintly hear the metro but it never bothered us or stopped us from sleeping. The beds were small, just a double but we had no difficulty sleeping. The internet connection was great and there was a free comuter available to guests in the lounge area. The bathroom was tiny but had everything you needed . I would have appreciated a bit more space around the basin. The toiletries were nice and the soap was replaced daily and the other items as needed. One problem was the shower temparature kept changing. The common areas were delightful and colourful with thoughtful touches in theme with the style of the hotel, fresh roses, china and chandeliersand a few books in the lounge. They even have umbrellas available at the door for use by guests. The lift is tiny and only goes to the second floor. It only just held the two of us with no luggage. However the staff offerred to take up our bags up to our room before we even asked them. The staff were all wonderful and very helpful and obliging, they all spoke English and were very friendly. They made excellent restaurant suggestions in the local neighbourhood. We especially recommend La Florimund and Fountain de Mars. They offerred to make our bookings for trips, explained our options and gave us time to think while making their recommendations known. They even noticed that we had a broken light bulb before we did and replaced it promptly. The one thing that we would have appreciated that was not available were tea and coffee making facilities. However there was a bistro right next door. In fact we never ate breakfast in the hotel as it cost 16 euros a person. We felt that this was expensive so ate breakfast out or bought a baguette near by. There is a small supermarket around the corner also a Pizza shop if you are looking for somethng less expensive. We would recommend this hotel to our friends and will return ourselves if we go back to Paris as we found it to be so convenient and a pleasant place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel - Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: craigiehutch
Reviews.Content: Arived at the hotel 12th November for 3 nights stay. Was immediately impressed with the inside Lobby. Very Chic, bright, clean and classy. The Service at reception was very warm and friendly. We were then directed to our room, 11, which was way above expectation. As a first time visit to Paris, I have nothing to compare the hotel too, however, having stayed in many 3 star hotels, in various cities, this by far superceeded them all. I was surprised it was only a 3 star rating! The room was larger than expected, with high ceilings, chandelier, 2 French Doors opening out to a view across the Fountain and Park over the road, and Les Invalides to the left. Perfect Location - 10 Min walk to the Eiffel Tower, 2 Min to Les Invalides, and on to the most Beautiful Bridge, Pont Alexander 3rd. Over the Bridge is Les Petit Palace and the Grand Palais, Champ D'Elysee, and the Concorde Plaza(?), looking up to the Arc de Triumphe, and with the Lourve a short walk East, aprox 10 Mins. When I return to Paris, I will most certainly be staying at this Hotel again. One minor critisism, however, was there were no Tea or Coffee making facilities, or Mini Bar in the Room. Food and drink in the area was fairly highly priced, which is generally what you expect to pay, however the Latin Quarter was good for selection and cost. I have read reviews about the Metro being a problem. We were located on the first floor, and all you could hear of the Metro was a very faint rumbling. Having stayed in City centres before, this most certainly was by far the quietest. No sound of Traffic, no sirens, no drunken revellers in the street. So don't be put off by previous negative reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Not the greatest value”
Reviews.Author: DavieWavie
Reviews.Content: OK. I dont like to leave bad reviews (see my other reviews) but I have to be honest here. We booked directly with the hotels own online reservation system. Our rate was 170 Euro. The room was tiny, but honestly I have stayed in smaller. So the size wasnt unacceptable. The bed was not comfortable but again, the big comfortable bed is more of an American thing. The sheets were appalling. Practically threadbare and not so fresh smelling. The bedspread looked to have the dead skin cells of thousands of previous guests. Could have used a good shake. The room did not have a bad odor, despite looking a little down about the heels. It was quite dark in the room. I got the feeling that a very low wattage lighbulb contributed to the gloomy ambiance. The bathroom was fine - plumbing worked well, water pressure/temperature good. Towels good- Some softer than others. They gave you a packet of tiny bathroom amenities but these were not replaced after the first day. You got it once and that was it. Breakfast was not included in our 170 euro rate so we got coffee and croissants in the neighborhood - plenty of choices. The hotel is right across the street from LaTour Maubourg Metro stop. We have been to Paris many many times and the 7e is my very favorite place to stay in Paris. The hotel's location cannot be beat. The staff were very warm and accommodating. We know the area quite well so we didnt need directions or require much help. They offered help rather than wait for us to ask. The hotel is old. That is no ones fault. But it must be mentioned that the place is a little creaky. The people above us were early risers and we heard every step they took. Squeak squeak squeak. I'm not sure what can be done about that. Better insulation??? Earplugs??? I have stayed in some pretty awful places in France in my lifetime and I have never complained because I've always felt you get what you pay for. I have to say, I do not feel I got what I paid for after staying here. We stayed two nighs and honestly, I would not have wanted to stay longer. Although there were some hits and misses our room would have been entirely acceptable had it been about 100 euro, but for 170 euro, I expected better. Room #25 is not worth 170 Euro. And it looks nothing like the pictures on the hotel's website. We felt really ripped-off. Wont stay here again. Hotel du Champ de Mars is a MUCH better value but they can be rather surly there.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable, efficient and lovely at the same time...”
Reviews.Author: AnaMinconi
Reviews.Content: I have stayed for two weeks in this cozy,well located Hotel, with my 15 years old daughter in October, and I was amazed by their impeccable attention to details (including room cleaning and breakfast variety), their lovely interior decoration and their efficient staff, focused on attending all guest needs and doubts. Really a wonderful experience, I totally recommend the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: moguelmama
Reviews.Content: We had the most beautiful room at this hotel. We felt like we were staying in a palace. The staff were wonderful and extremely helpful with our stay in Paris. We plan to stay here next year when we visit Paris. You were wonderful. The Moubry's

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay anywhere else in Paris”
Reviews.Author: sutco1981
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutely perfect for us. Incredibly helpful staff, great location (beautiful park across the street with a Metro station on the other side).....stayed in the Junior Suite (room 31) with a view of the Invaledes and a bathroom big enough to have two sinks, an enourmous bath, seperate shower, and enough floor space for an exercycle (not used once during our stay!)....I cannot wait to return to this wonderful hotel! This place was recommended to us by two friends, and I will recommend to anyone I know of who is going to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent and very smart guys”
Reviews.Author: jordipiquet
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfect and the service is excellent, they help us during the strike...no claims or issues...only I must say thanks

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel with Napoleon for a neighbour”
Reviews.Author: Ant42
Reviews.Content: This is a slightly quirky hotel (see photographs) in a pleasant area of the left bank opposite Les Invalides, which is a top tourist attraction partly because it’s where Napoleon's remains were laid to rest in 1861. Perhaps that's why the blue lounge carpet of the hotel is woven with bees - Napoleon's emblem. The hotel is very close to the Latour-Maubourg metro station and we could feel the hotel shake when trains went by, though the front desk team were unable to explain this rumbling phenomenon. Still, the trains stop at night, the bed was comfortable, the bathroom perfectly good and the front desk helpful and we found it a pleasant place to stay. It's a short walk from the Rue Cler with its market (buzzing on Sunday morning), shops and restaurants and there we had a good breakfast at a cafe (€16 for two compared with €16 each at the hotel). It was an easy stroll to the Grand Palais on one occasion and to the Tour Eiffel on another - just 10 to 15 minutes away. Our bedroom #15 had a sky-blue ceiling painted with clouds and pasted with gold pictures of cherubs. The light shades on our room's glass chandelier had fur on them. It was quirky. Our room cost over €200, which at current £/€ exchange rates is a lot, but dinner for two in a decent restaurant cost more - this is Paris after all. And if you want to stay in this quiet part of Paris, Hotel Latour-Maubourg a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Kathybear5
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights in this hotel. We loved the ambiance and our room (#1) was spacious, clean, comfortable and had a great view of the little park across the street. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. The staff helped arrange a pickup for our pre-scheduled tour, provided a map and helped us with directions. The hotel is in a great location...across the street from a metro stop and within walking distance of the eiffel tower, the Rue Cler area, and many sidewalk cafes and restaurants. We will definitely stay here again when we return to Paris!

Reviews.Title: “Great PLACE TO STAY”
Reviews.Author: MARGIEHICKS
Reviews.Content: The rooms were pleasant with comfortable beds,. The staff were all lovely and welcoming, including the night staff and the kitchen staff. The outdoor drinks area could do with a makeover as it looked a bit ordinary and not all that inviting. I would highly recommend this hotel. The Monet exhibition was only a 10 minute walk away and was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Surprises are never fun”
Reviews.Author: ddd1017
Reviews.Content: We were booked for 2 nights on 9/22 only to arrive exhausted and be told we had been moved to their sister hotel (Hotel deChampagne) - we were told they emailed us. NOT TRUE. We waited about 45 min for a cab to a poor relation - their sister hotel is not at all what the quality of this hotel was supposed to be. Very Very Disappointed in their lack of communication. I had emailed them twice to confirm and never heard back from them. They say they are doing renovations so BEWARE. Its in a lovely location and we were horribly disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and very helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: mickysunshinecoast
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Hotel de Latour Maubourg for 6 days in September 2010 and found it to be the most pleasant and enjoyable during my trip to Europe. The staff make the stay all that more enjoyable. They cannot do enough for you. The rooms were always clean and each evening the blankets would be turned down with a couple of sweets on your pillow. it is situated across the road from the Metro, 2 minute walk to Invaldies, 10min walk to Eiffel Tower restaurants and local grocery store around the corner. Also in an area where you feel very safe to adventure out by yourself.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: dennydds
Reviews.Content: very friendly pretty common rooms hotel rooms small by american standards but very pleasant terrific location, walking distance to lots, metro across the street great breakfast EASY wi-fi very helpful for restaurants

Reviews.Title: “Lovely gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: rubyplum
Reviews.Content: A fabulous little hotel in the heart of a pretty and vibrant district quite near the Eiffel Tower. Within walking distance of lots of good places to eat but our room at the back was blissfully quiet. The hotel's decor is wonderfully colourful and glamorous, such a nice change from the bland beige and dark brown decor you normally get in hotels. One of the best things about the hotel was the extremely friendly service from the desk staff. They were always smiling and helpful. We would definitely go back there. My husband and I were on business in Paris but, thanks to this lovely hotel, we had a romantic time too!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel - close to Eiffel Tower and the Metro”
Reviews.Author: Holidaygirl130
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel due to its proximity to the Eiffel Tower. The room was very clean and comfortable. We had the room next to reception which had access to the garden - since I booked the room through a cheap hotel site I didn't expect the best room. The staff were nice and friendly and all spoke English when required.

Reviews.Title: “Cool Hotel, but Noise Problem”
Reviews.Author: fishskis
Reviews.Content: This is a funky hotel filled with character in a fantastic location in the 7th, near St. Germain, the Eiffel Tower, Les Invalides and the Seine. The staff (and owner?) during the day were great. I did not like the gruff night man, who was always on his cell phone with personal calls, and just seemed a little bothered in general. The rooms are generously sized with interesting and unique decoration. Some of the bathroom design choices are questionable, but that is subjective. if you are looking for a cool, funky three star hotel in a great location at a fair price, this would be a good choice. BUT.... I have a major complaint..... I am really surprised that no one has mentioned the noise/ vibration situation at the hotel. Maybe it was just in my room, but literally every three or four minutes, you feel the rumbling of trains from the metro line beneath the hotel. Not only did this disrupt my sleep (though it did subside completely from about midnight to 6 am or 7 am), but it made for a generally un-relaxing stay. I was only booked for one night, but had I been scheduled to stay longer, I would have needed to change to a non-affected room (if possible), or I would have moved from the hotel. I was also not happy with the way the hotel handled the situation. They clearly have had this complaint before, but they offered nothing in the way of compensation for a fairly unpleasant night. Not even so much as an offer of breakfast. The implied contract with a hotel has a reasonable expectation of quiet; Why should I pay over $250/ night for a room with trains rumbling beneath it, literally vibrating the walls every few minutes? It just doesn't seem quite right. Were it not for the metro noise/ vibration issue, I would recommend this hotel to someone looking for a 3-star in a great location. but given the problem, and given the unsatisfactory way in which it was handled, I definitely would not return, and I would hesitate to recommend it unless the hotel assured that the specific room would not have a noise/ vibration issue. I really wish the hotel staff, though incredibly nice and charming, had handled the situation with a little more finesse, perhaps issuing a partial credit for the room charge as a gesture of goodwill; if so, I would have left with a much more positive feeling about this charming property.

Reviews.Title: “Great French Experience”
Reviews.Author: MDubG
Reviews.Content: My last trip to Paris, 15 years ago, was not full of good memories. However, this trip could not have been better. Our stay at the Hotel de Latour Maubourg was really great! The room was amazingly clean, the staff was great, and the location is perfect. We don't speak a French, but it didn't matter, the hotel staff appeared to be fluent in English. The hotel literally sits on top of a Metro stop, Napoleon's tomb is a few hundred yards away, the Eiffel Tower is a 5-10 walk, and there is a great pedestrian street full of restaurants and markets 3 blocks away. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Clean, convenient, friendly, cute”
Reviews.Author: SheWhoTravels
Reviews.Content: We stayed here two nights and couldn't be happier with out experience. This place has been newly renovated and our room was very nice, with a big bathroom and air conditioning. The front desk people were super helpful, and the rest of the staff was very helpful too. Breakfast is served down in the stone vault in the cellar which I thought was very cool. We got there after a long day of travel and the housekeeper helped me make a cup of tea when I couldn't find a cup in the afternoon down in the breakfast room. This place is also very convenient to all of the big sights in Paris and right across the street from the metro. Now that we have found it, I will stay here again if we get back to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location for central Paris walkabouts!”
Reviews.Author: Raroj
Reviews.Content: My son and I stayed for 4 nights, after originally planning on staying 2. As my son had just had a knee operation, we were upgraded to a deluxe room so that he wouldn't have to walk up and down stairs. This was without our asking, and I was very grateful for the thoughfulness. The staff were very friendly and helpful, the room was very clean and the location is fantastic. I would highly recommend a stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Super”
Reviews.Author: BobGent
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this Hotel for 2 Nights in August. Location: Metro is only 25 meters from the Hotel so connection to major attaction through metro is easy and fast. The eiffel Tower is less than 1 km walking distance, Napoleons Tomb is around the corner. The neighborhood is quiet, clean and safe. There is a Restaurant next door and 2 other across the street. Hotel Staff was very friendly, English was no problem. 24 hour reception so there is always someone there. Breakfast was in the celler. The cellar was very nice like a middle age caste. There is also a steambath in the cellar (free of charge) and a laptop connected to the internet. The breakfast area is a bit small but again this is typical paris as most restarants have simular tiny spaces. There is a small elevator. The hotel is rated 3 stars but I would give it 4 stars. Rooms. We stayed in Room 16. Room was clean, nice carpeting, clean bathroom, big bath / shower. The bed was ok but small if you are tall, I estimate 140 x 190 cm. The room itself was not big but reading many reviews this seems to be normal for Paris. There was a minibar (nice prices 2 euro for coca cola). You could hear the low noice of the metro but this was no problem. Our rooms was on the back so no nice view but very quiet. Service Free Wifi internet, many hotels charge you for this, per day or per hour, not here The first day we arrived around 3 in our room, has a small sleep and leave around 6. When we came back our bed were made again. Same happened on the second day when we left the key at the reception around 6.pm our bed was made again. I have never seem this in my life that your room is cleaned twice per day. I would really recommend this hotel, great location, great service, good price.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, but my experience spoiled at the end.”
Reviews.Author: TermV
Reviews.Content: The Latour Maubourg is situated in a fantastic part of town within walking distance of the bulk of all the tourist spots and a stone's throw from a metro station. (The corner of Rue de Grenelle and Boulevard de la tour maubourg -- don't trust the marker on google maps, and don't go to boulevard de grenelle instead of rue de grenelle) The hotel is a pretty typical European B&B. The room and bathroom were nicely furnished, clean and comfortable, yet very small by North American standards. The room had air conditioning which is pretty uncommon for Europe and a welcome surprise. The hotel serves a nice continental breakfast buffet of cereals, fresh fruit, meats and cheeses, pastries, juice and coffee. I really enjoyed the continental breakfasts in Europe and the Latour Maubourg did not disappoint. The staff were nice, friendly people. The only problem I faced was with the airport transfer. I asked the guy at the front desk for change for a 20 euro note. He proceeded to give me 10 euros in change, which I only noticed while in the van on my way to the airport. I explained this to the driver and he said that he'd take care of it. I gave the driver the 10 euros at the end of the trip assuming the transfer company would take it up with the hotel. The hotel ended up charging my credit card for the full cost of the transfer. So basically the front desk guy ripped me off for 10 euros and the driver ripped me off for the other 10. As you can see by the rest of my review, I was really very happy with this hotel but now I can't bring myself to recommend it or return in the future. Boo!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best start...but they made up for it!”
Reviews.Author: jmzcherry
Reviews.Content: I had planned a trip away to Paris for my partners 21st birthday and had spent a long time searching on trip advisor for a nice hotel. Latour Maubourg looked perfect and fitted within our price range so we upgraded to a deluxe room for a bit of extra space. We arrived in Paris at lunch time and made our way to the hotel to check-in. Unfortunately the hotel had no recollection of our booking on their system and were fully booked. Luckily we had printed off our confirmation email (which was booked directly on the hotels website). We had also already paid for the first night and had only brought enough money with us for the second night in the hotel and spending money. This is the end of the bad news however. The lady on reception was extremely helpful and found as a suite at their sister hotel the 'Grand Hotel Dechampaigne'. They paid for us to get a taxi over to the hotel and a complimentary bottle of champagne was waiting for us in the room. They also compensated us for part of our stay, going far beyond my expectations in terms of rectifying the situation. Whilst at the time it was a little disappointing, the situation was sorted out extremely quickly and you could tell it was a rare error on their part. If this had happened at some larger chains they may not have been has helpful. From the short time we spent at Latour Mauborg we could tell it certainly would have lived up to what we had expected, the location was great, it was decorated nicely and the staff were extremely helpful. I will still be recommending the hotel to friends and family and hopefully we will visit again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: pizzamann123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at La Tour Maubourg with my wife as part of our honeymoon. We stayed in room 11, which had a lovely juliette balcony overlooking a little park, a great king-sized bed, and period furniture with fireplace (very romantic). There was also a bottle of champagne waiting for us when we first arrived! The cleaning staff was terrific, they came twice a day (once in the morning and once again in the late afternoon) and the reception staff was very friendly. The location was great, with a Metro stop just outside the hotel and a very short walk to Rue Cler (great grocery shopping for picnics) and the Eiffel Tower. I would certainly return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Boutique Hotel; Great Area”
Reviews.Author: GR8T2BAGTR
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for four days and nights. This boutique hotel is tastefully decorated, clean -- maid service impeccable. The staff was very helpful in supporting our tourist information needs. Free Wifi was speedy and available. Also it is situated in the Invalide area, which is very convenient to city highlights. There are several cafes (including one right next door) and there is a pretty park right across the street providing a lovely view. Be sure you inquire about the varying room size though. Some of the rooms are teeny, tiny....

Reviews.Title: “Hotel stay”
Reviews.Author: 186338Kelly
Reviews.Content: we had no complaints what so ever i found the staff at the hotel to be extremely pleasant, helpful and welcoming which made our stay even more enjoyable thank you so much for having us it was a pleasure to meet you all i would definately go back to this hotel if i ever came back to paris

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't get better service”
Reviews.Author: indycindy
