Reviews.Content: There were four of us traveling. Both our rooms were lovely and quiet. We were in an excellent location, near many top sites and the Metro. But the best thing was the staff. They were so helpful answering our many questions, giving us suggestions, getting us an expensive ride to the airport, etc. They just couldn't have been better.

Reviews.Title: “BEST BEST hotel in Paris.”
Reviews.Author: T0mmyIreland
Reviews.Content: Have just spent 3 wonderful nights in Hotel Latour Maubourg, celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary. Start with location first : 100 yards from Invalides (Napoleons tomb), less than 15 mins to Eiffel Tower and 20 min stroll to Alexander Bridge. And if that is not good enough the Metro is 20 SECONDS from the door. Perfect!!!!! We got a complimentary upgrade to a Superior room and it was superb. Massive bed and a large room, especially by Paris standards, and very tastefully decorated. But the best thing about this hotel is the staff. From Sarah the owner, to the front desk staff, everyone was superb. A special thanks here to Young-Ju and Roberta, for whom nothing was too much trouble. Before we arived they had emailed us suggestions for a few local restaurants, (we opted for Pasco's, less than 5 min walk away and this was excellent). Overall a wonderful stay, and when we return to Paris again( done all the museums and monuments this time, so next time just leisurely strolls thru the streets of Paris) Hotel Latour Maubourg will be where we stay. Truly a home from home. To all the staff many thanks. Tommy and Carmel Stevenson, Ireland.

Reviews.Title: “Adorable hotel near the Eiffel”
Reviews.Author: tobag0
Reviews.Content: Small adorable hotel next to Les Invalides. Latour Maubourg metro station is just few steps away and there is 10 minute walk to Eiffel tower. Area is nice and safe, and there are couple very nice cafeterias near by. Hotel is clean and every room is uniquely decorated. Breakfast wasn't included the price and cost 16 euros per person. It was a buffet, which included coffee, juice, cereals, baguettes, croissants, cheese etc. Worth of 16 euros as Paris is very expensive city overall and you could pay 15 euros for a cup of coffee and a toast in some places. Staff is very friendly and helpful. Definetely excellent choice, and if we are going to Paris again, we will stay here no doubt about that.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MelanieWord
Reviews.Content: Great location, safe area and close to the metro stop. We loved this place, rooms are not so big, but they are clean, cosy and stuff was just brilliant. They gave us some nice tips about what to do and where to eat. This is worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was so quaint and everything I felt a small Paris hotel should be”
Reviews.Author: MelissaCommack_NY
Reviews.Content: There are a small amount of rooms here and they are not large, however our room was just perfect for us. The rooms have very good air conditioning. The hotel is stationed right outside the Metro on a little street and it made traveling around the city so easy for us. The concierge are knowledgeable and friendly and they get to know their guests as it is a small hotel. We did not see other guests while we were here and we felt it was our own little retreat As many hotels, this hotel is within 15 minutes walking distance to Eiffel Tower with a small view of it depending on which way your room faces. I really recommend this hotel! Excellent free unlimited wi-fi and printing.

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Place In Paris”
Reviews.Author: MJCH
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Hotel de Latour Maubourg from the 7th to the 10th of May .It was a most wonderful visit right from the start.The reception staff were most friendly ,welcoming and helpful and were on hand at all times to give advice about good restaurants, sightseeing trips and transport. The room we stayed in was very comfortable and clean and looked out on the tree lined street below. It was just adjacent to the Eiffel Tower and the Seine and was also right beside a metro station and a stop for the open top bus tour. The breakfast was very tasty and there was free internet access. The size of the elevator was for us a source of some amusement as we are 2 rather large people. We must be careful not to gain any weight before our next trip! All in all a most perfect place. We can't wait to return. Au Revoir!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a great location”
Reviews.Author: dahoui
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is fabulous, and the subway entrance is very close to the hotel; the rooms are quite spacious and the breakfast was really nice. Service was very attentive and courteous. In short, a great hotel in a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely small boutique hotel in great central location”
Reviews.Author: Skarloc75
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel de Latour Maubourg for 3 nights and found the hotel to be excellent. The location is directly opposite the Latour Maubourg Metro Station, so access to all areas of Paris is very easy. The area around the hotel is very peaceful and right by the Invalides Avenue, so lots of greenery, which is unusual in Paris. There are some very nice restauranes and bars within 5 minutes of the hotel. We really liked the fact we were not in the main tourist areas but could get around easily. The Eiffel Tower is a 10 minute walk, but within a minute of leaving the hotel, you can get a fabulous view of the tower. Our room was compact, but had everything we needed. There was some beautiful old beams in the room which really added character and our bathroom was spacious. There wasn't anything missing that we needed. The hotel has a very small lift which was handy on arriving and leaving. The inside is quite unusual, with multiple levels. The hotel has a stunning staircase that feels very grand. The staff were very friendly, except the night receptionist, who on both nights we spoke to him, we found him to be very grumpy. Of course, France has just been knocked out the world cup, so that may have been his reason :) But apart from grumps at night, the other day receptionist were all lovely and very helpful. We would recommend this hotel if you are looking for a small privately owned hotel in a central, yet quieter part of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and location!”
Reviews.Author: KiwiDaisyJ
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ideally placed and in a lovely neighbourhood. The rooms have enough space to be comfortable, compared to the typical Parisian hotel. The breakfast was excellent, and although it is an extra cost, it compares well price-wise and means you don't have to search for breakfast elsewhere. The standout feature, though, is the service - very well trained, accommodating staff. I was very satisfied with my stay there and have already recommended it to two sets of friends planning a trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, fun decor. Wish the airconditioner had worked!”
Reviews.Author: Susan23_MD
Reviews.Content: Right across from a subway stop, a few blocks from the train station, and within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower and other major tourist sites. The female front desk clerks were all great, but the one man was brusque and not helpful. We knew that the rooms had "interesting" decor, and we thought it was fun. But we were there 3 nights and had no air conditioning as it was broken. This during a very hot time. On the first night, a Saturday, it was very noisy, as we had to leave our windows open and there was the sidewalk cafe (open quite late), the subway entrance and lots of car and foot traffic. Add to that being hot and uncomfortable, and we got very little sleep that night. The next two nights were a bit better, as they were "work nights" and the weather wasn't as nice, so fewer people were out. Still, it was not easy to sleep. The last day, there were repairmen cleaning the ducts in our room and we had to wait to get in to get showered and changed for a prepaid dinner across town. Fortunately, they hurried to finish and we had just enough time to change and get there. The breakfasts were ok. The courtyard was cute. Overall, a pretty good place to stay. A bit pricey, but Paris is generally pricey. They did give us a VERY small amount off the bill for the inconvenience of no air (after we asked), but it would have been nice had they given us that amount for each of the three nights. Although minor, it would have been a nice gesture.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: COTraveler_10
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right across the street from a subway stop and within easy walking distance of the Eiffel Tower & many other attractions. Neighborhood is quiet and safe. The staff was knowledgeable and very helpful. Our room was clean and comfortable but a little small and the decor was over the top - deep red walls and bubblegum pink sheets, but that's a matter of taste. Breakfast was ample and good.

Reviews.Title: “A Warm and Friendly Place”
Reviews.Author: jjgIV
Reviews.Content: We recently spent a week at the Hotel Latour Maubourg and could not have been happier. I had read previous comments on Trip Advisor and found the praises to be accurate and the complaints to be overblown. It is primarily the warmth and responsiveness of the staff that made our stay so pleasant. It is more like the attention you receive at a good bed and breakfast with the amenities of a hotel. My wife was actually quite sick at the beginning and we were wondering whether she would require medical attention. I was completely sure that the staff would link us efficiently and effectively with whatever care was required. From the beginning, the staff responded to e-mails promptly. By booking directly with them, we were able to reserve a Superior room at a considerable savings. The room was ready when we arrived. While the closet was a bit small due to its triangular shape, we had no problem storing all of our clothes. We enjoyed the Empire décor of the room which was what we expected from the photos on the web site. There were one or two small spots on the bathroom woodwork that needed a spot of paint subsequent to a repair, but the room was clean and in good repair. We did not experience problems with sound transmission through the walls. Since the hallway is small, one does hear people passing, but it was not problematic. The mattresses were a bit worn, but we had no problem sleeping. We are not big breakfast people, so we only ate in the hotel once. It actually seemed like a fair price to us, given the quantity and quality of food available. We did usually eat at cafes and enjoyed crepes for breakfast at the Café Latour Maubourg. The Internet availability was very helpful to me. The location is terrific and the Metro stop across the street couldn’t be better. The ticket machine could not read our credit cards due to a lack of a micro-chip. We used one to buy books of tickets at a Metro stop that had a Vente window as well as an Information window. We have traveled in Europe quite a bit. It is true that some hotels in which we stayed were more luxurious (and they also cost twice as much). But we have never stayed anywhere in which we felt more welcome. If one is looking for a traditional U.S. hotel room, one should probably choose another site. But if we return to Paris, we will choose to stay at the Hotel Latour Maubourg again.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Voidsinger
Reviews.Content: TripAdvisor hasn't fooled us yet, so this hotel's great reviews led us to book it for our 4 days visit to Paris. Location was one of the main drawing points but we didn't really expect it to be THAT good. Within a few minutes of the Eiffel Tower, les Invalides and a pleasant walk to the Musee d'Orsay, the Louvre and all the things that make Paris incredible. If it's just a bit too far, the Metro is right there! Restaurants abound in the area, including Pasco, Le Florimond and the Cafe Constant group. Wake up and walk to the Rue Cler for a le petit dejeuner before leaving to explore Paris! It would be worth it just for the spot, but this is compounded by a very pretty boutique hotel, with a cute inner courtyard that we used to unwind after our days of exploring. Service is tremendous, with emails before our stay just to set everything up: transport, restaurant/tour booking, etc. They meet you with a smile and apparently "No" or "We can't do this" is not in their vocabulary. We had a beautiful red room with plenty of space, large windows opening up to the Rue de Grenelle and a small park in front. My North American side would lament the lack of a widescreen TV (there's just a simple one there with a few channels)... but why the heck would you watch TV in Paris? Go out and enjoy it! It's not the cheapest place around, but it is definitely worth it. I will undoubtedly go back if my travels take me to Paris again. You should too!

Reviews.Title: “The perfect Parisian spot”
Reviews.Author: Miguel&Tulio
Reviews.Content: The hotel is perfectly located in the heart of Paris. It made my recent trip perfect. It is in a walking distance to many parts and the Metro in right in front of the door. My room was great quite and clean and it was LARGE. The small garden terrace downstairs with the attached lobby and Internet spot is a bonus. This hotel was a great find for me - I would highly recommend it ant time and it will be my first choice from now on. If you are a couple and still romantic, this would be a perfect spot. The rooms are Parisian and very accommodating in this respect. Thanks to Sylvia and the staff. I very much liked the place without any negative thoughts.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: gee1973
Reviews.Content: An excellent base from which to explore having previously stayed in the Marais district. With the Metro a few yards away everything is within easy reach, even Versailles which is only half an hour or so. We were very fortunate to upgrade to the beautiful Junior Suite which was an unexpected treat. The staff are very attentive and friendly and were able to assist us with any information we required. Also it was nice to be able to walk to minutes to the Eiffel Tower to watch the light show. I will recommend the hotel to friends in future, but as with Paris generally don't expect a vast room!

Reviews.Title: “Truly a gem!”
Reviews.Author: Adrianmama
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in a superior room for 6 nights and we didn't find anything wrong with the hotel except the little confusion in the shuttle service that the hotel booked for us in advance. We couldn't find the driver who was said to be holding a card bearing the hotel name at the airport. After several phone calls, we managed to find the driver but 45 minutes had passed. Of course, that driver did not hold a card and he was not even waiting in the arrival hall. So, beware if u would like the hotel to arrange for the airport shuttle. However, things went smoothly after that. The room was spacious that allowed us to open 2 suitcases at the same time. It's clean with nice decor and the fragrant or aroma in the bathroom was pleasant. The best thing in this room to us was the availability of numerous sockets. Good for our chargers and a high ampere professional use hairdryer!!! It's a plesant surprise for us as we'd burnt and melted numerous adaptors and sockets in different hotels all over the world! Breakfast, price a little steep though, was worth the price as a cup of coffee elsewhere would cost u €4-5. Service was great and staffs were helpful. The hotel was also very accomodating to our request as to cancel one night's stay in the middle of the booking (originally we had booked for 7 nights but changed our mind as we wished to visit mont saint Michel and spend a night there.) we left our lugguages with the hotel and headed to MSM with light packing. Upon our return, we managed to check in the same room again as per our request. We were quite happy with that arrangement. Great location as the metro is right in front of the hotel, and a bistro at the adjacent block. Invalides, rue de cler are nearby and tour Eiffel us within 10-15 minutes' walk. We did not have time for the hamman but did try the massage oil provided for free. Great for alleviating the sore legs! Well, the room charge of €167 (incl. Tax) per night is quite expensive but we are not sure if we could pay less to get the same quality at some other hotel. Would recommend it if not travelling on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: bannergirl
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in March. I couldn't believe it when we came out of the metro station and the hotel was located right in front of us. So top marks for location as it was also within walking distance of the Eiffel Tower and we walked back from St Germain area one night after dinner. The room we were allocated was tiny but still had everything we needed. On our first night in the hotel, there was a problem with the toilet in our room being constantly in flush mode, making it difficult to sleep. We were moved to another room and upgraded to a lovely big room at about 2 in the morning. Unfortunately, we could still hear running water and my hubby was getting cranky from lack of sleep. The poor guy on reception did his best and was most helpful under difficult circumstances. I guess the plumbing in these old buildings can be quite tricky as I had difficulty sleeping another night also. I must say though that every morning we were asked if the room was ok and if we had any problems, and offered another move if we wanted. The continental breakfast was very good in the lovely surroundings of the basement breakfast room All in all a good stay, but beware of the plumbing.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel for couples”
Reviews.Author: vdv_ru
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 2 nights + 2 extra nights thanks to Icelandic volcano. All was very good: great location, very helpful and pleasant staff, charming decor. The only our wishes are: fridge in standard room and possibility to dry the bath robe after hammam.

Reviews.Title: “A disappointing stay”
Reviews.Author: LondonPluto
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for one night. We chose this because it seemed charming and romantic, especially with the hammam. However the decor and the towels especially were tired. The style is more makeshift than boutique. Also rooms were basic and tiny with no mini bar or even a bottle of water available. The hammam was more like a dingy hole. It is fronted by a tiny space which has two tired looking machines which make up the 'gym'. All in all I was extremely disappointed and felt ripped off and deceived as the professional pictures online tell a different and more appealing story.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Place to Stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: QueenMimi
Reviews.Content: We returned to the Hotel de Latour Maubourg for our third visit. Since we were able to get a good price through their website, I upgraded our room to a superior level. It was the largest room that we have ever stayed in while in Paris. The bathroom was very clean with a nice shower. All the hardware in the bathroom sparkles and appears to be new, so it was noticeable that some of the woodwork in the bathroom needs to be repainted. There really was no view from our room but that was not important to us. The women at the front desk during the day were wonderfully friendly and always helpful. The free access to a computer was also a welcome feature. The breakfast was included in our special price so we ate at the hotel. In past visits, we have eaten breakfast in one of the wonderful restaurants over on Rue Cler. One of the most important features about this hotel is the location. It is absolutely fantastic! The hotel is located directly across from a metro station. You can get anywhere in Paris easily on the metro. Some of the best restaurants in Paris are right down the street from the hotel. The Eiffel tower is a 10 minute walk from the hotel. Les Invalides and the Rodin museum are a 10 minute walk in the other direction. To really feel as if you are getting the Parisian experience, stay at this lovely little hotel.

Reviews.Title: “my favourite hotel in paris”
Reviews.Author: TCE_NRE
Reviews.Content: Lovely rooms, they're all refreshingly different. The breakfastroom in the basement is also really charming, and after a long day out it was nice to come back and use the hammam. It was our third stay and the staff was lovely as ever. :)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Stay in a Quaint Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Shashimi19
Reviews.Content: Staying in close proximity to la Tour Eiffel and Des Invalides, this lovely little Hotel offered a personal touch and a really authentic Parisian flair... The staff was very personal, my room was small but sweet - with a great view, and the decor and Petit Dejeuner was lovely...I would gladly return on my next business or pleasure trip to Latour Mauberg.

Reviews.Title: “One word - lovely!”
Reviews.Author: moncherie_reu
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights in late Feb 2010, and all I can say is we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Our deluxe room with nice French decor was very spacious. The location was perfect, in a very nice quiet neighborhood with views of Invalides and right opposite the Metro. The staff were all friendly, specially the ladies during the day shift. They were always cheerful and helpful, and special thanks to Silvia for helping with reporting our lost camera to the train authorities. If you press me for any negatives, the only one would be the squeaking floors, but that's what you get for a traditional French mansion. Other than that, it was just perfect. We'd definitely come back. Pompey

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: BenFr
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the hotel, took breakfasts there too. Enjoyed the Hammam on Sunday morning. Rooms are small but well decorated, particularly recommended for a romantic week-end. Bathroom clean, room as well. Service is excellent, the employees are friendly and forthcoming. They make everything for you to spend an pleasant moment at the hotel. Definitely recommended for a short-time escapade in Paris, the hotel is in the 7th quarters, close to the Eiffel Tower, the Seine banks, the Orsay Museum and others...

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: AroeiraMaria
Reviews.Content: Our stay at Latour-Maubourg Hotel was a good surprise. It is near the Eiffel Tower, Invalides and in front of a metro station. The staff is very kind and always helpping us to find best restaurants and location of main attractions. It is a small hotel, but very charming and confortable. Our room, a classic one, although small, was always very clean. Breakfast was very good and in a charming ambiance.

Reviews.Title: “A bit disapointing”
Reviews.Author: Anders80
Reviews.Content: To be honest, after reading all these good reviews i was a bit disappointed when i got to the hotel. It is a rather old hotel, you can hear people talking in the rooms next to you thru the walls and the metro goes right under the hotel so sometimes it starts to shiver a bit in the walls. Also the breakfast was a bit to simple, and not a really comfy sitting area either. I have never been to any other hotel in France, but i do travel around Europe and the US quite a lot. Comparing the price and what you get for it i was disappointed. However there is a bright spot, and that is really polite staff and they even followed you to the room to make sure you got settled right. Its not "the worse i`ve seen ever", but its not something i would recommend either.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel ideally located with great service”
Reviews.Author: AstroSwiss
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on short notice and almost had to cancel due to changing plans. The email contact with the hotel was very friendly and efficient and already we knew customers were important here. We arrived and were informed of an upgrade to our room, which was very nice. Our room was bigger than expected, the bed was very comfortable and the free wi-fi was appreciated. The location is on a quiet side street with a view onto the impressive Army Museum and across the street from the underground metro station. The reception staff were very helpful in answering our questions. The hotel location is great. The Eiffel Tower is about 15 minutes walk away, Napoleons resting place and Les Invalides (Army museum) only 5 minutes. There are plenty of good eating places around the hotel and the nearby Rue Claire was, well, very French! The hotel also offers a steam room (Hamman) which we used each night. The breakfast was good, but the volume of guests seemed to be a little much for the 2 ladies to handle. Food was slow to be replenished on the buffet which we thought had too small a selection (especially for the price). Hot food (eg eggs) would have been nice. Also, we and other guests had to wait a while for tables to be cleared. All-in-all a good hotel which we would definitely recommend, and which we would come back to again.

Reviews.Title: “charming hotel”
Reviews.Author: lì
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this charming boutique hotel during the month of December for a short holiday with friends and it has been great! The staff is always very kind and they gave us useful information about the city and what to do. We loved the decoration of our rooms (each was different) and the quality of breakfast. Definitely returning!

Reviews.Title: “awful”
Reviews.Author: peter mcnamara
Reviews.Content: stayed over New Year. looks good from outside but rooms terrible. Most are small but R26 is even worse when you have to turn sideways to move past end of bed and nowhere to sit. Lighting so dim that candles would have been better. Only mirror hung 6ft over bed. (very usefull for makeup). Decoration of rooms and bathrooms can only be described as as something from the film Barbabella. Rooms to the right of the stairs suffer from noise from the lift and are also claustrophobic as theyoverlook a tiny but tall inner courtyard which allows very little natural light. Constant sound of running water and waste pipe from washbasin stuck using silicone which resulted in flooding.

Reviews.Title: “A hotel that makes you feel very welcome”
Reviews.Author: goudron
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel de Latour Maubourg for christmas and we were very pleased, the reception staff is the best we have ever experienced on our many travels. The hotel is small and cosy and we had the room close to the reception with a little patio outside. The breakfast was super and much more than you expect from Paris. This will definately not be the last time we stay here. The room although small was nice and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay - Lovely Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pezzapug
Reviews.Content: I took my girlfriend for a suprise trip to Paris and after reading the great reviews of this hotel I thought this would be ideal. The hotel was decorated very elegantly and exactly what I was looking for. The staff were so friendly and very helpful. They spoke perfect English which was great for me as my French is very limited. It is located directly opposite the Metro station in quiet area but not too far away from the heart of Paris. I would recommend this hotel to anyone but especially couples looking for a romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “exactly right for city break”
Reviews.Author: pier32
Reviews.Content: Terrific boutique hotel situated within walking distance of all major sights. The staff were most welcoming and pleasant. Our classic room had an overwhelming smell of cigarette smoke from previous occupants. I mentioned this to a staff member and the following day we were moved to superior room which was spacious and had a high ceiling.The bed wasverycomfortable and bathroom had a bath and shower. I would recommend avoiding the classic rooms as they are located on the top floor and have small windows and the ceiling is part of the roof in the dormer style. The lift does not go to the top floor. Breakfast was a delicious cold buffet in the quaint cellar dining room served til 11am which was an additional bonus as we were on holiday. There is a convenience shop two streets over towards Eiffel Tower and turn right in which to buy bottled water. etc cafe Maubourg serves great coffee at the bar for just one euro. I can recommend this hotel to anyone on a short city break, particularly if most of the time is spent sight seeing outside of the accommodation.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in 7th”
Reviews.Author: Margathon
Reviews.Content: This is the second time I stayed at the hotel and this time I came back with my husband and mother-in-law. I was pleasantly surprised to see a lift in the hotel. The last time I stayed there my dad and I had to drag luggage up the winding stairway. The rooms are comfortable and very clean. Nice amenities. The breakfast is priced a bit high, we are are neighboring bistro's each morning. The staff was just tremendous! Very helpful, sweet and most delightful folks to welcome you and take care of you during your visit. I encourage any traveler to stay at this charming hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Good All Round but Expensive Booking Independently”
Reviews.Author: Bromleypeople
Reviews.Content: I completely agree with the other recent reviewers that this is a good, clean hotel in a really excellent location.We spent 4 nights there. The staff were pleasant and helpful. However the breakfast at the hotel was extremly expensive at approx 15 euros each and we went to neighbouring cafes instead. Booking independently cost us 916 euros for the 2 of us for 4 nights without any breakfast which is, in our opinion, expensive for a 3 star hotel. Each room is colour themed and the silver /black combination with many dangling crystals trimmimgs was not to our taste.. Furthermore the mounds of bed cushions were left after our arrival on the floor in the window alcove for the rest of our stay taking up valuable space.The bedside ledges were tiny but housed largish lamps with dangly crystal shades. Excellent shower. If you like a morning drink before walking the streets to a cafe you may wish to consider a travel kettle.

Reviews.Title: “Charm and elegance in the chic 7e arrondissement”
Reviews.Author: Montreal59
Reviews.Content: This gorgeous boutique hotel is in a quiet area just steps away from trendy cafes, bistros and restaurants. It is well-situated across the street from La Tour Maubourg metro station. Les Invalides and Napoleon's tomb are a 5-minute walk and the Eiffel Tower is 15 minutes away. Because of its availability at the time, we were upgraded to a junior suite, which was spacious (by Parisian standards), comfortable, clean, and beautifully decorated. That said, the hotel's best feature is its staff: friendly, helpful, knowledgeable and unassuming, with a good working knowledge of English. This was our first visit to Paris and there's no question that we will be staying at Hotel de la Tour Maubourg on our next visit as well.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in a beautiful city”
Reviews.Author: Finlaydude
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights at this hotel and had a wonderful time. The room was lovely, the staff were friendly and attentive (and willing to tolerate my horrible attempts at speaking French!) and the location is just perfect, particularly if it's your first visit to Paris. The Eiffel tower is about 10 minutes walk, the Army Museum (and Napoleon's tomb) is right next door, there is a Metro station right outside and none of the main attractions are more than about 10-15 minutes away either on foot or by Metro. The hotel is lovely and quiet, there are lots of restaurants and cafes nearby, and there's a fantastic street nearby where you can buy lots of pastries, wines, cheeses and meats.

Reviews.Title: “A gorgeous hotel, with wonderful staff, in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: LondonBakers
Reviews.Content: Having been to Paris previously staying in various other locations I can't recommend Hotel de Latour Maubourg highly enough. The place is an absolute find and should you take the time to read reviews on the various travel sites you will struggle to find a bad word written. We stayed for three nights, the first in a standard double before moving to a superior room for the rest of our stay. This was purely due to availability when booking - Certainly no complaints of the first room but if a superior room is available when making your reservation I would suggest its certainly worth the extra few Euros. The standard double was not the largest of rooms as you come to expect in Paris but was certainly clean, had everything you needed and in keeping with the other charmingly eclectic touches of the hotel was perfectly judged. Our superior room (23 as I recall) even more so. The location just across from the landmark Military Museum is both beautiful and perfect for any stay in the city. Bikes, Taxis, and the Metro all just around the corner ready to get you to where ever else may take your fancy but if you've not stayed in this part of town before there are some lovely spots to discover within walking distance. The busier St Germain is a short stroll away, with the Eiffel Tower approximately 15-20 minutes (walk) in the opposite direction but far enough away that you dont feel like your in the middle of the hustle & bustle. Paris is not a huge city so everything is still close by. Hotel de Latour Maubourg is charming - a lovely building in a great location with attentive welcoming staff providing a relaxed, perfect stay. Highly recommended and we will certainly be returning.

Reviews.Title: “C'est Magnifique!!”
Reviews.Author: LinnieSD
Reviews.Content: We had a most enjoyable stay at your wonderful hotel. Our room was delightful and so clean and comfortable. The young women at the front desk were the best! They were so helpful to us as we had never been in Paris before. They are most knowledgeable and so patient in directing us to wherever we wanted to go. Even their suggestions as to restaurants and cafes were just right. Our experience was just terrific and we would enthusiastically recommend Hotel de Latour Maubourg.

Reviews.Title: “Enchanting!”
Reviews.Author: SparkPotential
Reviews.Content: The location is outstanding, the staff SO helpful, my room was beautiful, and my stay was simply enchanting! My room walked out to a gorgeous little courtyard where I enjoyed a glass of wine and the evening air before a delicious dinner across the street. The Metro is outside the door to take you anywhere your heart desires. I LOVE Paris! And will definitely make Hotel de Latour Maubourg my very favorite, very special Paris hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay at a quaint hotel”
Reviews.Author: heymon2
Reviews.Content: We spent 6 nights in this hotel and really enjoyed it. We spent a little more than our original budget, but we started planning the trip relatively late and other potential hotels were booked. This turned out to be fortunate for us. The front desk staff was very attentive, and even the night shift guys were on top of their game. Our room was right behind the reception desk (room 3) which at first seemed a bit unusual, but it became an advantage to us. We could not hear the front desk once the doors were closed, and the convenience of having our room right there was nice, especially when we forgot something and had to go right back to the room. We had our own door to the interior courtyard, which we made good use of. The room was the classic room, but we had space for 2 suitcases plus a closet. The bathroom was sufficient, although we would have liked some additional shelf space to spread out toiletries and such. We traveled with a friend who had another room in the same hotel, and she reported it to be a bit smaller but quiet and just what she expected. We arrived early and they made us some excellent coffee to enjoy while we waited for our room, which we expected to take a few hours but took only an hour. They even brought our heavy luggage into the room for us. A note about the breakfast: We too thought it was rather expensive at 16 euro per person, but in reality it was a decent value. First off it is all you can eat, and second the food is really good and the coffee is exceptional. Compared to a cafe, where you get just one cup of coffee, one croissant or piece of bread, and one glass of juice, usually for about 9-10 euros, the hotel breakfast was a better, more delicious deal. We would eat in the hotel every day if we had it to do over again. The location of the hotel was very good, with the Metro across the street next to a taxi stand, and convenient access by walking to many sites. We walked to the Eiffel Tower several times, to the Orsay, Invalides (next door) and even the Arc (kind of a long walk). The neighborhood was excellent, the restaurant right next door (La Source) had good food and friendly service, and all the restaurants we went to nearby were good. Having gone all around Paris on this trip we became familiar with the other areas we could have stayed, but we thought this location was ideal compared to the other places we researched. I complement the entire front desk staff, the housekeeping, and the breakfast room staff. We enjoyed the personal attention we felt we had, and believe that a smaller hotel like this can provide service like this where a larger facility would be less likely to do so. The free Wi-Fi was a bonus, and really I can't think of a complaint.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, small hotel on Left Bank near Les Invalides”
Reviews.Author: Ras15
Reviews.Content: We would agree with other reviewers that this is definitely a place to stay--well run, friendly staff, superb location, comfortable bed, manageable street noise--especially with double-paned windows closed. We couldn't have afforded it without the discount offered this summer, so hopefully it will not be priced out of reach next time. Our room AC worked just fine, and window awnings could be easily lowered by hand to add to temperature control on a warm day. Like most small Parisian hotels, the elevator is tiny--fine for transporting luggage but not for the claustrophobic. The breakfast is pricey but a very good buffet. (The cafe on the corner left of the hotel is a handy substitute, if desired.) We did not try the hammam, i.e., sauna, due to the warm weather, but it might be just the thing on a cold day. The bath linens included a loufa sponge but we would suggest the management offer a choice between that and a washcloth (un linge de toilette?). We opted to use the van service they offered for our airport pickup at CDG, which came direct to the hotel and the charge was comparable to a taxi fare.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional little hotel”
Reviews.Author: Chrispysmith
Reviews.Content: Stayed in one of the less expensive rooms and still found everything outstanding. Great room, excellent bath room, friendly staff, convenient location. Will definitely stay there again when we get the chance.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel helped make our stay in Paris perfect.”
Reviews.Author: PRW-6
Reviews.Content: We chose the hotel because of the reviews we had read on Tripadvisor and it fully met our expectations. The location is ideal for sightseeing, being in walking distance of the Seine and many of the major sights, galleries etc. The Metro station is less than 100 metres away, as is the cab rank. Rooms are excellent (we were upgraded without having to ask) and the decor is very attractive. All staff were exceptionally friendly and helpful. We strongly recommend the steam room (at no charge).........it certainly revived us after a long day's sightseeing! We did not eat breakfast at the hotel as the weather was great and we opted to eat at one of the very nearby brasseries at a pavement side table. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay and would not hesitate to recommend the hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: stefaan75
Reviews.Content: We booked the cheapest room but as the hotel wasn't full we were upgraded to a deluxe room. It was large and clean and the bed was very comfortable (I actually slept better than in my own bed). The location is wonderful, right in front of the Invalides and within walking distance to Les Champs Elysées, the Eiffel Tower, Le Louvre... We didn't use the metro at all, as we enjoy walking. On the contrary to some other comments, I found the breakfast was quite good. 16€ isn't cheap but the area is pretty expensive too and if you want a solid breakfast you won't find it for much cheaper around the hotel. The staff is also very nice and always happy to help.

Reviews.Title: “Stay in the heart of Paris!”
Reviews.Author: Canton,MI
Reviews.Content: My teenaged daughter and I stayed here mid-Aug. This hotel is in a wonderful location very close to Rue Cler (see Rick Steve's Paris book for great information on this area). The hotel is across the street from the metro and bus #69 will take you to all of the big tourist spots. The Eiffel tower is a short walk away. What could be better? The area is loaded with cafes and seemed very safe. Hop on the RER at the Invalides metro stop and zip over to Versailles for the day. Check out the Rodin Museum which is also very close to the hotel. The hotel itself is a beautiful, small hotel with just a few rooms on each floor and beautifully decorated (see photos). We got a rate of 130 Euros via Expedia. Our room converted to 2 beds and had an ultramodern, clean bathroom. We had a room in the back which was extremely quiet. Maid service was very attentive and we lacked for nothing, even ice upon request, which was a plus since Paris was very warm for a few days and we also really appreciated the A/C. The friendly desk staff were helpful and attentive. My daughter enjoyed the free internet access so she could still communicate with her friends. We never ate the breakfast due to the cost and besides all of Paris was right outside our door inviting us to enjoy the fabulous bakeries and cafes. I would definitely stay here upon any other trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a break, great staff, ideal location”
Reviews.Author: NortonCaines
Reviews.Content: This is a small but perfectly formed hotel, containing many quirky features and staffed by extremely friendly and helpful people. The rooms are small but very clean, comfortable and air-conditioned; the decor is highly entertaining also. It is a great spot, just across the road from the Metro and with many very good cafes and bistros nearby (the 7 eme bistro just round the corner was especially good but get there early!). It is ideal for Invalides, the Eiffel Tower and the Musee D'Orsay, the neighbourhood is very laid back and great to wander around...can't fault it really, great value and very highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for a romantic city break”
Reviews.Author: ColinFGlasgow
Reviews.Content: We booked three nights at this hotel after readings reviews on Tripadvisor. We had a classic room, which although small was perfect for our needs and for Paris was very good value at €110 per night, i.e. somewhere to sleep and explore the city from. The room was very tidy and individual decor was different in a good way. Within walking distance of the Tour Eiffel and if you are feeling fit the Arc De Triomphe. Latour Maubourg metro station right across the road and the Les Invalides metro nearby faciltated easy access to Paris. Before arriving the staff helped us arrange restaurants for 2 of our 3 nights, with particular mention for Sophie Anne who was especially helpful and pleasant. On the last night we had dinner at Cafe De L'Homme which with it's view of the Tour Eiffel was superb. Would urge you to visit L'Hotel Des Invalides which is right next door and contains Napoleon's tomb. Also had a fantastic day at the Palace of Versaille. Best thing I can say is that when I go back to Paris I will certainly stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, great location, good service - a little gem”
Reviews.Author: kerrydoubleu
Reviews.Content: We booked a 2 night stay at the hotel to celebrate a birthday - after trawling all the hotel websites in Paris, we discovered Hotel de Latour Maubourg. We did have quite high expectations after reading reviews, and we were not disappointed upon our arrival. Our room at the front of the hotel overlooked a small park, and was very pleasant to stay in. The front of house team were more than competent in giving recommendations for restaurants, and we dined in the memorable restaurant: Les ombres. Thankyou for helping to make our stay in Paris such a pleasure..........

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Perfect - Don't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: ally21903
Reviews.Content: We were in France for a wedding and were able to make it to Paris for 3 days at the end of our trip. I researched hotels for hours and was lucky enough to find this hotel. It was such a great price we booked it immediately. We arrived and were welcomed warmly. Our rooms were a bit small but we didn't need anything bigger. The staff was helpful especially Roberta and in only 3 days our room was cleaned 6 times :) We had complimentary champagne on Bastille Day and enjoyed the outside patio. The location is great. It is right across from the metro and don't be afraid to use it. It is clean and so convienent! There is a also a lovely park and of course two cafes right next door on each side. One a little more expensive.... You are a very short walking distance from the Hotel Invalides and a tour bus stop. I will never stay anywhere else in Paris. Amazing!!!

Reviews.Title: “CLASSY”
Reviews.Author: LeaMccabe
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at Hotel Latour Maubourg. When we arrived they directed us to the room behind the reception area and were a bit apprehensive ... but once the door was closed it was fine! The room was extremely clean & very comfortable with a modern bathroom and the bed comfortable. The decor throughout the Hotel is quaint. They have a free internet available which was great for us. The location is across the road from the Metro station and within walking distance to many attractions (eiffel tower 8 minute walk). It was a beautiful Hotel and in a quiet location with many eating places close by. Great value for money. Highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Location, Great Room, Friendly & Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: Webor
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a superior room which was very clean and wonderfully decorated. The hotel is located in a quiet area close to the Eiffel Tower with many restraunts bistro's and cafe's close by. There is a Metro station very nearby with access to the main network making it easy to discover the rest of Paris. The hotel staff were superb being friendly and very helpful. I would definitly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with fantastic staff, great location, highly recommend it”
Reviews.Author: corkmancorkIreland
Reviews.Content: Just back from a wonderful few days in this hotel. We were celebrating our 25th Wedding Anniversary and we were absolutely delighted with this hotel. We chose this hotel because of the previous reviews on here and It's exactly like they all said. Metro across the road, walking distance to loads of the sights , Eiffel Tower 8 minute walk. Cafes and restaurants everywhere, safe place to walk around at night. The staff arranged a taxi pick up to bring us from the airport right to the door of the hotel and back again and it only cost about €10 extra per person more than the bus ( we would advise this for first time visitors if you don't know your way around Paris ) The bar / restaurant next door is a great place for food and is very reasonably priced for Paris ( 2 steak, chips and salads, 1 bottle wine and 2 desserts €54). Breakfast in the hotel is expensive ( same in all Paris hotels ) but we chose to eat at one of the many cafes around the corner in the Rue De Cler area and only paid €6 each. The staff in the hotel were different class and really friendly and helpful. If you are looking hotel in a good location, that is spotlessly clean, with a great service from the staff then don't hesitate to book this gem.

Reviews.Title: “Good location”
Reviews.Author: llong32
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from 4 days at the Latour Maubourg. The location was great - right opposite a Metro stop and just around the corner from the L'Open Tour stop. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel as considered it expensive and there are three brasseries within a 2 minute walk for both breakfast and dinner - we fell in love with the steak in the brasserie right next door - La Source. The staff were very friendly and put up with our attempts at French. The hotel is very small and individual - fitting our very large suitcase into the tiny lift was a challenge. We had a slight problem with a leak in our bathroom on the second day but the staff couldn't have apologised more and it didn't really affect our stay. The only downside was the weather - we got absolutely drenched whilst on the top deck of the L'Open Tour bus - not what I expected in July!! Quite expensive but then most of Paris is - our Euros didn't go very far.

Reviews.Title: “Well done”
Reviews.Author: FloridaParadise
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended. Clean, attractive, well located near Metro. Staff friendly and helpful. Rooms a bit on the small side, but comfortable. Lots of good restaurants near by.

Reviews.Title: “Incredible Staff”
Reviews.Author: RJ/HM
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 8 AM after an overnight flight from DC. Despite not reserving an extra night for early arrival, we were in our room by 10 AM (after being provided a breakfast at no charge). The staff (Anne-Sophie, Silvia, and Roberta) were incredibly friendly and helpful, both before and during our stay. The Pros about the hotel: Great Staff that arranged for a car pick-up from De Gaulle Airport and for a very nice dinner reservation at a local restaurant (La Fontaine de Mars), very nice location (as long as relaxed and quiet works for you) with a metro stop and a taxi rank about 30 yards from the hotel, nicely appointed, albeit smallish, room that overlooked the square. Modern and very functional bathroom, extremely comfortable bed. Free internet access using an on-site computer. Cons: Breakfast over-priced and underground, but there are at least two available brasseries serving breakfast within 100 yards of the hotel. Great value for the price-highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a romantic trip near the Eiffel tower.”
Reviews.Author: maxenemarie
Reviews.Content: We booked the Room on the top floor with the big soaker bath tub. The lower level (reception) seemed small to us, but when we got to the room, we were pleasantly surprised. The room was spacious with air conditioning to keep it cool... VERY nice decor. The entire room had a large attic-style roof, so all the windows were skylights which all opened without screens, so you could peek your head out if you wanted to survey the little water fountain/garden out front. This hotel is closest to the military school/museum, but within a 10 minute walk you are under the Eiffel tower. The mini-bar was well-stocked and replenished every day. My favorite thing was that I could bath and watch the birds fly over head through the sky-light. This hotel made this trip one I will never forget. The only thing that was not perfect was the over-priced continental breakfast. 16 Euro per person for pastries, cold cuts, cereal and cheese. I learned that there are several small brasseries very close by where you can buy excellent croisants for about 1 Euro each, as well as pizza, quiches, and other very delicious edibles at reasonable prices. Also, there are two VERY good restaurants on either side of the hotel with excellent coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly situated, comfortable, chic boutique hotel with fantastic service!”
Reviews.Author: clarey2311
Reviews.Content: Just back from an amazing long weekend in Paris. My boyfriend (now fiance) chose the Hotel de Latour Maubourg for our 3-night stay after much deliberation (he planned this months in advance) and I can't recommend it highly enough for a romantic weekend away, especially for a proposal (such as happened to me!). The hotel is perfectly located, so close to the Eiffel tower (5-10 mins walk) and les Invalides. Easily within walking distance to some great palces along the Seine and interesting markets (e.g. Saxe-Breteuil - amazing). Not to mention the Metro station just opposite, which allows you access to many places of interest within 10 or 15 minutes at most (Montmartre, the Louvre, Notre Dame, etc). Rue Cler (some say is the best food market street in Paris), is 5 mins walk away (check out Davoli!), and there is an endless choice of cafes, boulangeries and restaurants also within a short walk. I have read the 'very poor', 'poor' and 'average' reviews on here and I don't understand the comments at all! Contrary to previous reviews, we did not hear a peep from the Metro or any noise from cafes outside - we thought the room was very well insulated. Heard the occasional noise from an adjoining room but this wasn't a problem at all. We had a packed itinerary, setting off early each morning and came back for a lovely nap in the afternoon before setting off again. The location allowed us to do this. We stayed in Room 23 on the 2nd floor which overlooked a pretty park opposite the hotel. I can see how the decor may not be to some people's taste but we found it to be eclectic, interesting and different, yes, a little kitsch but nothing wrong with that! The room was impeccably clean and we were so impressed with the extra little touches like the turn down service, roses in the bathroom, digital room safe, hotel umbrellas free to borrow at the entrance, free hammam and free high speed wireless internet should you need it. Can't comment on the breakfast as we did not sample it (a bit expensive at 16 Euros I suppose and we preferred to go to the boulangeries) but the salle and little courtyard garden were lovely. The room was not huge but then I doubt many in Paris are very big - there was certainly enough room to unpack and store 2 large cases and a large double wardrobe, a desk, plenty of power points etc. As for the desk service - fantastic. My boyfriend wanted to impress me by asking for everything but doesn't speak perfect French. The ladies were patient and kind and allowed him to make his point, rather than talking to him in English, and if he got stuck they were happy to switch back. Always friendly, happy and smiling and ready to assist, any time of day and night. We both recommend this hotel highly and would go back without hesitation. Easily our new favourite place to stay in Paris! Book online for the best rates and watch out for the 3-night deals when you book in advance.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay in a beautiful hotel with helpful,kind receptionn”
Reviews.Author: fluey46
Reviews.Content: My mother and I enjoyed our stay in this beautiful and elegantly decorated hotel this past June. The staff were very kind, helped us with dinner reservations and airport transfers,and answered all of my questions promptly.( I had many!) The breakfast was great too- easy, filling, and extended hours. Fresh baguettes, croissants, and petit pain au chocolat daily! Plus many more continental options. There is a great variety of rooms to choose from as well. I look forward to returning on my next visit!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: kevoSydneyAustralia
Reviews.Content: I agree with the other Reviews. We chose this Hotel mainly based on Trip Advisor and were not disappointed. We chose a Superior room and while not large was quite roomy enough for our 6 night stay. The room was on the 2nd floor overlooking a pretty square, but was very quiet and charming. All staff were extremely friendly and very helpful. Booking a restaurant for us was no trouble at all. One of our complaints was the high cost of the breakfast. We ate out at the various local cafes which were usally cheaper than the Hotel. It is a pity that the breakfast is so expensive as it would have been more convenient to eat downstairs. Room service is fantastic and free internet access on their computer is a plus. As mentioned above, there are many good cafes/restaurants nearby and there is a laundromat a few minutes away. The Hotel is also very close to the wonderful Rodin Museum. One thing that you should be aware of is that there is no porter to assist with luggage. This is only an issue with the few steps at the front of the Hotel. The lovely Silvia was on the front desk when we arrived and when we left and she was only too happy to assist us on the steps. Yes, we certainly would recommend Latour Maubourg for your stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Best location, super friendly staff and nice quiet rooms”
Reviews.Author: FESP
Reviews.Content: My mom and I came to Paris for a mother and daughter trip. We always look for a hotel with an excellent location and comfortable rooms. Hotel de Latour Maubourg is EXACTLY what we were looking for. The hotel is adorable, the rooms are small but perfect for two people. The location can't be beat. The metro is out the front door, cafes are all around and the Invalides is within a stone's throw. The Eiffel Tower is close enough to walk too . . . but, so is Notre Dame! The staff is EXTREMELY friendly. They set up transportation to and from the airport, they speak english, look up train schedules and call to offer tea at night! If you are looking for a hotel with on a quiet street, with a great location and pretty furnishings then this is it!

Reviews.Title: “a true little gem”
Reviews.Author: eh1777
Reviews.Content: This is a beautful little boutique hotel. I arrived here exhausted from much traveling, on my first trip to Paris, and speaking no French I was worried. But the arrangements made by the hotel for my pickup at the train station went well, and I was warmly greeted by the front desk. The room was tiny and dark since it only looked on other rooms, but it was clean and richly appointed, and quiet. They have a nice attention to detail throughout. The front desk girls really made the effort to help me, a clueless American, with good suggestions that were appreciated. The location is great, walking distance to the Eiffel Tower and I did a longer walk to the Louvre along the Seine too, cabs and restaurants everywhere, across from Metro. If you don't need much space, this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Paris base for business or pleasure”
Reviews.Author: ringsau
Reviews.Content: I have a single day remaining of a 6 night stay at the Hotel de La Tour Mauborg. I selected the hotel based on reviews on Tripadvisor and I have to say I have been even more than impressed. This is an impeccible boutique hotel directly across the road from the metro stop La Tour Mauborg. The hotel is spotlessly clean with interesting eclectic rooms all in different romantic themes. My room had a large double bed, desk, bathroom with a bath (a plus for Paris) all for a bargain in my estimatation price of 200 Euro per night. The hotel staff are amazing. Polite to a fault and ever present to assist. Little touches like turn down service, hotel umbrellas at the entrance and FREE high speed wireless internet are touches even higher star hotels have trouble delivering. This hotel does it without fault. The location of the hotel is excellent. A few blocks from Rue Cler (the best food market street in Paris) , there is an endless choice of cafes, boulangeries and restaurants within a short walk. A Paris favourite, Le Florimond is a few blocks away. A velib station is also across the road from the hotel allowing for easy cycling to any destination. The metro line is excellent as well with easy access to all parts of Paris including 1 stop to Invalide to take the RER direct to Versailles. I coudl not be more lavish in praise of this hotel and its service. I will stay there again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Paris "Charme" lives at Hotel de Latour Maubourg”
Reviews.Author: lesmiz
Reviews.Content: this beautiful, friendly hotel is all you could ask for in Paris - convenient to the Metro, wonderful restaurants and sightseeing within easy walking distance, perfect hospitality and service during our four night stay. The breakfast is a delight, the decor enchanting. The area is very safe and comfortable. Our room was typically Paris-small, but the charm overshadowed the size! Will surely stay there again - the entire package is simply irrestible!

Reviews.Title: “Unique and stylish”
Reviews.Author: bogert
Reviews.Content: Great location opposite the Metro. Terrific area for a more local shopping and eating experience with good variety. Each room is individually decorated - we had a deluxe room and it was a v large room exactly what we wanted. We were on the ground floor there are stairs and a lift for other floors. We saw a couple of the other rooms as some friends of ours were meant to meet us there. We told the lady at the reception that we were expecting them she checked but could not find anything. We couldnt contact our friends - they were en route. Our friends had booked through an intermediary and the booking had not gone through to the Hotel. This is something to watch out for as they thought they had booked directly with the hotel, it was not until they got an email from the intermediary the day before wishing them a great stay that they realised that they hadnt. They arrrived quite late in the evening and were shown a couple of rooms that were smaller than ours although one of them opened onto the courtyard. The following day they were upgraded to a deluxe room - the girls at the reception could not have been any more accomodating or apologetic. How lucky or 'well done' to this owner to have such a great team of staff. We were helped with dinner plans and travel plans we were givien copies of menus etc we could not have asked for more. Definitely stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: klever5
Reviews.Content: We were very happy with our three night stay at this very comfortable hotel. Our visit was made even more pleasant by the very charming and helpful mademoiselles at the front desk. Our room (Number 15) was large enough for us to deposit our large pieces of luggage and still give us space to move around. The room has a Napoleonic decor - red, gold and black pillows on the bed - as well as some additional funky touches such as the fur collars on the individual lights in the chandelier. The bathroom was a good size with a large shower. The location is directly across the street from the Tour Maubourg metro stop making it very convenient to get around the city. There is a small lounge off the reception area as well as another lounge in the basement, decorated in a purple scheme, where a (free) computer is located for guest use. A few steps lead up to the outdoor patio. Amenities include a choice of daily newspaper and free WIFI. We didn't try breakfast because of the steep price (16 Euro). All in all we found this to be an extremely pleasant and comfortable hotel and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel, incredible service, and great location”
Reviews.Author: paris448
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a stay at the Hotel de Latour Maubourg and have nothing but wonderful things to say about the experience. The hotel is lovely. Because our stay was split into two segments of three days each, we were able to experience two different rooms and both were very nice. The people who work at Latour Maubourg were the friendliest and most helpful people I've ever met at a hotel! The location was absolutely the best. Metro and taxi stand right across the street. Everything you could want (cafes, stores, markets) were on Rue de Grenelle, Rue St. Dominique, and Rue Cler making the neighborhood very charming. This hotel is a gem, and I certainly recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place perfectly situated”
Reviews.Author: Dode74
Reviews.Content: A very nice hotel placed within a stone's throw of the Invalides (military museum) and 10 minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower - it couldn't be better placed. There are plenty of nearby places to eat and a lovely cafe on the street corner for that outdoor breakfast experience. The place is spotlessly clean and has plenty of character. The staff were friendly and helpful at all times. The rooms are well decorated with a very genuine French twist in places. We got an ugrade to a very nice deluxe room at the same price, although I would have been less pleased had I paid for such a room at the normal price having booked it.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect base for exploring Paris”
Reviews.Author: Cudrefin
Reviews.Content: I somehow managed to post my original review of this hotel against a restaurant of a similar name so hopefully I've managed to get this review right :) I spent 5 nights at La Tour Maubourg hotel with my family in August 2008. We selected the hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews, hotel price and location (we wanted to stay somewhere that was fairly central to the main attractions and with good access to the Metro). Hotel Location: The hotel is situated right on the edge of Les Invalides and directly outside the La Tour Maubourg Metro station. There are enough cafes and restaurants nearby to satisfy most people. The hotel is well placed for attractions being a 15-20 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower, Champs Elysees and Jardin des Tuileries. There is a lovely view from the front of the hotel over a small park area with a fountain. The reservation: We booked the room directly through the hotel website as I prefer to deal directly with the hotel rather than through a third-party booking agency. Making the reservation was easy and we quickly received email confirmation of our booking. We then received a futher email from the hotel requesting information about our preferences regarding beds (double, twin, etc.), newspapers and even the colour of the roses (nice touch). Although check-in is from 1:00 pm the hotel said that they would try to have the room ready earlier as we expected to arrive around 9:00 am. Check-in: We arrived at the hotel at 1.00 pm (we walked the couple of miles from St Michel to the hotel and stopped for breakfast so we were later than anticipated) although true to their word the hotel had made the room available from 10:00 am. The welcome we received from Eva on reception was great and we immediately felt very much at home The room: We opted for the junior suite as our daughter is only 5 years of age and we expected to be spending quite a lot of time in the room, particularly in the evening. The room was placed on the top (3rd) floor and I would guess has been converted from what was once the attic. The suite consisted of a lounge area with desk and chaise longue (which doubled as an extra bed), a bedroom area with a huge double bed, a separate bathroom with a shower, separate bath and twin wash basins. The toilet was in its own room at the other end of the suite from the bathroom. The decor of the room was quite unusual, having a plum coloured theme with printed fabric covering the walls. With the suite being in the attic there were skylights in place of normal windows. There was a minibar in the room and space for storing clothes in the bathroom. There was an LCD television mounted on a wall above the desk. Although slightly unconventional, the suite was really nice and comfortable and we loved it. Hotel services: We didn't make much use of the hotel services (breakfast, bar, etc.) so it's not possible to pass comment on these areas. The reception staff we dealt with were very good and were able to provide any information that we required about the city and its attractions. A nice touch was the free wireless internet connection. The stay: Housekeeping did a great job of keeping the room clean and tidy during our stay and overall we were very happy with all aspects of the hotel service. Other information: The complimentary bottle of champagne in our room on arrival was a perfect start to the holiday. Shutters on the skylights could be closed by remote control - very useful for keeping the room dark in the morning. Also, with the room being at the very top of the hotel you didn't get other guests passing your room waking you up. The air conditioning was excellent. There were no tea or coffee making facilities in the room. The shower was a bit on the small side. Having the clothes storage in the bathroom was slightly unusual. The toilet didn't have a towel rail in the room so the towel had to be tucked behind the basin tap - a small point but the sort of detail I would expect to be covered with an advertised room rate of 460 euros per night. The ceiling sloped at either side into the eaves making the suite feel smaller than it actually was. I tended to duck when I didn't need to and then forget to keep my head down when I should have :) High points: Paris is still a fantastic city although I prefer it out of the summer season. The public transport system is superb and relatively cheap. La Tour Maubourg is a great hotel if what you want is somewhere comfortable and quiet to stay within easy reach of the heart of Paris. We got a good deal on the room rate which made it a lot more affordable. Low points: Wow! Paris is expensive these days if you are visiting from the UK. Don't expect to pay less than 10-15 euros (£8-12) for a fairly basic meal. A pint (well, 500ml) beer will set you back around 8 euros (£6-7) in just about any standard bar/restaurant in the city centre. We paid over 30 euros (£25) for 2 croissants, 2 small pieces of bread, 1 crepe, 1 lemonade and 2 coffees. I thought that Disneyland was overpriced (139 euros or £110 entry charge for 2 adults and a child for the most basic entrance package) and overcrowded - expect to queue for 20 to 90 minutes for most of the rides. The food was not great or cheap their either. Conclusion: This is a lovely little (only 17 rooms I believe) hotel in a great location. This hotel is probably not for people who expect a huge range of hotel services to be available but as a base to expore the city it is absolutely perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Helpful staff, great location”
Reviews.Author: frey77
Reviews.Content: We spent a week in Paris staying in the Hotel de Latour Maubourg after trawling through Paris hotels on Trip Advisor. We normally stay in large modern hotels, but rapidly found that such things in Paris are either very expensive or not in the centre of the city. So instead we went with the reviews and booked a superior room in the Latour Maubourg. First things first, the hotel immediately confirmed our booking with a personal email asking if there was anything they could do to make our stay better, whether we needed a shuttle pick-up from the airport etc. We thought this was a nice, personal, touch and replied that we were arriving very early in the morning (7am!) and it would be nice if we could leave our bags until check-in time. In actuality when we arrived they had a room ready for us (5 hours before normal check-in time) which was unexpected and really really good. The staff were very friendly throughout our stay and spoke very good English. We stayed in a superior room which was pretty large and comfortable. It had a big window, which opened out onto a small courtyard. This was fine for fresh air, but obviously you're not getting a view. We knew this from looking at the website, and it wasn't a concern for us. It seemed to us that the deluxe rooms probably had the view from the front of the hotel. Not being at the front of the hotel did mean that the room was nice and quiet which was good after all the traffic noise you get in central Paris (did I mention the million scooters?). As has been mentioned in other reviews the furniture is a bit quirky, but the bed was really large and comfortable and there was a nice chest of drawers and it all seemed to go together pretty well. The bathroom was a little worn around the edges, but it never gave us any issues. The location of the hotel is worth a mention as it's very, very good. There's a metro stop literally 20 metres from the front door which is a great thing when you've been wandering around Paris all day and your feet hurt. The neighbourhood is very nice to walk around. It's not as busy as a lot of other places in Paris and there are a lot of nice restaurants and cafes. There are three cafes within 50m of the hotel, two of which are fairly normal cafe/brasserie places which do good food for reasonable prices. The other one (cafe esplanade) is a bit more sophisticated and expensive, but well worth it as they do a great breakfast with nice views of Les Invalides. There's a pedestrian food market area on Rue Cler (a couple of minutes walk away) which has a load of great food shops/stalls on it. We went there and bought some bread, fruit and cheeses and it was a lot of fun. We also tried the Italian restaurant, Pupi, which was recommended in another review, and found it was just as good as reported. There's also this Eiffel tower thing, which is about a 5 minute walk away, easily close enough to stroll over after dinner and watch the lights come on (which we did severla times). We made extensive use of the free wireless internet the hotel provides. We used our iPhone for this and it allowed us to use the web which was very convenient to check opening times for museums, locations for restaurants etc. I don't think this is necessarily a common feature in Paris hotels and it added a lot of value for us. All in all we found our stay to be really good, and would stay here again. The personal feel to this hotel is really significant. They even bought chocolate gifts for us for Easter, which were from the boutique chocolatier Jean-Paul Hevin!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Charming Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Palm37
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at Hotel de Latour Maubourg and found the hotel simply delightful. When we arrived we were booked into a classic room which was beautiful but a little on the small side so we upgraded to a superior room for an extra 30 euros a night which was more spacious. The room was fabulous, quirky decor, loads of character and spotlessly clean. Service was great and the staff were very helpful. Location was fantastic - right opposite the metro. There are lots of great restaurants and bars nearby. There was a real charm to the hotel - would highly recommend.

Reviews.Title: “The perfect start to our honeymoon”
Reviews.Author: TheAirs
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel de Latour Mauborg for the first three days of our honeymoon and it was everything we hoped it would be. Wonderful service, perfect location, and some really nice touches that made us feel special. Conveniently located right next to the metro, with a view to the Eiffel Tower in one direction and Les Invalides in anther. We used the hotel as a base and walked to the Tower one day, and to the Arc de Triomphe the next, utilising metro and buses to see more of the city as we wished. As others have mentioned, the room was on the small side, but that really wasn't an issue for us, we really loved the place and would definitely recommend it. The breakfast room and lounge in the basement are particularly charming, and mention has to be made of the staff who couldn't do enough for us. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, great value”
Reviews.Author: sakw
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel de Latour Maubourg in March 2009. It is fabulous. Quiet, lovely rooms, with charm+++. Excellent staff. Impeccably clean. Lovely breakfast. Located across the street from the Metro, in the 7th arrondissement. Very convenient to all of Paris. We loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Just what we expected; a great boutique hotel at a good rate”
Reviews.Author: DCHotelSnobs
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 1 night stay at the Hotel de Latour Maubourg. My wife and I took the Eurorail from London where we stayed 3 nights (you'll see a review for the Asbhurn Hotel as well). Metro to this hotel from the train station was easy. The Metro stop is literally right across the street from this hotel in a beautiful park setting. The Hotel is right in front of you as you exit the Metro stop and looks exactly like the pictures on this site. A beautiful facade in a neighborhood setting with visible cafes and brasseries on the corners. The reception area is charming and the lobby area is well appointed; albeit on the smaller side. The girls at the reception get an A+ They were all very warm and welcoming and spoke very good english. It was much appreciated since our French was very limited to the basic please/thank you, etc. Their restaurant recommendations were great too; try the casual Italian place just about a 10 minute walk down the street. The wait staffed there is very welcoming and didn't mind us cutting up their beautiful language. Prices are reasonable for awesome atmosphere and even better staff. We booked a queen/double and got what we paid for. In actuality, the bed was more the size of the double but we slept fine for the one night. If we were there for longer we would have asked for or paid for a larger bed. The room was smaller than I expected (even by European standards), but we only used the room to rest - so it wasn't a big deal. The layout of the room was fine, a bit cramped but since we only packed one small bag between the two of us, it was fine. There is a safe in the room which was nice and we used it. The bathroom was nice and clean, but we couldn't get the towel dryer to work. We didn't ask them to look at it and I'm sure they would have. Again, not a huge deal for a 1 night stay. Good hot water and good water pressure. Our room was on the 3rd floor and over-looked over rooves and buildings - so upgrade if you want a room with a view. The room was a bit 'dark' for our taste. It was well appointed with flowing drapery, etc., but the combination of a dark carpet and dark colorerd bed spread and brown curtains, made the room 'feel' smaller than it was. We pulled back the curtains and let the light into the room. It felt better. No noise from other rooms - so that was a huge plus. Overall, our experience was good. This hotel offered a very good location (a 15 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and much more), great attentive service, a boutique french experience we were seeking and a really cool, 2 person elevator to take you up to your room.

Reviews.Title: “Charmed by the impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: marianne202
Reviews.Content: We were in Paris for a long weekend - it was not really a pleasure trip - a close family member was very ill and in the hospital. We arrived early in the morning and our room was ready (as had been requested via email), Sylvia made note of the hospital and got us the directions from the very convenient Metro stop just across the small street. The room was clean, quiet and just quirky enough in decor to make it perfect for us. We fully appreciated all of the staff but especially Sylvia - she was a true "hotelier"

Reviews.Title: “A simply amazing Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CarrefourOxford
Reviews.Content: I took my boyfriend there for Valentine's Day and I cannot but agree with all the other positive reviews.
