We had a Cassic Room, which was decorated in a gorgeous and very attentive way and which was a good size for inner-city Paris. Everything was very clean and modern and just plainly adorable. What was most astonishing was the superbly friendly service and amenities such as a rose for Valentine's Day and rose petals in the bathroom. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful, smiled all the time and have an excellent command of English. They also booked an amazing restaurant for us, very French and authentic. The location is first class, right opposite Invalides and only a few minutes from the Eiffel Tower. The Metro station is literally just opposite the hotel. All in all, it really is a first-class hotel at a low price. Definitely the best Hotel to stay at if the Ritz is out of the question.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to go back!”
Reviews.Author: TotoahBelfast
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I spent Valentines at this Hotel based on the reviews on this website - and it didn't disappoint. We stayed in a superior room which faced onto the main road and loved everything from the rose petals placed around the sink and shower to the comfortable king size bed. The bathroom was a little bit on the small side but not something to worry about. It's the little touches which make this hotel stand out - things like turning the sheets down at night, leaving a valentine's day card, the rose in the bathroom, slippers and robe. The staff on the reception desk were superb and extra helpful when my girlfriend had her purse stolen in the Metro - thanks again! Great hotel, well placed in the City and really worth the money. Can't rate it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Hotel de Latour Maubourg”
Reviews.Author: LoveParis81
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in August 2008 for 5 nights as part of our 11 day romantic vacation through France and Italy. After searching through the hundreds of hotels and apartments for rent in Paris, I chose this one because of other reviews and the location, since neither of us had been to Paris before. The staff was always very friendly, and every evening when we returned to the hotel we would tell them where we planned to go the next day, and they were more than willing to help plan our metro route and give us advice. The room was comfortable enough for the 2 of us with authentic decor and large windows overlooking the fountain across the street. The hotel is literally right across from a metro stop that was very convenient for us since we walked or took the metro everywhere we went. There is a delicious cafe right next door and numerous shops and grocery stores within a few minutes walk. The Eiffel Tower is 10 minutes walk away. This is honestly the best value I could imagine for the money, everything was excellent. Also, the wireless internet was free unlike most other hotels. We stayed in 3 other hotels throughout the rest of our vacation and this was by far the best experience we had, we will definitely return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and value”
Reviews.Author: Trundle1
Reviews.Content: Booked the Latour Maubourg after reading reviews on TA, and have to agree with the positive reviews here. The hotel itself was very comfortable and well appointed, the staff were friendly and helpful and spoke very good English - useful for those whose French isn't what it should be. Even the continental breakfast was great. Best of all is the location, there is a metro directly outside the hotel next to which there is also a cab rank. If you don't mind walking, a pleasant 10 minute stroll get's you into the heart of Paris itself. I have been actively recommending this hotel to friends who might be visiting Paris in the future and pleased to highly recommend the Latour Maubourg for anyone looking for good value, superior accomodation in Paris. We will stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, Great Staff!”
Reviews.Author: BaltimoreBen
Reviews.Content: Took my wife to Paris to celebrate her birthday and stayed at Hotel Latour Maubourg. Couldn't have wished for a better hotel - the building itself is lovely - cosy yet warm and very tastefully decorated. The room was excellent - a nice size, again with tasteful decor and a huge bathroom. The outstanding element though was the service. Everyone was extremely friendly. Champagne was put in our room to celebrate the birthday, which was a very nice touch. Anne-Sophie kindly made us dinner reservations at the nearby restaurant Fontaine de Mars (which was excellent) and special thanks go to Silvia, who helped us numerous times throughout the trip with recommendations, directions, booking us a steam bath and sorting us out with a taxi back to the station. Merci Silvia! We'll certainly stay at this hotel when we return to Paris as it's perfect - great location, intimate and very reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: chriszan
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this lovely hotel for one night. Great location and good value for money. The room was really comfortable and beautifully decorated. Enjoyed an excellent breakfast in bed. Definitely recommend this hotel for a great time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Charismatic and value for money”
Reviews.Author: BrightonJones
Reviews.Content: Spent a long weekend at the Latour Mauborg and was pleasantly surprised Great location - lots of shops and restaurants nearby and we managed to walk to most of the tourist destinations - Eiffel Tower, Seine etc, even Montmartre (but my legs were a little tired at the end) Hotel is beautiful and our room was fairly large considering a lot of the boxes that pass for hotel rooms in Paris. Although I didn't get a bedside table as such, just the world's smallest shelf, so it loses a star for that alone. Most of the check in staff were helpful, but yes the night time guy is pretty surly, so try to check in earlier if you can! We tried the 'hammam' - a strange place. It's a sauna off a cupboard with two bits of gym equipment in it, laughingly called a gym. The sauna is weird, firstly it's an odd shape, basically only one person can sit down at any one time, so any other sauna-goers are left sort of hanging around waiting for their go, staring at the large unexplained shelf and wondering why that wasn't just turned into extra seating. Not that relaxing and a bit strange. Can't recommend that bit at all.

Reviews.Title: “A Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bex082
Reviews.Content: This hotel is beautifully decorated, in a perfect location - a 10 minute walk from the eiffel tower & river, has very helpful and friendly staff and offers excellent value for the money you pay. The room was small but very well decorated, very clean and the bathroom was lovely. The hotel is just meters away from a metro station as well. I would certainly recommend this hotel to anyone looking to stay in the centre of Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Magnifique!”
Reviews.Author: charbit63
Reviews.Content: I just returned to Chicago after a six night stay at Hotel de Latour Maubourg. All I can say is, wow did I make the right choice. As others have already mentioned, the location is perfect. Close enough to most anything you'd want to see in Paris (actually perfect for day trips to Versailles, now that I think of it). Yet when you return to the 7th, it's like coming home. A quite, peaceful, area with just enough hustle and bustle, but without the overwhelming amount like other areas of Paris I've stayed in (1st, 8th i.e.). As far as the Hotel itself, it is a restored private mansion and still has that feeling about it. I stayed in Room 14 which was decorated magnificently in Napoleon 111 style. For those that critized the decoration of the rooms, I'll include a picture of the Napoleon 111 rooms from the Louvre. Strikingly similar, huh? It's called taste and style. May not be for everyone. If you are happy with the Motel 6 style back in the states, as opposed to this style, maybe this isn't the place for you. In fact maybe Paris (the fashion capital of the world) wouldn't be the place for you period, but I digress. Finally, the staff (Sarah, Roberta, Anne Sophie, Silvia, Patrick, etc.) all made the stay in this wonderful Hotel that much better. I must give you an example of the type of service they provided me. The last day of my stay I slipped on a wet cobblestone and threw my back out severely. They were able to arrange for me a doctor (service called SOS) at midnight who treated me right in the room. When it was time to check out the next morning, (I barely remember it as the medication the doctor gave me was very strong, and I had tried treating myself earlier with some Armagnac) they assured I made it safely to the airport. The pain was gone, but man was I in a daze. My apologies and also sincere thanks to the staff for putting up with me. In addition the staff was able to make reservations at local restaurants for me, as I am French challenged. I ate at one three times because it was so good (La Fountaine De Mars). The Cassoulet was fit for a King. It was ten minute beautiful walk from the Hotel, yet there is a Bistrot right next door that I used for late night snacks(Croque Monsieurs, etc.) and other excellent local restaurants right around the corner. If they'll have me back, I'll only stay at this hotel in the future. Both for it's beauty, class, but most of all for the staff that made me feel welcome with their smiles everyday after my long walks. And one more thing the Hamman (steamroom) is perfect for after a long day of tiring muscles out. Make sure they turn the temperature up (40C is perfect for me) and you will be ready to "paint the town". Merci Beaucoup, Charles Harbit

Reviews.Title: “The birthday treat”
Reviews.Author: Mossey7
Reviews.Content: Myself and my finace visited the hotel from 16th November - 20th November as it was my fiances birthday. We absolutely loved our stay at the hotel. The staff were fantastic and the service was superb. We loved the treatment and the delivery of any champagne we ordered. The hotel has a very romantic feel about it and is perfectly situated beside the metro station which makes it very easy to travel around. There are so many great coffee shops beside the hotel and it is only a ten minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. Thank you to all the staff for their kind hospitality during our trip.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the great location and lovely feel of the room”
Reviews.Author: MalSGP
Reviews.Content: We were there on a "budget honeymoon" (rooms in europe are just too expensive due to exchange rates!!) So was very pleasantly surprised when the room turned out to be GREAT. Very small (no surprise there) but nicely decorated and very clean. There was a nice chilled bottle of champange for us as a gift from the hotel when we arriived. Lovely... =) The staff was fantastic and very helpful in all our requests. They had fantastic knowledge of the area and gave good reccomendations for restaurants. Was quite a touristy restaurant (ie all the diners were speaking in english) but the food was great so no complains there. Location was good too, just opposite the Metro, and walking distance to Invallides and Eifel Tower, however, still quiet enough to not feel intrusive. Would not hesitate to stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: jheisel
Reviews.Content: After searching through this site for the perfect reasonably-priced hotel for a romantic getaway weekend, we settled on Latour Maobourg. From the moment we checked in to the (sad) moment when we checked out four days later, everything was at the highest level of perfection. Major sites like the Eiffel Tower are within walking distance, and anything that is not walkable is easily accessible by the Parisian metro, a few steps from the hotel's front door. Overall, a perfect base for tourists, or lovers looking for a romantic weekend.

Reviews.Title: “A gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: asleung
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels in Paris that we stayed. The front desk staff were very helpful and gave good recommendations to restaurants. They also helped us in confirming our dinner reservations. Room is nice and bigger than some other Paris hotels of the same class. It is literally across the street from the Metro station. A lot of good restaurants are just 1 block away.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel - but skip the breakfast”
Reviews.Author: mischango
Reviews.Content: Overall our stay at Latour Maubourg was a great time. The room was very clean, eccentrically decorated and very well kept. However, our room was the junior suite and the ceilings were too low in many places for my 6 foot 4 inch husband. So be weary of the suite if you are very tall. Also - we had breakfast in the hotel one of the days, and it left a lot to be desired. I had hot chocolate, which was given to me with very tepid milk, and my husband tried some cheese which turned out to be spoiled. The dinner recommendations were given for places that were loaded with other tourists (from the US and other places), and we would have liked to have a more authentic dinner experience. One of these restaurants was admittedly very very good, so they did a great job - its just that they didn't seem to understand when we asked for a small, quaint, French restaurant. I think their intentions were good in that they were trying to help us find a place that would communicate with us in English. Again - overall it was a fantastic trip and the hotel staff was very friendly and accommodating. Next time I would do more research about dining beforehand and would also steer clear of the breakfast at the hotel. The location was fantastic and I would recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel with wonderful and helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: lovetootrav
Reviews.Content: Whenever we travel, I take a lot of time and care to choose a hotel and read all the reviews. I looked at the Hotel de Latour Maubourg, called and spoke with the receptionist, and booked this hotel for our third trip to Paris in April. We were absolutely charmed. The hotel itself is beautiful, the staff is eager to please, and we agree with other reviewers that it's a wonderful choice for Paris. Upon arrival from Seville, we took the Air France bus from Orly to Invalides, hopped one stop on the Metro and exited right in front of the hotel. We had booked a standard room and were told with an apology that our room was not available - would we accept an upgrade to a suite with their compliments? Heck, yes - so we found ourselves in a lovely, large room (the one with the red walls on the website), with full height windows facing the leafy square. The bathroom also had a full-length window and soaking tub/shower. It was just gorgeous - lots of light, space, and closet room. But while many hotels look nice, it's the staff that make the difference, and I can say with gratitude that people at the Hotel de Latour Maubourg were just wonderful. Our last day, when attempting to get some cash at the ATM, my card was swallowed by the machine. Great - it was a French holiday, so the banks were closed. What do we do now? Roberta not only let us use the desk phone (for about a half hour), but spoke in French when needed to explain the situation and reassured us that she would help resolve any problems. We did speak with our credit card issuer in the US, and everything turned out to be fine, but her quiet confidence was beyond the call of duty. We were very, very pleased with our choice, and highly recommend the hotel. Thank you! PS We're from Los Angeles, California, not LA, Chile....don't know how to edit that part.

Reviews.Title: “A brilliant stay !!”
Reviews.Author: Billericay_8
Reviews.Content: The hotel was just wonderful. The staff were incredibly helpful and as we don't speak French,spoke to us in English . The room and bathroom were spotless and kept that way by the ( invisible !!) hotel staff. One of the girls behind the desk described the hotel as our home in Paris for the time we were there. We don't travel much but this has been our best Hotel experience . The styleof the rooms is (to us ) very grand and felt luxurious . The hotel is situated in a convenient and fantastic location- opposite the metro which encouraged us to use it !!!! The Eiffel Tower was up the road and round the corner, lots of sightswithin walking distance. So yet again a HUGE thank you to the staff at the hotel. Hope to see you again sometime .

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with exceptional staff”
Reviews.Author: Irkutsk22
Reviews.Content: My stay at Hotel de Latour Maubourg was a wonderfull experience not only because of the convenient location and good facilities, but primarily due to the high standards of customer service maintained at this hotel. Reception staff was always helpfull, smiling, and it makes this hotel very special. I highly recommend it to all Paris visitors.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic place”
Reviews.Content: I stayed with my son in october and we had a wonferfull time in this little mansion.The staff was fantastic and gave us a lot of good informations about paris and its museums and restaurants.We had a deluxe room with a little balcony and a view om the invalides palace. Very very nice stay

Reviews.Title: “Tiny room and no elevator”
Reviews.Author: Conrad_Brazil
Reviews.Content: I have booked 7 nights for this hotel for me and my wife but as soon as we entered the room, I asked the management to cancel the other nights. The room as veeery small (no place for the suitcases opened), no elevator to our floor (and my wife is pregnant - we told them), and a strange decor in our opinion, The good thing is that they cared about out complains and offered us an upgrade,but we had already booked another place. The localization is very good.

Reviews.Title: “Great Bargain”
Reviews.Author: Marybs6
Reviews.Content: Other reviewers have covered the advantages of staying here very well, great location for walking to many sights, the convenient metro, the on-and-off bus stopping a couple blocks away, nice staff, clean rooms, and many good restaurants within three blocks. The hotel is also a real bargain for it's excellent location. We had a quiet room on the top floor which gave us a bathroom with a skylight (very nice), but required us to walk up a flight of stairs because the elevator doesn't go that high. Not a problem for us but it may well be for some. The ceiling slanted so low that my husband couldn't walk in half the room without bumping his head. Luckily I'm short so my side of the bed was determined by the ceiling! My husband would have preferred a shower head mounted high up instead of at the tub level. But those were small problems compared to the many benefits of the hotel. It was our sixth stay in Paris and while we liked all the hotels we've stayed at before for various reasons, many are now priced at $500-$700 a night convincing us to look for something else. This is our new favorite Paris hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Room for the Price”
Reviews.Author: MBA60302
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a three-day stay at the Hotel La Tour Maubourg. We booked a standard-size room (at 198 Euro on Orbitz). While it was cosy, it was more than adequate for our needs. We were traveling with 6 bags (all but one of a size that would qualify as "carryon luggage" on most planes) and, upon initially entering the room, were skeptical that we would be able to fit our things in. But, within 20 minutes, we had managed to find places for them all. The room was on the front of the hotel, overlooking the park. It was somewhat noisy at night, as we kept the windows open, so there were sounds of traffic and distant sirens. But the room was no more noisy than many other hotels or apartments located in a bustling world-class city. The decor was a bit brash -- red walls and pink bed spread -- but the bed was a good size and comfortable. The bathroom had a bath tub with wall mounted shower spray, and was of adequate size -- bath linens were reasonably thick and large, and there were even complimentary terry robes. Not only was the wifi free, it was quite fast. As others have mentioned, the location is just terrific and staff quite helpful. We did not try the breakfast as it is 16 Euro per person, instead opting for croissant & coffee at 5.5 Euro at a nearby cafe. We would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Location!”
Reviews.Author: GDF68
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here to celebrate our joint birthdays. We were very encouraged by the TA reviews and decided to book the junior suite. The hotel is utterly charming, in a superb location and the staff very friendly and helpful. They recommended and subsequently booked a local restaurant for the second night of our stay which was also fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful location”
Reviews.Author: Jody1976
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from our holdiay where we stayed for four nights at Hotel de Latour Maubourg in Paris. I booked this hotel based on the reviews on this website, and I was very happy to see that they were completely true. We had a wonderful stay with this hotel, even though the room was very small, and my husband did hit his head a couple of times, we found the room to be cosy, quaint and very comfortable. We didn't hear the noise that other reviews have commented on, and we thought that the decor was really nice in comparison to some other hotels we had stayed in. One thing that we loved was the staff in this hotel. Everytime we needed to organise something they were so eager to help and so patient. We needed to confirm one of our tour bookings, but this is made difficult by the fact that we don't speak french, but the ladies on the front desk were more than willing to help. Even though she was put on hold for some time. It always felt that nothing was a problem for these girls and after three weeks in Italy and especially where the service in our previous hotel was so poor, we were so appreciative of the help and professional attitudes of these people. The completely contradicted the warnings that other travellers had given us about the Parisians. We didn't opt to have breakfast at the hotel, because we did think that it was a little expensive, but we found some lovely cafes just around the corner that served breakfast for reasonable prices. If you feel tired from a day of wandering around Paris, the little bar/restaurant next door to the hotel offers a nice menu with some really wonderful staff. We enjoyed their company so much that we went there three times over our four night stay. I thiink the other fantastic aspect of this hotel is purely the location. We walked everywhere. It is literally two hundred metres from Les Invalides and a ten to fifteen minute walk to the Eiffel Tower. Just across the road from Les Invalides is a bus stop where can catch the local buses or the Open Tour buses which are great to do if you want to give your legs a rest. Even better, the metro is just across the road from the hotel also. So there is an abundance of public transport around to help you with your stay. But, we walked everywhere from here. It gave us a wonderful opportunity to take in the city and really experience it. We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at this hotel and would definitely return again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Boutique Hotel in Central Paris”
Reviews.Author: jdierickx
Reviews.Content: Very nice boutique hotel in Central Paris. We were very close to all the nicest spots of Paris and this hotel is very well deserved with public transportation. The staff in the hotel is quite nice and helpful with any questions we had. Some improvements may be done for business people like us. It seems like this hotel is more targeted for couples and lovers and everything is not always ready fit for business people (i.e. laundry, almost inexistent fitness room, no dining or snacks service room... but internet is free!). But apart from those small details this is a lovely and charming place to stay in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Ouch---this is value for money?”
Reviews.Author: kswright
Reviews.Content: Okay, I know it's Paris but still...how Trip Advisor readers rate this so highly is beyond me. The hotel has 3 sizes of rooms: standard, superior and deluxe. My husband and I booked a superior. We were coming to Paris at the end of a lengthly trip to Italy and had four bags. The "superior" room overlooked an air shaft and was so tiny the bags literally would not fit in it. They moved us to the "deluxe" room, which was medium sized and would accommodate our bags, but at 300 euros a night it was outrageously overpriced. The decorations, which look quite splendid on the website, are pathetic. Like an amateur tried to decorate a room from flea markets. There was no soundproofing and you could hear everything from the rooms next to you and on top of you. On the plus side, the beds were comfortable. The staff on the front desk was also very, very good, especially Roberta, and helped us with special requests and dinner reservations without a trace of the Parisian attitude. To give the hotel its due (and probably why it charges so much) is the brilliant location. The views from our "deluxe" room were fabulous, of a small park off Invalides, Blvd. La Tour Maubourg is one of the neatest boulevards in Paris and is just around the corner from the hotel. This part of the 7th arrondisment has to be the best place to stay in Paris. . . quiet but with plenty of street life, restaurants, shops, etc., upscale (read expensive) but without the tourist trap feel of the Latin Quarter and Saint Germain or the business-like feel of most of the right bank. My husband and I hadn't been in Paris for ten years and were disappointed at how bad the average brasserie and restaurants had become. They were almost uniformily expensive and mediocre, from the neighborhood of the hotel to the Marais and St. Germain. In the hotel's location, avoid the touted Thomieux bistro like the plague, it's totally disgusting. The hotel desk recommends Cafe des Anges around the corner, which is also not very good. But a few blocks away on La Tour Maubourg is a great, rather upscale restaurant, La Cuisine, that I heartily recommend. There's also a very good Thai place, Thai Villa, on the boulevard a few steps from the hotel. All in all, La Tour Maubourg iis a good place to stay if you can afford a "deluxe" room and aren't expecting accommodations that look like the photos on the website, if only for the location. My husband and I spent an afternoon walking around the area looking for better hotels. There aren't any...a scattering of two stars and one Best Western that didn't look much better until you get closer to the Eiffel Tower and all the tourist innundation that location implies.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Parisian Accommodations”
Reviews.Author: Robertmartine
Reviews.Content: We booked at the Hotel de Latour Maubourg based on its location and the reviews we saw on this Web site. We were not disappointed. It is ideally situated on a relatively quiet street on the Left Bank within walking distance of the Eiffel , the Seine , several important musuems, and numerous fine restaurants. It also has a Metro stop directly across the street enabling visitors to connect to any part of the city in a matter of minutes. The accommodations were spacious (for Paris), beautifully attired and reasonably priced (again for Paris). The staff is also extremely helpful. A stay also includes breakfast and there is a room where visitors have access to the Internet. All in all, we couldn' t have stayed at a better small, but accommodating, lodging. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Two night stay in Paris - one awful the other great!!!”
Reviews.Author: lyogeo
Reviews.Content: I spent hours and hours searching guide books and trip adviser to find the perfect hotel to take my girlfriend to Paris in order to celebrate her Birthday. The hotels faultless reviews on trip advisor swung it for me and I booked the hotel well in advance. The hotel seemed perfect I could not wait for a romantic weekend away from London. I emailed the hotel in advance with some questions such as restaurant recommendations and I was impressed by the speed and detail of the reply. Everything was going well and I was penning a perfect trip advisor review in my head before I even arrived!… Then as I was literally leaving my home for Kings Cross the hotel called me to tell me that the hotel was full due to a guest staying an extra day and that I was being moved into a suite in their sister hotel Grand Hotel De Champagne, I had no choice will only an hour until my train left London but to accept the change. When I arrived at the Hotel De Champagne I was so upset. This hotel was horrible (very shabby tasteless décor bright orange sofas in room uncomfortable bed about all in all about as romantic as a porter cabin) it was clearly in a different league from the hotel I had booked as can be seen from its mixed reviews on TA. I was very very upset. I called the La Tour to get Lugi’s (receptionist) mobile, I called and calmly explained how unhappy I was. This was his response in a text message ‘I think there might be the possibility of coming back to la tour tomorrow but I am a little afraid that our quarter might appear quite uninteresting compared to the one you are in… also the room we could offer you could appear smaller and old style’ this is not the fantastic customer service described in the reviews I had read. I moved into la tour the next day and it was lovely, a great location and the room I had ordered was just as described very romantic and French I was just very very disappointed to only have one night . The hotel at first offered to pay my taxi from the old hotel to the one I had booked but I quietly persuaded them to upgrade me from superior room to deluxe and did not pay for the first night (at my suggestion) however I would have much rather paid for two nights at the hotel I had booked. To sum up this hotel really let me down and I had to ask for the remedy I received. However had this cock up not occurred I would have given the hotel a top review as it was very charming and in a fantastic location.

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Nortraveller70
Reviews.Content: We spent hours on the internet searching for the perfect hotel for our 4th trip to Paris. We choose this hotel due to its location and all the great recommondations on Trip Advisor. Our expectations was sky high before our trip, and we where almost sure to be disapointed. But there was no need - it was perfect. A charming little hotel, with a wonderful staff. A special thanks to Luigi, who answerd all our questions with a smile, and recommended a genuine french restaurant for us with great food. We have never met so friendly people in any hotel ever before. We loved every minute of our stay, and are sure to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: BritTim
Reviews.Content: Hotel latour Maubourg is a perfect hotel and nestled in a very convenient and ideal location in Paris. It was my fiancees and I first time to Paris and picked this hotel because it was close to the Eiffel Tower and it only has 17 rooms. The reviews were great so we booked it. It is right in front of the la tour maubourg metro stop which is extremely convenient and you cant miss it because its called La tour Maubourg. The reception desk was very nice and helpful. Our room was number 3 right behind the desk which is different from US hotels but it was surprisingly nice. We didn't here any commotion. We booked the standard room which was plenty if you're on a budget. This room had plenty of room since you here that European hotels rooms are normally small but this room was perfect. It had a nice bathroom and we had our own access to the small garden. Our room was on the backside of the hotel so we didn't here any commotion from the street. The room service was excellent. If you walk in a circle of the street the hotel is on you will find an ATM, I believe 3 or 4 cafes, and a convenient store along with a great bakery just down the street. There is a wonderful garden right in front of the hotel were we just picked up sandwiches from the cafe and ate there. Overall, we really had a great experience from this hotel which makes the rest of the trip relaxing. You do need a day to relax at the hotel from all the walking and site seeing you'll do in Paris so it's great to have something nice to come back to. I would recommend getting the top 10 Paris book. It has city maps and metro maps that are exactly what they have in the metro stations. It explains the sites you can see in Paris as well as hours of operation and days and times when you can go site see for cheap or for even nothing. For example: my fiancee and I went to the louvre for free (saving 18Euros for the two of us) because the book said ages 18-26 will enter for free after 6pm on Fridays.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous!!!”
Reviews.Author: JoeB_Sydney
Reviews.Content: This was one of our favourite hotels we stayed at during our travels throughout Europe. The location is brilliant, just a short stroll to many of the cities sites. We chose this hotel based on TripAdvisors reviews, and I have to say the reviews are pretty accurate. The staff are excellent, in particular Luigi at reception, he was so helpful and made our stay stress free and very pleasant. I along with my wife highly recommend this hotel. Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: gcardale
Reviews.Content: Very enjoyable stay, beautiful hotel, excellent reception staff, charming room, lovely finishing touches, very convenient location.

Reviews.Title: “Great!”
Reviews.Author: alsky
Reviews.Content: This was a great little hotel in a perfect location in Paris. Hotel was very cute and authentic francais! Hotel staff was friendly and helpful. Room was small but had all the amenities. If you take a right out of the hotel and cross la tour maubourg, there are lots of little cute cafes, grocery stores and patisseries down there. It is in a great location, walking distance of EVERYTHING--we used no transportation other than our feet! Definitely recommend this hotel! Also has free Wi-FI!

Reviews.Title: “A great base from which to explore Paris”
Reviews.Author: Cudrefin
Reviews.Content: I spent 5 nights at La Tour Maubourg hotel with my family in August 2008. We selected the hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews, hotel price and location (we wanted to stay somewhere that was fairly central to the main attractions and with good access to the Metro). Hotel Location: The hotel is situated right on the edge of Les Invalides and directly outside the La Tour Maubourg Metro station. There are enough cafes and restaurants nearby to satisfy most people. The hotel is well placed for attractions being a 15-20 minute walk from the Eiffel Tower, Champs Elysees and Jardin des Tuileries. There is a lovely view from the front of the hotel over a small park area with a fountain. The reservation: We booked the room directly through the hotel website as I prefer to deal directly with the hotel rather than through a third-party booking agency. Making the reservation was easy and we quickly received email confirmation of our booking. We then received a futher email from the hotel requesting information about our preferences regarding beds (double, twin, etc.), newspapers and even the colour of the roses (nice touch). Although check-in is from 1:00 pm the hotel said that they would try to have the room ready earlier as we expected to arrive around 9:00 am. Check-in: We arrived at the hotel at 1.00 pm (we walked the couple of miles from St Michel to the hotel and stopped for breakfast so we were later than anticipated) although true to their word the hotel had made the room available from 10:00 am. The welcome we received from Eva on reception was great and we immediately felt very much at home The room: We opted for the junior suite as our daughter is only 5 years of age and we expected to be spending quite a lot of time in the room, particularly in the evening. The room was placed on the top (3rd) floor and I would guess has been converted from what was once the attic. The suite consisted of a lounge area with desk and chaise longue (which doubled as an extra bed), a bedroom area with a huge double bed, a separate bathroom with a shower, separate bath and twin wash basins. The toilet was in its own room at the other end of the suite from the bathroom. The decor of the room was quite unusual, having a plum coloured theme with printed fabric covering the walls. With the suite being in the attic there were skylights in place of normal windows. There was a minibar in the room and space for storing clothes in the bathroom. There was an LCD television mounted on a wall above the desk. Although slightly unconventional, the suite was really nice and comfortable and we loved it. Hotel services: We didn't make much use of the hotel services (breakfast, bar, etc.) so it's not possible to pass comment on these areas. The reception staff we dealt with were very good and were able to provide any information that we required about the city and its attractions. A nice touch was the free wireless internet connection. The stay: Housekeeping did a great job of keeping the room clean and tidy during our stay and overall we were very happy with all aspects of the hotel service. Other information: The complimentary bottle of champagne in our room on arrival was a perfect start to the holiday. Shutters on the skylights could be closed by remote control - very useful for keeping the room dark in the morning. Also, with the room being at the very top of the hotel you didn't get other guests passing your room waking you up. The air conditioning was excellent. There were no tea or coffee making facilities in the room. The shower was a bit on the small side. Having the clothes storage in the bathroom was slightly unusual. The toilet didn't have a towel rail in the room so the towel had to be tucked behind the basin tap - a small point but the sort of detail I would expect to be covered with an advertised room rate of 460 euros per night. The ceiling sloped at either side into the eaves making the suite feel smaller than it actually was. I tended to duck when I didn't need to and then forget to keep my head down when I should have :) High points: Paris is still a fantastic city although I prefer it out of the summer season. The public transport system is superb and relatively cheap. La Tour Maubourg is a great hotel if what you want is somewhere comfortable and quiet to stay within easy reach of the heart of Paris. We got a good deal on the room rate which made it a lot more affordable. Low points: Wow! Paris is expensive these days if you are visiting from the UK. Don't expect to pay less than 10-15 euros (£8-12) for a fairly basic meal. A pint (well, 500ml) beer will set you back around 8 euros (£6-7) in just about any standard bar/restaurant in the city centre. We paid over 30 euros (£25) for 2 croissants, 2 small pieces of bread, 1 crepe, 1 lemonade and 2 coffees. I thought that Disneyland was overpriced (139 euros or £110 entry charge for 2 adults and a child for the most basic entrance package) and overcrowded - expect to queue for 20 to 90 minutes for most of the rides. The food was not great or cheap their either. Conclusion: This is a lovely little (only 17 rooms I believe) hotel in a great location. This hotel is probably not for people who expect a huge range of hotel services to be available but as a base to expore the city it is absolutely perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent hotel and people”
Reviews.Author: kalos080808
Reviews.Content: Very nice bedroom and very kind and dedicated staff. Excellent souvenir. Next stop in Paris will be for sur, in this hotel. Next to the Invalides and Tour Eiffel.

Reviews.Title: “Quality and Style in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Caroline1456
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel, the staff were friendly and helpful and always had a bonjour or bonsoir! The hotel is boutique and is really quality. Location is superb - quiet area with plenty of cafes on a quiet road. Metro station could not be nearer, and beside the Invalides and a lovely stroll from the Effiel tower. We stayed in a standard room which was petit but more than adequate, the furnishings were beautiful and such attention to detail was appreciated. Very clean and bright bathroom with shower over bath and lovely fresh roses! Breakfast was lovely, again attention to detail on the tables and plenty of choice. It was a pleasant experence in the downstairs breakfast room. I cannot recommend this hotel enough - it is great value for money, in a great location which felt really safe and was perfect for a break in Paris. A credit to the staff - well done!

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel in great neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: pamulla
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room and bath with air conditioning. Old world decor with real art. Totally agreeable staff who went above and beyond to assist us for our short time in Paris. Dropped our bags before checkin and reception held them, delivered them to our room and even assisted with dinner arrangements that evening that turned out great. lovely neighborhood: walk down Rue La Tour Maubourg to Rue Cler for shops, cafes, boulangeries Taxi stand and Metro station across the street; quiet and safe neighborhood but walk to the Seine, the Louvre

Reviews.Title: “Loved La Tour Maubourg!”
Reviews.Author: 243travel
Reviews.Content: The rooms at this hotel are full of great touches. Our room had fresh flowers every day, bathrobes and slippers, champagne and a plate of cookies; the bathroom had a heated towel rack, a shower and a separate tub. It is extremely clean! The location is excellent and you will find lots of places to choose for dinner within walking distance. Service was friendly and very helpful. The area is very peaceful, you will not be woken up by street noise. We will be staying here everytime we visit Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely coming back.”
Reviews.Author: MontyAustralia
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a 3 night stay in July. Our only regret is that it wasn't much longer. We have stayed in a wide variety of accommodation over the last 4 months, and this hotel was amongst the best. Friendly and helpful staff become very important when you are away from home for a long time, and the staff here were excellent. I support all previous comments re charming decor, cleanliness, plentiful and varied breakfast, guest lounge and quirky little courtyard, great location near metro and major sights, and good nearby restaurants. We treated ourselves to the suite on the top floor, with an enormous bathroom, but looking at the rooms the next price level down, it would appear they are equally as spacious, with standard size bathrooms. I too would prefer doonas and bigger pillows. We usually like to try different hotels on return visits, but when returning to Paris, will look no further than the La Tour Maubourg.

Reviews.Title: “Great little hotel!”
Reviews.Author: 10seman
Reviews.Content: My wife, two teenage daughters and I just completed a 4 night stay at this hotel. I lived in Paris years ago, and have stayed at several small hotels closer to the Isle de la Cite. I found this hotel on TripAdvisor and decided to give it a try. I'm glad I did! It was the best yet, especially for the money. When all three girls in my house are pleased, it must be good! The hotel was quite charming and comfortable. The staff went out of its way to help in every way. They arranged a car to pick us up at the airport and booked two restaurant reservations in advance. They also gave us a street-level map to help with directions to find one restaurant, provided umbrellas for the one day it rained, and brought us forks one day when we brought back pastries to eat in their courtyard. The metro stop directly across from the hotel is a great plus for Paris, as was the convenience to the RER (commuter train) that saved time for several destinations. Rue Cler is just down the street, and we found a couple of great restaurants within an easy walk (Chez L'Ami Jean and Pasca). I'd definitely suggest this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Latour!”
Reviews.Author: CSFL
Reviews.Content: We (my mom and I) stayed at the Latour Maubourg, after doing extensive research and e-mails. We used tripadvisor, and loved the hotel and the staff. Roberta always replied to the e-mails, and everyone at the desk was helpful with directions and bookings. We stayed there for 9 days in a deluxe room, which was roomy and well decorated. The rooms and the hotel are kept immaculately clean, which is always a plus when traveling overseas. I can not speak for the size of the smaller rooms, but can tell you that room 11 with the rose bathroom was great! Excellent for walking to the Eiffel Tower and Champs. We also found the metro across the street to be an excellent help. The two cafes at the end of the block have good food, the one across the street, we liked better. I hope this helps someone else have as wonderful a time as we did.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: flower675
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful trip made all the more special by the hotel. 27-29 June. Although I have visited Paris before this was my husbands first visit and we both loved every minute of our stay. The hotel gave us directions fron CDG airport via train (8 euros each way) very straightforward. We were in room 1 which is on the ground level at the front of the building it is gorgeous and very spacious, the walls are quite thin though we could hear someone in the next room snoring! This was probably because there is a connecting door to the next room.Although there is no bath the shower is enourmous. The staff were lovely nothing was too much trouble. Try Restaurant Pasco's booked for us by the hotel its just across the square the food is excellent. Good breakfast and plenty of it, If you plan to go up the Eiffle Tower it opens at 9am we got there at 8:45 and were in the second lift up expect to wait about 2hrs later in the day. Can't wait to return

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Intrepids6-
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at La Tour Maubourg in Paris and would recommend this hotel. We arrived in Paris via Train at Gare Paris Lyon and decided to metro it to the hotel. Caught the metro to Madeleine and then transferred to La Tour Maubourg line. On exiting from the Metro we found the hotel was directly opposite - fantastic. We booked a superior room which overlooked the courtyard. The room was a good size with king size bed and tastefully decorated. The only down side, if any, was you could hear people going up and down the stairs if there through the day, but being in Paris you don't spend a great deal of time in your room so it was no issue of a night. The staff were great and very helpful. Would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: RoulaMaria
Reviews.Content: This is a terrific hotel, especially for those who would like to explore Paris on foot! The location is excellent: right stack dab in the middle of everything...a 2 minute walk to Les Invalides (where you find Napoleon's tomb and the army museum), and add another 2 minutes and you find yourself in the Musee Rodin. You are 10 minutes away from the place de concorde (where u r in proximity with the vendome, Madeleine church, the opera, and galleries lafayette, Louvre...etc.). Notre Dame de Paris is only a bit further. The hotel is also set in a beautiful area, for if you walk to the right side after the hotel's main entrance, u find yourself in an area filled with lovely bakeries, cafes, and boutiques, until you reach the Eiffel Tower (10 minutes walking distance). St. Michel and St Germain r also close by, and so is the Champs Elysees. A metro station is also less than ten steps away from the hotel door. The rooms are well-sized, comfortable, clean, and speak history! the bathrooms r also spotless, and breakfast is great, with all kinds of cheeses, pastries, juice, cereals, yogurt, and hot beverages (try the hot chocolate). The area is very peaceful, so for those who like to spend the night without being woken up by street noise, this is the perfect place! We loved this hotel, and would defnitely stay in it another time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Small Hotel in the 7th”
Reviews.Author: AdventureNow49
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this lovely hotel for 7 nights in late May and early June and were delighted by the friendly and very competent staff (both day and night) for whom no request or question was too difficult. It is situated in a lovely and less frantic area of Paris, a few blocks from the famous Rue Cler with its convenient Les Halles, Franprix and good shopping. A taxi stand and the La Tour-Maubourg metro are across the street; many brasseries are within a short distance of the hotel as is Les Invalides, with a slightly longer walk to La Musee Rodin. The Eiffel Tower and the Crystal Palace can be seen in the distance. The hotel is happy to have you borrow its Paris and France guidebooks. Our rooms (two different ones) for two separate stays were clean, comfortable, attractive, air-conditioned and had two Juliet balconies (room numbers 11 and 1). There were bathrobes, champagne and a plate of cookies at each stay; the bathroom had a heated towel rack. Maid service was outstanding: the maid noticed we each needed 2 pillows (there was a total of 3) and provided the 4th without being asked. WiFi is available in room. There is some intrusive street noise due to the brasseries close by, but it is Paris, after all. A charming hotel, nicely situated, and one to which I intend to return.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: V888
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for one night in June 2008. It's pretty compact and the lift is a bizarre experience - especially when the staff come along for the ride - but all in all a superb stay. The location is spot on - a very nice area and loads of life nearby. Good shops and market type stalls offering amazing looking food. Room was tiny - although they do definitely have bigger ones. Just avoid room 16 if size is an issue for you!

Reviews.Title: “Great little spot”
Reviews.Author: RM3110
Reviews.Content: Great reviews led me to book this hotel - they were not wrong. This is a small boutique hotel in a very good area of Paris. All the comments on the staff are correct - very friendly, very helpful. We stayed in the top floor "junior suite" which is a bit mis-leading in that its not really a suite but a large attic like bedroom with very large bed and sofa bed, plus large bathroom including bath and shower and 2 sinks. Being picky you could say the low roof might be a bit of a nuisance to somebody tall but for us it addeed to the charm of the place. Breakfast was taken in the converted cellar area which was very nice. At 16Euros breakfast isnt cheap but there was lots of it and you dont go to Paris counting the pennies. Nearby - ie across the street - there are a bucketful of really good cafes/restaurants, and you will be at the base of the Eiffel Tower in 10 minutes. The access to the metro station is outside the front door, but we walked most places, the Louvre is 20 mins at asteady pace. I would try and negotiate a deal if you can but I reckon this place has and will get a lot of custom so dont expect silly cheap rates.

Reviews.Title: “Great 2nd stay at La Tour Maubourg!”
Reviews.Author: Paris1scarf
Reviews.Content: On the front end of a Provence tour, we stayed 3 days in our favorite 7th district hotel! Once again, the staff is absolutely the reason we stay here! They ask about our daughter, who is a student nearby. They make reservations for us, they take care of us, they are like family. Our pretty room had oil paintings, and a huge bathroom. Located in a quiet area near Invalides, Eiffel, and Rue Cler, there is a cab stand out front , and the Metro! So, you can hop on the Metro and go anywhere. Every time we go to Paris, we do different walks. Try the Pere Lachaise Cemetery for a beautiful stroll through a parklike setting, full of uniquely sculpted mauseleums, and the resting place for many well known figures.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, awesome staff”
Reviews.Author: wilhelm1
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel, bathroom could be cleaner. Good for those of you who like a quieter area. A little expensive for what you get - def. a 3 star. But the staff were absolutely and completely perfect - super friendly, and the metro station is across the street. Also, all the big sites are close, and there are two nice cafes close by for breakfast, and some shops for food. No room fridge which is a definite minus. I have also stayed in the Latin Quarter and prefer the hussle and bussle of that area and the the closeness of the Marais for little street exploring. But if all you want to do is see the big sites, this hotel is a good location - too quiet for me.

Reviews.Title: “April in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Calamanco
Reviews.Content: Weekend with my husband in April. Very good position opposite the metro. Good area for small restaurants and the staff were very helpful booking these. Perhaps not in the buzzy part of town but I preferred the quieter feel with locals wandering around getting their shopping. Had breakfast at bistro to the right when you come out and across the road. Croissant is not enough for my husband so he had their brunch, which was omletter and then bread and croissant. Perfect and a better price than the hotel. Hotel room was large and comfortable overlooking the front. Bathroom good - bath area a little dated, good basin All in all wonderful weekend. Would go back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way.”
Reviews.Author: jllb24
Reviews.Content: A beautiful hotel in a perfect location. Our room was perfectly decorated and the bathroom was a good size. The reception staff could not be more helpful. The metro was literally over the road from the hotel which made everything very convenient. The Effiel tower was a ten minute walk away. We didn't have breakfast as we thought the price was a little steep but walked to a patisserie around the corner and sat with our pastries in the gardens of the Effiel Tower. We could not have wished for a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good stay at a lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sea_Bass_21
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed one night at this hotel in May and enjoyed our stay. We booked the most basic room on Venere.com for a discount rate but the room was quite cute and tastefully decorated with high cielings and a comfortable bed. The bathroom was a very good size with a cool, colorful tile decoration and my wife loved the bathrobes. My only issues with the room was that it was hard to move by each other as it was a narrow room. My wife did not like that there was only a mirror in the bathroom and not a larger one in the room itself. Very minor issues for us since we were only there one night but may be an issue for a couple staying several nights. These things did not bother us much since we weren't in Paris to stay in the room the whole time. The decor of the hotel itself is wonderful and it's location right next to the Invalides is awesome for getting around. The staff at the hotel are what make this place great. Salim went out of his way to help us find a great restaurant on a very busy night and offered great advice and was very friendly and funny. The other staff were great as well and I wish every hotel could have such wonderful employees. You can tell they really care about the hotel and want their guest to have a great stay while they are there. The area right around the hotel has a few good restaurants and cafes nearby but there are good places just a few minutes away on St. Germain. I would definitly stay at this hotel again though I think I would pay a little more a for a higher room class if I was there for more than a few days. I would not hesitate to recommend this place to others.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in Paris”
Reviews.Author: Wand3rl0st
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on reviews in Trip Advisor. We would be arriving in Paris after a 2 week low budget trip through Morocco and we wanted a nice but not extravagant hotel. The hotel was extremely easy to get to using public transit. It is directly across the street from the Metro station. The location is diagonally across from Les Invalides and is within easy walking distance of every attraction. Although located in a busy section of Paris, the hotel is on a very quiet street. On arrival we were greeted cordially by the desk person and we discovered that we were upgraded to a deluxe room at no charge. European hotel rooms have a reputation for being on the smallish size. The room we had was huge, even compared to North American standards. It was immaculate, well appointed, faced the park and had everything we required. The bathroom, a sore spot in many European hotels, could have graced the covers of decorating magazines. The staff at the desk were very courteous, provided us easy directions to the places we wanted to visit, provided us tips on getting around and avoiding lineups and were generally very helpful. My wife was ill on one of the days that we stayed there and staff made certain that she was comfortable and not disturbed. Breakfast was served in the small basement dining area. The baseement also houses the sauna, the exercise equipement and the computer room. Breakfast was exactly what I expected and I was not disappointed. Fresh juice, cereral, croissant, bread, pasteries, jam, cheese, yougurt, cold cuts and strong coffee. At 15 euro, it's steep compared to North American standards but is what one can expect in Paris. After visiting this hotel I can understand why it gets strong reviews and I would certainly recommend it to others who would like to stay in a centrally located, small, friendly hotel in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Good but good value?”
Reviews.Author: Andy Wilson
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed 2 nights at the Hotel de la Tour Maubourg to celebrate our 25th Wedding Anniversary. Being a special occassion I booked Deluxe Room (no.12) at a web rate of Euro300 per night (rack rate Euro360). With current exchange rates that is around £250 per night, excluding breakfast (Euro16 per person). The hotel is in a good location within easy walking of the main Paris attractions but there is a Metro station and taxi rank right outside. There are many good restaurants nearby. The reception staff were very helpful and friendly before and during our stay and helped us with room selection and booked a restaurant for us. The room was nicely furnished and of a good size and was very clean. Being honest the bathroom could do with updating and would have benefited from a proper shower cubicle as opposed to an over the bath fitting. The bathroom was adequate and not, in my view, 'deluxe'. We had a great time in Paris and enjoyed staying at this hotel but I'm not convinced that it represented good value for money. I was expecting a slightly higher standard or something a little more special for the price paid.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Find”
Reviews.Author: jshWilmington_De_
Reviews.Content: We booked our trip thru Traveladvisor.com and could not have been happier. We lived in Paris in the 80's for three years and had not been back since. We lived in the 7th arrondissment and wanted to stay in the same neighborhood, so we were delighted to find Hotel de La Tour Maubourg. The staff was wonderful and very quick to help with any needs we had. Our room was cleaned spotlessly each day and our bathroom was huge. This location is wonderful...the Metro is across the street, also a taxi stand on the corner, a 10 min. walk to the Eiffel Tower, another 10 min. walk to the Champs Elysee, restaurants are abundant and cafes are on every corner. It was a trip to remember and this Hotel made it just perfect. Would recommend highly! After a week in Paris, we went on to Nice. I left behind a travel iron and when we e-mailed them, they agreed to mail it off to our hotel in Nice and 2 days later, it arrived. Terrific service and a charming french hotel...Johanna and Carl...Wilmington, DE.

Reviews.Title: “Great find”
Reviews.Author: sjc195
Reviews.Content: We spent two days in a superior room, and had a wonderful time. The room was immaculate, with a very comfortable bed. While some have mentioned that breakfast is expensive (what is cheap in Paris?), it was delicious, and nearly worth the price given the comfortable surroundings. I had an unexpected need for printing services while I was there. The staff went out of their way to help me locate services in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous little gem of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: Annasdad2002
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 night stay at this hotel, which we had booked as a result of Trip Advisor reviews, and it was better than we could have hoped for. Excellent location right next to a Metro station and with plenty cafes and restaurants nearby, it felt really safe and secure for wandering in the evening We were lucky enough to have been upgraded to a superior room, which was not huge but had everything that you could need. It was beautifully decorated and kept very clean. As mentioned by other reviewers the reception staff were particularly helpful and full of knowledgeand nothing was too much trouble. We didn't eat breakfast at the hotel as we were up and about early each morning. We did use the Hamman steam room which was nice on our aching legs after seeing all that Paris had to offer. We ate at Chez Francois about 10 minutes walk away under the Air France building and it was excellent - much nicer inside than it looks from the outside! Would we go back again - MOST DEFINITELY!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: craftycamel
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at the hotel with 6 friends. We felt the whole ambience was exclusive and yet cosy. The staff were friendly and went out of their way to help with any queries. The rooms are a little small but all individually maintaned and decorated in the Napoleonic III style which was fun. We loved the chandeliers. The situation of the hotel in the 7th was perfect with easy access to most of the sights and only 10 minutes walk from the Eiffel Tower. The only negative was the small breakfast area. Overall a great stay! Peter and Debra Hobbs ... GUERNSEY

Reviews.Title: “A fantastic find”
Reviews.Author: nigecathy
Reviews.Content: After many visits to Paris we have found the perfect hotel. The hotel staff were incredibly helpful and we received a very warm welcome. We had a Superior room (Room 14 ) and this was beautiful and quiet. The hotel had booked a table for us at La Fontaine de Mars, a place reallly worth visiting. Breakfast supeb. Cannot fault the place or staff.Great location. Thanks to the reviews on Trip Advisor and Bookings.com. Cannot wait to return !

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay at Hotel de La Tour Maubourg”
Reviews.Author: courtmac62
Reviews.Content: Never been to Paris before and it didn't disappoint. After a few calls to the hotel we negotiated a good deal thanks to the management and of course Salim. All staff we met over the 4 days were so helpful with bookings and local info. The room we stayed in was regal and we aimed for this particular room thanks to previous reviews on trip advisor. The hotel location is quite central and at the same time an exceptionally safe part of the city. We walked to the Eiffel tower in no time at all. Metro 30 meters from hotel along with taxi rank. Paris really wowed us and looking forward to many more long weekends there. I say thank you again to the staff at the Hotel, see you next year! Mark & Tracy

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: ByAirMail
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for a long weekend in April 2008. The hotel I reserved based on good ratings given by fellow travelers from the hotel website. Booking was easy and worked well. We booked a superior room and the cost was 200€ per night. For that rate I expect to receive comfort even knowing Paris is an expensive city. The room was pleasing, not too small, very tidy, and the interior was also pleasing -even romantic. Housekeeping did excelent work keeping the towels, etc always fresh. Location of the hotel is good and right next to the Metro station. Only positive things to say about the reception staff, they were nice and friendly. Only improment I can spot is the usage of "some kind of standard air refreshener" which to me smells bad. Luckily it quite nicely went away just by opening the windows. We can recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Ok, clean, good location...........but”
Reviews.Author: travel062
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the La Tour Maubourg last week for a 2 night stay. On arrival was allocated a nice basic clean room on the second floor. The room was quiet warm and the a/c was not working. Called reception and the guy came to take a look, after inspection told me that all the a/c units where affected with the issue and it would be fixed the next day. The next day was a beautiful warm spring day in Paris and on returning from the hotel the a/c was still out and the room was baking hot. Still no fix and it was now friday night. Had a dreadfull nights sleep (person upstairs banging around). So to summerise. If i stay at a hotel and the a/c is not functioning and i raise it as an issue with the staff, i would expect a quick resolution, move to a room that is cooler or a reduction on the bill offered, none of these transpired. The Hotel is nice, clean and in a great location so dont let this put you off but a/c is sometimes important to some people and im one of them

Reviews.Title: “A Perfect Stay”
Reviews.Author: kengor
Reviews.Content: A fantastic location, comfortable room, friendly and helpful staff and clean and beautiful surroundings made this hotel a perfect stay for my wife and I. As many have reported on this site, the staff is exceptional - accomodating and friendly. You feel at the end of the day as if you have come home. The location is unbeatable. I often doubt descriptions such as "conveniently located" or "right across from Metro", but in Hotel LT Maubourg, these are absolutely spot on. You literally cross a small two lane side road to get to the metro stop - its embarrasingly close. I heard no noise from the Metro either and I consider myself a light sleeper. The hotel is in 7e, and we walked to Invalides (which is very close), the Eifel Tower (maybe ten minutes), the Louvre (a little farther, but a nice walk), shopping, restaurants and beautiful architecture. What more can you want? There are many excellent restaurants in easy (less than five minutes) walking distance from the Hotel. I can give my enthusiastic endorsement to Le Florimond (on av. d.l. Motte-Picquet), Bistrot Le P'tit Trouquet (on rue de l'Exposition) and Au Petit Tonneau (on rue Surcouf). Of course, the hotel staff is happy to make reservations for you. Do not hesitate to make your reservation at this fantastic small hotel - we certainly will be on our next trip to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: Matador77
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel based on the TripAdvisor feedback and we were pleasantly surprised. The staff is extremely polite, room was impeccable, clean and the free wireless was a nice touch after having stayed at the Monte Carlo Bay Resort where they wanted an extra 20 euros for internet! location is excellent, metro across the street, walking distance to major sites as well as cafes, bistros, markets, etc all around. Less touristy than many other areas. Very QUIET as well, no street noise or guest room noise. A real plus. I would call this place a B&B over a hotel, has that feel to it. The only glitch seems to be on the transportation, the shuttle from the airport was booked and the return as well. However when I checked with the night desk prior to our departure he didnt seem to have the info and suggested a taxi would be better anyway and confirmed one for the next morning. Upon checkout on the 6th, the morning desk manager showed our shuttle was in fact booked for that days return. Anyway, we took the cab and it ended up being very expensive but it was our choice. I don't consider this a reflection on the hotel but buyer beware when booking transportation around.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Googoletta
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay tremendously! The hotel was very nice, clean and charming. The staff was very pleasant. The location was very central for all of the sites and museums we wanted to see. Metro access the was across the street. There are excellent bistros near by, on the corners. We had petit dejeuner (breakfast) at the hotel. It was very convenient and good. I will recommend this hotel to friends. Other recommendations: Paris Museum Pass and Paris Visite Pass (public transportation). Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, pretty rooms”
Reviews.Author: ughboot
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very romantic in a quaint converted mansion. The location is very convenient to the major sites and the metro, although it may not have the ambiance of staying somewhere like the Marais (but that's a personal taste issue). The staff were lovely, our only small hiccup was when we needed a few minutes rest between museums and we were not able to use the room as the cleaners were still busy... not a big issue. The Hammam steam bath is well worth trying. We had a superior room, which was sufficiently large with a nice bathroom. The bed was comfortable and the room was quiet, with a nice view. We booked our room at a promotional price of around 180 euro a night (it was a special occassion for us). I don't think we would have booked it for its full normal price.

Reviews.Title: “A Gem in the Heart of Paris”
Reviews.Author: YorkAlfaMan
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Paris last weekend and had a brilliant stay at the Hotel Latour Maubourg in the heart of the city which is a good distance from the CDG Airport (We used a service called Paris Shuttle to take us there and back- a prebooked mini bus which was excellent). This hotel, though very small , was a real gem. Located 20 metres from the nearest metro and just 5 minute walk from the Eiffel tower and the Champs Elysee, it was perfectly situated . Though expecting something bigger the hotel itself was quite luxurious. The hotel has recently been refurbished and we were in one of the larger ground floor Deluxe Rooms, which was quite stunning in a traditional way (even though the original timber flooring was quite squeaky!). Check the web for deals as we must have paid only half the price that the Hotel advertise it for @360Euros . The room was cleaned daily with linen and towels also changed each day and the attention to detail was impressive. We did not eat in the hotel although from what I could see they only did breakfast, but there are plenty of cafes nearby for the obligatory croissant. There was no separate bar as such but you could get a drink from reception if you wanted. The reception staff were most helpful, and all could speak excellent English , even though we tried out our French, English was the chosen language. Overall an excellent small ,luxurious , quaint hotel. A very lucky choice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location near Eiffel Tower and Metro”
Reviews.Author: Flyboy1968
Reviews.Content: My 8 year old son and I stayed one night at La Tour Maubourg. We paid 150 euro for a twin room. When we arrived, we were upgraded for free to a Junior Suite without asking. The hotel is very nice and very attractice and clean. Seriously. This place looks like a 4 star hotel. The suite was got was on the top floor which was accessed only by stairs. There is an elevator that is VERY, VERY tiny and it will get you to the second floor. The pictures on the website are all very accurate. www.hoteltourmaubourgparis.com Our suite was decorated in purple which make the pictures (attached) sort of funny looking, but, really, the room was very nice. The bathroom was very nice, although the shower stall was very tight, so if you're anything other that large-average size, you'll probably be limited to the tub. I assume the shower size is the same in the non-suite rooms, so it's something to inquire about if you're on the large size. The hotel is direcly across from the La Tour Maubourg Metro stop which makes for easy access to all parts of Paris. It's only about a 10 minute walk to the Eiffel Tower and the neighborhood is very upscale. There are restaurants right next door and the street noise is minimal. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, but tiny rooms. Check what you are going to get before you book”
Reviews.Author: vpe
Reviews.Content: The hotel is quaint and certainly conveniently located. I booked the hotel because of the Tripadvisor reviews and because the hotel website implied that they were providing a special promotional rate for their rooms of about 230 Euros. I booked what they called their Classic Room for 150 Euros, which is about $235 --and this did not include breakfast. By US standards, this is quite expensive. Though Paris hotels are known for their small rooms, this was the smallest room I have ever stayed in. It was probably created by dividing a bigger room and with a width of about 8 feet (I was in #16) it had almost no room to put anything in it. The "closet" had a curtain in front of it and was about 18" wide. Luckily I was traveling alone, with a computer and a carry on--but the room is advertised as a double. If my wife had been with me, and we had a couple more bags, it would have been impossible. There maybe be other Classic Rooms in the hotel that are larger, but you should check which room you are in and make sure. I certainly do not think I got value at 150 euros if room #16 is what other Classic Rooms are like. Even though there may be other attributes that I have not yet sampled, I think the hotel would do well not to advertise these special rates since the implication that what you are getting a normal room at a great promotional price. After all, it generates a response like mine.

Reviews.Title: “Paris in the spring at latour de Maubourg”
Reviews.Author: rockyboyCork
Reviews.Content: We just returned from beautiful Paris last weekend and a lovely stay at the Hotel Latour Maubourg in the heart of the city. This hotel, though very small , was a real gem. Located 20 metres from the nearest metro and just 5 minute walk from the Eiffel tower it was perfectly situated. Though expecting something bigger the hotel itself was quite luxurious and the classic double room was spotless. The room was cleaned daily and the attention to detail was impressive. The reception staff were most helpful,especially Salim who spoke English, and overall it is an experience I would hope to repeat.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel, Excellent Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: addoll
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay at the this hotel. It had a lovely atmosphere and was very clean. The staff was wonderful. We had lots of help from Salim and Roberta and they could not have been kinder or more helpful. The location provided the perfect place to see Paris with many sites nearby and easy access to the metro station just across the street. We would highly recommend this hotel and hope to return one day.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, even better location”
Reviews.Author: goingfor50
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 3 nights at La Tour Maubourg from March 13-16th. It's in a great location, and right across the street from a Metro station. The Eiffel Tower is a 10 minute walk. Other tourist sites (Louvre, Arc de Triumphe, Notre Dame) are a bit further, so we used the Metro to save time. We never ate at the hotel, but there a several cafes right in the area. We had room 22. It was quite small, but was nicely decorated. The bed was not the most comfortable, but we were so tired at the end of the day, it didn't matter. The walls are VERY thin so you can hear conversation next door. The room was very clean, and the bathroom as well. Staff was very friendly and helpful. There is internet access available from 8am-8pm on the hotel laptop. The "gym" is a closet with a treadmill, I think. There is also a steam room in this same "gym" area/closet. We didn't use either because we walked all day, and didn't have the energy for a steam bath. All in all, a good hotel for 150 Euro per night. I would recommend for travelers on a budget, as Paris can get expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great for couples, families might be pushing it.”
Reviews.Author: cabrown
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at Hotel de La Tour Maubourg from 29 FEB to 3 MAR during our stay in Paris (and left the kids at home!). We found the hotel to be comfortable, well located and a good value. Getting to and from the hotel was a breeze. Upon arrival at CDG, we took the Roissy bus to Opera (~€8/person), and then took the Metro to the La Tour Maubourg stop (one carnet, 10 tickets, ~€12). The hotel is just across a small one-way street from the metro. To return to CDG, we hired one of their "recommended" shuttles (~€36 for two) in order to spend more time in the city before leaving that evening. We stayed in room 33. It was small, but completely adequate and comfortable. My only gripe would be that the toilet is only a few centimeters from the wall. Another issue that may bother some people, but did not bother us, is you can actually hear the metro running to and fro. Otherwise, everything was clean and tidy. The hotel staff were completely professional and helpful. The breakfast was good. It is ~€16/person and includes everything you see (as opposed to a tiered offering scheme employed by some hotels). I've done better and worse in Europe. We took advantage of what the hotel offered and filled up each day, took only a snack for lunch, then found dinner elsewhere. If you're looking to head out to eat, the hotel can surely direct you to one of many local cafes or restaurants in the vicinity. You can also just head down to Rue Cler where there are many cafes, bakeries, and other shops in which to purchase things to eat. All in all, I'd recommend this hotel to anyone going to Paris as a couple. There was one family of three that I saw, but I think that with the size of the rooms, any more would be pushing it. In the hotel's defense, I didn't see any of the other rooms to determine their adequacy for families. In the future, I think I'd just save myself the trouble of finding another hotel and stay at Hotel de La Tour Maubourg again as long as they maintain the great level of service they seem to have established.

Reviews.Title: “Great birthday treat”
Reviews.Author: taximummy
Reviews.Content: This was a special trip for our joint 40th birthdays so I did an even more extensive research of reviews of hotels than I normally do (family joke how fussy I am for hotels) and this one came out tops time and time again in my budget (we can't all afford George V prices!). I, like everyone else, was not disappointed, small was definitely friendly here.
