We walked miles in our weekend (take good shoes as most streets cobbled) and saw other hotels in areas you really wouldn't want to stay in (however good their reviews just not worth the risk) and came back to our hotel very happy and lucky our's was so good (also right opposite metro which we also used a lot (once we got used to it!) and about 15/20 minutes transfer from Gare du Nord if using Euro Star like we did. We stayed in a classic room no 24 (I think) very regal looking. If I tried really hard to critise something it would be the bath/shower combo tap played up sometimes, forgot to mention it on check-out but sure they will fix immediately (that type of people/place). Everything else 11/10 and already recommending to friends and family. We liked France before but love it now so much more relaxed than London, not really peak season yet but nothing seemed to open before 10-11am so no rushing anywhere for a change. Brilliant weekend - thank you everyone who made it so good!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: AJLHuddersfield
Reviews.Content: We were celebrating our friend's 65th birthday for a couple of days in Paris. The staff at the hotel were extremely helpful from pick-up service, to organising restaurant bookings, even happy to organise a birthday cake! Location is excellent for strolling out and also there is a Metro and a taxi rank across the road. Would definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: JulesNY
Reviews.Content: Hotel is charming, location is perfect, staff was very courteous and helpful. Room 3 next to the front desk would be great in warm weather, with its small terrace. Room 16 is in the back and very dark, but had a wonderful bathroom! My only real complaint is the quality of the breakfast coffee. Most Americans are now much more discriminating in their appreciation of good, strong coffee (thanks to Oren's, Peet's, Starbucks, etc), and having watery "American"-style coffee in Paris is just unacceptable! That being said, one breakfast server graciously fulfilled my request for two mugs of cafe filtre (espresso) with hot milk, another server was not as cooperative. Other than that very minor complaint, I'd go back in a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Napoleon style room”
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline13
Reviews.Content: I just return from Paris and I can say I was very impressed about the room in the hotel . Also , the location of this small but chic hotel is very good. I will recommend it to my friends

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with a very personal service!”
Reviews.Author: jphypno
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel with my girlfriend & we loved it! The staff were extremely friendly & gave us a very personal service. We stayed for 2 nights & our towels were changed 3 times. On valentines day the hotel gave us a compimentary glass of champagne each & some very tasty heart shaped lollies. The room we stayed in was quite small, but was very clean & the decor was very impressive. We are planning to go back to this hotel later this year but will pay for a bigger room. I cannot fault the hotel & certainly think that the hotel should be rated higher than it is.

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing”
Reviews.Author: xerxes36
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel. The rooms are quite chintzy, in a nice way. Reception staff are extremely helpful and polite. Quiet location, but central - we had a lovely walk by the Seine to the Louvre.

Reviews.Title: “why is this hotel number 5 not number 1”
Reviews.Author: catdea
Reviews.Content: i can not write enough good things about our short stay at this hotel, in our eyes it should be number 1 not 5!!! The staff were amazing from arranging our trip to disneyland to feeding us crossiants at 2 in the morning! our only complaint was our stay was so short, i would recommend to anyone and would never stay anywhere else

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: Victoria012
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel stayed here for 3 nights! Room was small but not tiny! Was lovely and clean!! Loved the hassam - steam bath but extremley hot!! Would definitely stay here again!! Central location practically next door to the metro, which we didn't really use as everything is within walking distance, and mainline station! And the eiffel tower 10 minutes walk!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: viaggiando
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel through the Internet at a rate of 140 €. For this price, I found it excellent. Staff at the reception are VERY kind and helpful, the hotel is nicely decorated in a lively colour scheme, the room had a very reasonable size and a large bathroom. Breakfast was also good. I would definitely recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Friendly & Helpful Staff”
Reviews.Author: NikNak8
Reviews.Content: My wife and I had a wonderful time in Paris. The hotel de la tour Maubourg is in an ideal location within walking distance of most of Paris's major attractions. For those less inclined to walk there is a metro station across the road! The room was very clean, and the small touch of leaving sweets on the pillow make a difference. The staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. I can't remember the ladies name behind reception but she booked us a restaurant 'La Rotisserie du Beaujolais' and it was fabulous. Thank you very much for all your help and helping us thoroughly enjoy our visit to La Belle Paris! We will definitely be back. Lots of Love Keith and Harriet

Reviews.Title: “The Start of The Rest of Our Lives”
Reviews.Author: JulesVerne130108
Reviews.Content: I surprised my Girlfriend for her birthday with a 3 night stay in paris. I was looking for an immaculately presented, comfortable & well located hotel...and indeed i found this with Hotel de La Tour Maubourg, and more. The reception staff could not do enough for you, and the room maids were exceptional too! This trip was very special, as we got engaged during our stay in Paris. We have many special memories from our stay, but i can certainly say that our stay at Hotel de La Tour Maubourg is one of those memories. We would highly recommend this hotel to anyone looking for an incredibly well decorated and presented hotel, perfectly situated for seeing all Paris has to offer, at an affordable price!! Truly Superb

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Hotel! Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: redqueenofhearts
Reviews.Content: We had 4 rooms for the group. The rooms were all different and charming. The hotel was clean. Convienent. The people working there were very professional and helpful. We would stay again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Cute place in a fantastic location.”
Reviews.Author: Migatarosita
Reviews.Content: Very cute rooms and clean hotel. Nice and very helpful receptionists. Fantastic location near from Eiffel and beside Les Invalides. The only "but" was that we booked for taxi transfer from de Airport. The flight changed the timetable 2-3 weeks before and I told to the Hotel. They confirmed me by mail that was ok. Whe we arrived we called for the transfer and they told us that there were not place for us because the hotel did not gave the advice.... 45€ of taxi!! So... I recommend this hotel to everyone that can afford it but.... don´t stand by them for the airport transfer. Ignacio.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent in all regards!!”
Reviews.Author: Butterflysfriend
Reviews.Content: Lovely room, tasteful decor, very clean, large bath, quality furnishings, quite, good location, and the gracious staff is exceptional! Very nice neighborhood with easy and pleasent walking distance to EffelTower, Louve, Notre Dame, shopping, and dinning. My first trip out of the country, however, I worked in hotel and resterant trade in Colorado's skiing areas and have some insight and experience and I believe Hotel de la Maubourg is exceptional. My friend and I joined up in Paris, stayed two nights at a different Paris hotel, which I booked through a travel agency, before we continued on to Lisbon, then returned to Paris for two nights at Hotel Maubourg, which my companion had booked for us, she's an experienced traveler. The first hotel was OK, as far as clean rooms, however, their staff was haughty and did not follow through on my request for flowers in my freinds room, it was too complicated for them. Hotel Mauboug's staff is excellent, and just nice people, I would welcome any of them into my home, they certainly deserve the praise other reviewers have given them. I would recommend it to anyone, with the exception of those confined to a wheel chair, however, they may have better handicap facilities than I am aware of, you could discuss this with them and be confident of their honesty and helpfullness. The elevator is quite small, but not really needed.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem for a Paris Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GeordieFellow
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to Paris and we were not disappointed. The Hotel Latour Maubourg is a gem of a place to stay. It is centrally situated for all the main attractions many of which are within reasonable walking distance. Also, there is a Metro station just across the road. The hotel itself is in a fairly quiet spot, considering its city location. Traffic noise was not a problem. On our first night we had a pretty small room but we were immediately given a much larger room for our remaining 3 nights. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. All in all, no problems and would definitely recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: gr7361
Reviews.Content: We are a family of five and booked two rooms in this hotel for our Paris vacation. The hotel was everything that we expected. Prior to our trip we had extensive email contact with the staff. The staff arranged Christmas Day dinner for us at a local restaurant and were very responsive via email. After we arrived we found the staff were to always be pleasant and very helpful. On Christmas Eve, complimentary champagne was served to us ! Both hotel rooms were very clean. The rooms were large (rooms 11 and 31) and comfortable. There was free internet access in both rooms. The hotel location is directly accross the street from a Metro station and is an easy walk to an RER station for trips outside of Paris. The hotel location is not far from the Eiffel Tower and is within walking distance of the other major tourist sites such as the Louvre, Notre Dame, etc. I felt the neighborhood was safe and I felt comfortable exploring in the vicinity of the hotel at night. However, the strength of this hotel was in the friendly and helpful staff! I would heartily recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Paris.

Reviews.Title: “What a Gem ! from Staffordshire UK”
Reviews.Author: Englishtraveller65
Reviews.Content: Hotels such as this should be kept a closely guarded secret. We stayed for four nights during the first week in December on the recommendation of relatives who in turn had been influenced by Trip Advisor reports. This small Hotel is located in a quiet area and very close to a very unobtrusive Metro station which we used occasionally for trips to the Opera area. For our first view of the buildings fronting the Seine we booked through reception a sightseeing cruise and at 11 Euros for two was a good deal. It does seem that some of the best rates are often obtained using Hotel reception. We chose to walk to those major sights time allowed us to visit but there are of course many forms of alternative transport available from the Hotel, indeed there is a taxi rank near to the local Metro station. There are many restaurants and bars in the vicinity at a variety of prices, we took breakfast in the hotel which was provided at a cost of 15 Euros each down in the cosy and intimate converted cellar where the buffet selection and service were very good. The Hotel is a very old building and part of the charm are the creaks and groans accumulated over some two centuries. Do not expect clinical perfection. We booked a Superior room but on arrival were upgraded to a Delux, it was located on the ground floor facing the front and had, in its formative days been a reception room, large, spacious and magnificent. Bearing in mind the ground floor location it was so quiet and peaceful but this is one of the hotel strengths, the other being the helpful and genuinely friendly nature of all the staff. Whilst in Paris we wanted to see a Show and our selection was the Folies Bergeres to see Cabaret and Reception after much effort booked two balcony tickets on a two for the price of one deal at 54 Euros far better than that obtainable on the Web.So thanks for all the help and advice, for making our stay so pleasurable and for such a memorable visit (inspite of the rain) - AU REVOIR

Reviews.Title: “Overall, fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: EnglandMaximus
Reviews.Content: Me and my sister booked a stay at this hotel as part of a Paris break, I have stayed in Paris many times and it is the best hotel I have stayed in over there, The staff were excellant and couldnt do enough for you, we got up-graded to a superior room from a classic, The hotel is spotless and the decor is authentic and modern all in one !!! It is centrally located with a metro right outside the front door and the Eiffel tower just a ten minuite walk away. The breakfast was nice and as always in the basement of the hotel. There are many restaurants within walking distance and a taxi rank just outside the hotel. If and when I return to Paris, I will DEFINATLY be returning to this hotel, Thanks to the staff for a pleasant stay xx

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Redwoo
Reviews.Content: I stay in Paris 3-4 times per year, so far always in a different hotel. I will come back to Hotel de La Tour Maubourg. The rooms are a bit larger than I am use to, the shower has ample room, the room has individual climate control, there is free internet and wireless, the phone service is inexpensive, the Metro is just outside the door, and the neighborhood is quiet. Every person I met who worked here was wonderful and friendly. Check in and check out was easy, efficient and accurate. The hammam was an interesting and relaxing experience. The roses and newspapers were nice, thoughtful touches. I think "thoughtful touches" could sum up my experience: The decor is fascinating, with charming details, both small and large, in every direction you look. I enjoyed the bathrobe and slippers. The bed spread, throws, wraps and pillows were tastefully arranged and interesting enough that I needed to take a picture of my room to bring back and share with my family and friends. This hotel is a gem!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: John402
Reviews.Content: We have just come back from a lovely stay in Paris every thing about this hotel is wonderful. The staff look after you superbly, thank you Caroline for your help on reception. Our room (number 23) was perfect and very, very clean. Thank you again for a wonderful stay, just one problem it is was not long enough!!!!! hope to see you again soon Hazel and John

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in good location”
Reviews.Author: northernscientist
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my 40th birthday, based on Tripadvisor info. It was really excellent, especially the location. Around 10 min stroll to the Seine, and the area of Les Invalides has a great atmosphere. Thanks to the train driver strike, the public transport by Metro was limited (pity as the Metro stop is only 1 min walk away!), but from here it was very easy to walk everywhere we wanted to go, including Musee D'Orsay, Louvre etc. There are lots of lovely little touches (like bathrobe & slippers!) that I've not seen in so-called 'upmarket' hotels. On arrival, we were upgraded, and the room (bed all in red, gold & black with loads of cushions) was very cosy. Loved the fluffy chandelier! The staff all spoke excellent English and were always ready to help us, and the young man on night duty was particularly friendly and helpful, suggesting ideas for sightseeing. Breakfast was really nice too, much better quality than some other 'Continental' breakfasts we've had. Excellent value, and highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel in Paris”
Reviews.Author: jps79
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel via TripAdvisor, thankfully. I've been to Paris many times for leisure and to aimlessly wander around. I've stayed at a lot of hotels there, usually the big names, Hilton, Mercure, California Hotel, etc. After staying at La Tour Maubourg, I will ONLY stay here when I return to Paris in the future. First and foremost, the staff is beyond wonderful. During the day, Roberta and Caroline start your day off with the most vibrant smile and enthusiasm...they offer suggestions for your day and are very eager to help with any questions. I was in Paris for a few days en route to go home to Texas, after being away for a year in Afghanistan. After my 3 day laziness in Paris, I checked out of the hotel and arrived at CDG airport to find out Air France had gone on strike. Being said, I only had a week to be at home before returning back to work, and being stranded at CDG is no pleasant experience, I know many can vouche for that, and my time was limited. Especially when there is a strike. Anyhow, I notified the La Tour Maubourg and they immediately invited me back and told me my room was waiting for me and if there is anything they could do to help, then please let them know. I hoppped in a cab and returned to this lovely hotel. The girls were genuinely concerned for my troubles and did their best to figure something out and suggest other options. A long story short, it worked out well, I made it home and I cannot wait to stay at this hotel again. I usually day dream about Paris and the sights, now I just think about this cozy little hotel. So, to give you some basic info, which has already been given time and time again on this site, and they are all correct.....the hotel is clean and cozy. Yes, rooms are small, but this is Paris...I thought my room was perfect. Plenty of room, cool atmosphere and decor, CLIMATE CONTROLLED ROOM -TO YOUR DISCRETION, of course the free internet, perfect location, etc etc. I'm telling you, this is my favorite hotel I've stayed anywhere in the world. I consider myself well traveled and this hotel has a special touch that no other has. The staff is amazing, the rooms are clean and continuously looked after, the location is in a weird way perfectly centralized away from crazy traffic and passer bys. I can go on and on. I really enjoyed my stay there, and cannot wait to return. It truly is a gem of a hotel in Paris. As I said, I've stayed at the big name hotels just to have the big room and little things we are use to, to only come up spending entirely way too much money and complaining about a few things when the hotel came up short...every single time. This hotel covers all points a hotel should cover, a rarity in Paris, or Europe for that matter. It's all here. Also, when Roberta and Caroline leave, Sandra takes over and is moving a 100 miles an hour doing what she can to please the guests. I probably had more correspondence with her via telephone, and she blew me away with her natural hospitable manner and enthusiastic attitude. I recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Paris. You actually feel as if you are living in Paris staying here, something I think we all eventually feel one time or another while here, unlike the giant white rooms I use to seek for 'guaranteed' comfort at the others. Don't waste your time with those. Come to this hotel, I promise, you will leave with the same impression I had, or at least I hope you will. Merci Au Revoir.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: saune
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay in this charming hotel very much. The Hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. Our room was small, but very comfortable and very clean. The location was superb, across the street from the metro and next door to a great place for breakfast. We will retiurn.

Reviews.Title: “Very kind staff - hotel could be better!”
Reviews.Author: Antheia
Reviews.Content: Let me just express a few things before I dive into my review. This is my fourth European trip this year. I also travel extensively within the U.S. as well. I do not always provide reviews for every hotel I visit. I consider myself to be a fair ciritic. And I am a hopeless romantic. So, when I read "how romantic" this hotel was, I seleted this hotel. Also, the hotel website is beautiful coupled with the favorable reviews from Tripadvisor, I booked this hotel! I stayed for 2 of the originally reserved 6 nights. The staff were excellent, Sanda & Roberta you are both so kind. The location is great if you want to be somewhat removed from the action, but close to the metro. With that being said, the moment I pulled up to the hotel in the taxi, I was immediately taken aback. The hotel webite is not a true representation of this hotel. Once inside, the moment I entered, I realized the decor was gaudy. On the reception desk was a large arrangement of plastic and silk flowers with florescent colored butterflies. As I browsed the reception area I found the florescent color theme throughout the hotel. Tasteless decor. There are bright colors everywhere. The furniture was in the same color scheme. This is not my idea of classy or romantic. It is quite a shame since, this hotel has the potential to be very elegant and beautiful. It has old charm, a winding staircase and a beautiful entrance foyer. This type of old victorian elegance should be accentuated with complimentary decor, not bright florescent color schemes. Clash, I just didn't care at all for the decor at this hotel! As another reviewer described below, "shabby, chic." Once I entered the room it was very dark and as one other reviewer mentioned, noisy. This is due to the open staircase, this didn't bother me, but if you need complete silence to sleep, you may want to ask for an inside room. The bathroom (my utmost pet peeve) not to my standards. I am not expecting the Ritz or Four Seasons for this price, but I like simple, white, clean! Here is the worst feature of this hotel, the towels were very hard. I thought they were the floor mats for the bathroom. I could not wipe my face with them. In addition, I like white sheets on the beds not blue or green sheets. I like white sheets of a medium quality. I asked for softer towels but the replacements were hard as well. Thus, I always travel with one towel and a small pillow. Just to be on the safe side, as I mentioned I travel quite a bit. I moved hotels and to my delight for the same price 160E, I was able to get a bright room with simple decor and a great bathroom with softer towels!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel but tiny room”
Reviews.Author: Hounslea
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Hotel de La Tour Maubourg for 5 nights with my 16 year old daughter. It was our first time in Paris and we wanted to see all the sights and have lunch at the top of the Eiffel Tower. Sandra on reception was extremely helpful and when I emailed before our visit she tried to get us a booking but due to the fact that Paris was still very busy she couldn’t get a direct booking. She did however find a coach company, Cityrama, that did packages and we decided on one to have dinner at the Eiffel Tower, have a boat trip by night on the Seine and finish off with the last show at the Moulin Rouge. This was a fantastic night out and although we were very tired when we got back it was well worth the money. The hotel is ideally situated just next to the metro and we managed to see lots of Paris in 4 days. There are some wonderful restaurants nearby and if you want to have a special meal I could recommend Petrossian – which is a caviar restaurant or Il Vino – where you choose your wine before you choose your food. All in all this was an excellent hotel in the right location but our room was so tiny we couldn’t unpack our suitcases.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond expectations!!!!”
Reviews.Author: hadley311
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for two nights last week. I have to say it was perfection!!! The room was ready by 11am (the time we arrived from London). It was a large room and beautifully decorated! All of the staff spoke English and were very friendly! I forgot my converter for my camera charger and they had an American one that they lent me. The steam bath (complimentary) was a treat!! The Invalides is literally around the block and the metro was across the street. Great cafes surround the property. The Eiffel Tower is a beautiful (and short) walk away. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!! They also have a computer downstairs with internet access. On our last day, they kept our luggage so we could spend the afternoon touring. I could not imagine a better place to spend our short time in Paris.

Reviews.Title: “Great option if you wish to stay in the 7th arr. / Invalides area”
Reviews.Author: Mossmania
Reviews.Content: If you wish to stay on the left bank, say, in St Germain, and you are seeking a boutique hotel with charm in a mid price range (180-250 Euros), the Latour Maubourg is an excellent alternative. If you want to be in the 7th arr., this hotel is perfect. The hotel is close to the border of the 7th arr. and the 6th arr. (St Germain). You can walk to the heart of St Germain/Latin Quarter in 20 mins. Also, it's not far from the Eiffel Tower / Champs Elysee. The metro station is right at the hotel. A short Taxi or metro ride to Louvre, Marais etc...If for some reason you love Les Invalides, the hotel is 3 mins away. Neighbourhood: around the hotel is a wealthy, residential area. Not as exciting as the touristy parts of Paris, but more authentic and low-key, and a great area to return home to at the end of a day. The people in the cafes beside you are usually locals. There's a nice pedestrian-only street wih good restaurants and shops called Rue de Cler 5 mins away by foot. Hotel: this is a very attractive boutique hotel, and the staff are friendly, helpful, and have a genuine interest in providing solid service, without being too chatty or over the top. Some rooms are small, others larger, the more you pay the more you get. ASK FOR EXTRA PILLOWS as the ones they give you are tiny. Free internet service and access to a doctor if you need one (I did, not free!). I paid about 40 Euros more per night at this hotel than I did for a two star Latin Quarter hotel last year, and it was worth it. You get attractive rooms and the personal touch.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, wonderful staff but room smallest ever!!!”
Reviews.Author: The-C-Girl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here October 17th-20th. I had emailed the hotel beforehand to request a nice room as it was my boyfriend's 30th. However on check in I discovered it was the smallest room I have ever stayed in, that includes New York and London hotels! I think it was a similar size to my bedroom in university halls. There was no real wardrobe, only a rail with curtains over it and hardly any space around the bed to unpack/exist. I was so disappointed and furthermore the people above us were noisy. I requested to be moved. Unfortunately we were unable to do so until the next day. Not wanting to waste our time in Paris waiting to move rooms we went out the following morning and we missed our window to move rooms although the hotel were v helpful and said we could move the next day. But the next day meant that we that we only had one night left so we did not move, it just did not seem worth it. The staff members at the hotel were very helpful, accommodating and very friendly and I can't fault the location at all. The location was really great, really near to the sights and fortunately (due to the metro strike) we could walk everywhere. My advice would be make sure you are not going to get a box room before you arrive as despite the fact you won't be in your room much its very hard to live in a space that small.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous boutique hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: travel_loverSydney
Reviews.Content: Thoroughly recommend this hotel. The staff were extremely friendly and helpful. Location was fabulous with the metro across the road, restaurants almost on your doorstep and walking distance to a lot of the sites. Breakfast is served in the basement which must have been a cellar (very cute), it's a typical Continental Breakfast but you can get a cheaper breakfast next door. Lovely rooms, very quaint recently renovated. Sydney, Australia

Reviews.Title: “A real treat”
Reviews.Author: alwoh
Reviews.Content: We were delighted with our stay. Attractive, very clean, and the front desk was consistently staffed with kind, friendly, helpful folks who all had a working knowledge of English. The location was excellent for walking to many of the sights. We would stay there again and heartily recommend this hotel to others who visit.

Reviews.Title: “Warm welcome, great location, very helpful friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: smidster
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel from recommendations on this website – so we thought it only right to report back! This is a great little hotel between the Eiffel tower and Saint-Germain des Prés - within walking distance of most of the tourist sites. It has the Metro stop with the same name right across street in a nice little park if you are not into walking. In fact, apart from our Metro journey to and from Gare du Nord we did all our sight-seeing by foot. The room was small yet delightfully presented and immaculately clean. We were on the second floor (there is an elevator) and faced the park across the street. The bathroom was well presented with a bath as well as shower and hairdryer. The room had a safe, desk, flat screen TV and a strong (free) Wi-Fi Internet connection. The hotel staff were excellent. They are well informed, professional and extremely helpful with arrangements, directions, and good suggestions for sightseeing, food and transportation. I’m normally quite fussy about hotels however I would have no hesitation in returning or recommending Hotel de La Tour Maubourg.

Reviews.Title: “C & K Australia”
Reviews.Author: OzOverseas
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in an excellent location close to all sights, the staff were excellent and helpful, especially the receptionist. She gave good advice on restaurants and shopping locations (unfortunately). The hotel had great character and we would not hesitate in staying there again in the future.

Reviews.Title: “We loved staying here! Metro across the road!”
Reviews.Author: Kerise7
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were very pleased with this hotel. It was centrally located, has great bistros all around it, had a metro stop directly across the road which was a huge plus and the staff were marvellous!!!!! The room was cute and spacious enough for our needs. I felt we were well served by this hotel and would recommend it to my family and friends. Kerry, Ontario,Canada

Reviews.Title: “good location not so good room”
Reviews.Author: CherryGrower
Reviews.Content: Great location, good staff, very helpful. The hote is clean and nice. However, we were placed in room 24, if offered this room change due to the elevator and the proximity of the bathroom of the adjoining room. You could hear the neighbour peeing at 2 am. I am sure the other floor has a room in the same position. Again staff were great and the location is good. Paris is expensive as is this hotel while its a good price compared with everythig else in the city.

Reviews.Title: “The Perfect Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: donnacarla
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in Paris twice before and i found the hotel Latour Maubourg a perfect contrast to the large, faceless hotels i had stayed in previously. Our room was lovely and the whole hotel was maintained to a high standard,but best of all were the staff who really went out of their way to make our stay special. I must also mention Sandra who is possibly the nicest hotel receptionist I have ever met ! Thank you for a wonderful holiday!!

Reviews.Title: “Warm and welcoming in a great location”
Reviews.Author: NE1ontheroad
Reviews.Content: We arrived late and tired due to changed flights and an unscheduled stop, but the staff was welcoming and our room was spacious and beautifully decorated. The hotel staff is excellent. They are well informed, professional, and extremely thoughtful. They helped us with arrangements, directions, and good suggestions for sightseeing and transportation. Our stay was expensive, but that was due to the unfavorable exchange rate rather than the hotel being overpriced for what and where it is. For its central location, proximity to the metro system, walking distance to major sites and the generous size and charming decoration of our deluxe room room, we thought the price was reasonable and fair. All in all, we had a wonderful stay, and were quite happy with our choice of hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: WorldTravelers003
Reviews.Content: I agree that the staff is friendly and helpful and the hotel location is excellent, but I was overall very disappointed with the hotel for the price. The rate was far more than we wanted to spend, but since this is our first trip to Paris and the hotel got such great reviews and ratings, we decided to splurge. We were terribly disappointed. We were booked in a room with no shower and a rock hard bed. We asked to change rooms, which they did the next day. The room was a significant improvement but still not worth the money. At this price, I was hoping for some old world elegance but it is more accurately described as shabby chic. The floors squeak, conversations and clinking breakfast dishes can be heard through the walls and floors, and the traffic noise would be unbearable if the windows were opened. Due to the excellent location, it would have been a great deal at half the price.

Reviews.Title: “A charming hotel in the heart of Paris!”
Reviews.Author: grknurse1982
Reviews.Content: Bon Jour, we just returned from a fabulous stay at this wonderfully romantic hotel. We booked our trip in June after reading previous reviews of the hotel. Upon arrival we were greeted by Caroline, who turned out to be a great trip planner. She provided us with wonderful choices for dinner, day trips and evening outings. Actually the entire staff should be complimented on making us feel so welcome. Our room was #21 and overlooked the Rue de Grenelle and the park. Noise was not an issue except when the cleaning staff began their work in the morning. The breakfast although pricey was fresh and delicious. We ended up eating there on the day of our departure. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone that would like a more intimate, romantic time in Paris. We loved it so much, we're planning on returning next year! Au Revoir!

Reviews.Title: “A Parisian Gem”
Reviews.Author: theligerandligress
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in an excellent location and from the offset it was clear that this was going to be a special place to stay. Our plane was terribly delayed but on arrival we were made to feel very welcome and as important as any other guest; despite being 5 hours late! Our room was compact and bijou with some lovely touches such as a rose (you get to choose the colour) in our bathroom and some fabulous furniture. The bed was extremely comfortable which was vital after a day of ambling round the streets of Paris. The hotel is situated in between the Eiffel Tower and Les Hotel Des Invalides. You would think that this would make the area noisy but it was quite the opposite. Nearby were some lovely little shops and cafés to sit in or browse and excellent for people watching. The hotel rates were brilliant and very, very reasonable, especially for the standard of hotel. The manager and the other girls were very insightful and really helpful, giving us great advice on where to eat and what to visit. Just outside the hotel is a metro stop so it is easy to get around the rest of Paris, though because of the location we tended to walk everywhere. If you do choose to stay here (and we strongly suggest you do) then you should try the restaurant called 'Pasco' which is on the boulevard de la tour-maubourg (the main street next to the hotel) - it was amazing, the food was really good and the service equally - especially since one of us was vegetarian an unknown concept in Paris! We'll definitely be staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “A return visit to this hotel a must - a great find!”
Reviews.Author: wilkie13
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this great hotel for 4 nights in early September with our daughters. The rooms were immaculately clean. Staff courteous and helpful. They were very welcoming. Location was superb being very near Invalides and Eiffel Tower. Metro opposite the Hotel. Will definitely stay at this hotel next time we visit Paris. We could not have asked for more!

Reviews.Title: “A charming Parisian Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Emcgsy
Reviews.Content: Delightful hotel in an excellent situation. Staff welcoming and helpful. Lovely , well equipped room with air conditioning. Although overlooking a fairly busy road, the soundproofing in the room was excellent. Great breakfast for 15 euros. Lovely walk in the evening within minutes of the hotel with Les Invalides beautifully illuminated and a great view of the Eiffel Tower.

Reviews.Title: “The Charm of the Latour Maubourg”
Reviews.Author: sanmyn
Reviews.Content: This hotel was suggested by my sister who had stayed there four years ago. I spent a week in Paris, one in Italy and one in the mountains at L'Aquila. Of the three hotels, all of which were delightful, Latour Maubourg was the best and most memorable. The three level last century building was completely gutted and remodeled one year ago. An elevator was added and each room totally upgraded but still holding the charm of the past. My room on the third floor faced the park across the street and I opened the long windows for a nice breeze despite the excellent air conditioning. Room #23 was small yet delightful with shades of gold and brown, a little purple, and was well thought out. The new white bathroom has a long and deep bathtub, a room safe, a desk, and best of all a strong WiFi Internet conneciton. There is a intimate rear courtyard, a downstairs dining room and a small but smart lobby. For getting around Paris, the metro station is in the park square across the street and the neighborhood is full of excellent well priced restaurants. Walking toward the Eiffel Tower, there are many hideaway bistros and brasseries and several irresistable pastry shops. For more into, you can email me at: sanmyn@aol.com Hope you enjoy the "Maubourg" as much as I did. Gary H.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Quaint Hotel”
Reviews.Author: loan030778
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from Paris and stayed at Latour Maubourg Hotel for our 4th Wedding Anniversary. The Hotel is very Quaint and in a ideal location, 10 minutes walk from The Eiffel Tower and just round the corner from Invalides. Many restaurants located near the hotel and the Metro is just opposite the hotel, so easy access. Hotel was very Clean and the staff were very polite and helpful. Free access to internet for hotel guest which was very useful when you wanted to look for information about Paris. Our room was very spacious as we stayed in a Superior room and had the pleasure of having a old fashion free standing bath in our room. Would definately return to the hotel, Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “great location-friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: JF26
Reviews.Content: My adult daughter and I stayed at this hotel and had an excellent experience on our first trip to Paris. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful at all times. The location was close to everything; the first thing to be seen walking out of the front door was the Eiffel Tower to put right and Hotel Des Invalides and Napoleons's Tomb to the left. Le Pont Neuf is only a short walk from the hotel, and the Metro is right across the street-easy access to all Paris has to offer. I would highly recommend this hotel to travelers. GF & JF Vancouver BC, Canada.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location for Good Price”
Reviews.Author: FlyingGeese
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel de Latour Maubourg this past September (2006). We were both pleasantly surprised. We had booked the junior suite and found that it was considerably larger than most rooms we had gotten in other European cities. The bathroom was also quite large, if oddly laid out. The bathtub was smack dab in the middle of the room and you had to walk around it to get to the other sink and the shower. Also, the toilet was in a seperate little room, on the other side of the room, i e, NOT in the bathroom. Not a big deal, but you did have to think about it when you got up in the middle of the night. The linens were very good quality and the staff was very helpful. The elevator quit working the second day we were there and couldn't be fixed, so we hiked up and down three flights of stairs. No problem for us, but I thought I'd mention it. They have a little place in the basement where you can get coffee and pastries in the morning. The hotel, I think, is in a good location. Sort of in the middle of things (just a few hundred yards from the Invalides), yet still having the feel of being in a residential, and quiet, area. Will probably stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, Great people, beautiful rooms”
Reviews.Author: AndreaVancouver
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Hotel Latour Maubourg for 4 nights in May, and had a fantastic visit. The room was very large - by most standards, and especially by Paris standards. We had room #1 which we were told was their largest room. Bathroom was a bit small, but shower was great size & really nice - fixtures & fittings completely updated and gorgeous. Decor was spectacular - very parisien. 2 desks, plenty of room for luggage, a lounge settee, a laptop already setup for us and ready with internet access. 2 big closets, extra blankets in the room. beautiful wood floors, big huge windows with gorgeous drapes, HIGH ceilings with original spectacular mouldings, colourful crystal antique chandelier. whole hotel is decorated beautifully - really takes you back in history. I read 1 or 2 reviews that spoke of rude people at this hotel, but I can't imagine who they were referring to! There was always someone at the front desk from morning til late evening who was helpful and very very friendly and so helpful. Great english, although we tried our best to speak French! At night there was someone at the desk that was more of a security person - English wasn't as good, but he was very polite and courteous. If I could have one very small complaint, it would be that our room #1 was situated right at the front door/entrance and was a little noisy at times. BUT it was only "people/talking" noise and was only during regular daytime hours. Nighttime was spectacularly quiet in the hotel and the neighbourhood. Probably would have preferred to be on 2nd or 3rd floors, not ground level. Location is spectacular. when we returned to paris a couple of weeks later, we stayed over by the Louvre/Champs Elysees - no comparison. The location of the Hotel Latour Maubourg is MUCH better. close to everything, lots of brasseries and local shops... walking distance to all the tourist hotspots, and a metro stop about 50m away. We walked everywhere from this location. When we stayed in the other hotel near Louvre, we also walked, but had to fight the throngs of tourists, buses, and tourist trap stores. The Invalides area is just a completely different feel, yet arguably more central. Wouldn't hesitate to stay in this hotel again. We heard of other hotels that were cheaper in the same neighbourhood... but can't imagine that they would have had the same feel of luxury and history as this hotel. Is this hotel pricey? yup! but we did not feel cheated.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, Wonderful Staff”
Reviews.Author: rapidrabbit
Reviews.Content: We found the location to be excellent for touring all the main Parisian features a tourist would want to see. Metro access was unbelievably great - across the street! Our only concern was the lack of secondary first escape. Only one way in and one way out of the rooms. We could not see any fire suppression (Spriniklers), but they may have been installed and hidden. We are former airline employees, and have stayed in 100's of hotels all over the world. One of the things we are always aware of is fire danger - so we have heightened awareness. Otherwise, we found the hotel to be charming, the decor was very beautiful and the hotel was extremely clean and nice. The staff was was very helpful, considerate and so kind.

Reviews.Title: “7th (arrondissement) heaven”
Reviews.Author: rottmom
Reviews.Content: A friend and I stayed here last month and have nothing but good things to say about it. We each booked a single room that, while small (as are most Paris hotel rooms), was spotlessly clean, well furnished (incl. terry bathrobe), ideally located (views of Invalides dome from front rooms and metro right across the street on excellent line). Other reviewers have made somewhat negative remarks about the lady owner but we found her very pleasant and welcoming (she even brought her dog over the day we were leaving after learning I missed my own dog). The reception staff (Roberta and Sandra) were incredibly helpful and patient with even the most silly guest (ex: guests who knew they had a reservation at one of a famous chef's restaurants but couldn't remember either the name or the street and the taxi was waiting to take them there). Very quiet and lots of really good, well-priced restaurants within walking distance. My friend has made over 30 trips to Paris, stayed in countless hotels, and declared this to be the hotel he will use from now on, and I endorse that declaration.

HotelInfo.Name: Hotel de Latour Maubourg
HotelInfo.Address: 150 rue de Grenelle | 07 Arr., 75007 Paris, France
